Es la primera vez que Nely tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una persona muy solidaria, valor que comparte con los miembros de su banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando es para invertir en la compra de telas e hilos  que son los materiales básicos para la elaboración de sus bordados. En promedio cada rollo de hilo está valorizado en 100 soles, ella comprará 2 conos y con los 300 restantes adquirirá la tela, esto hará que mejore la calidad y producción de sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Nely is 43 years old, she lives in her own home with her 4 children. She has embroidered for the last 20 years. She began this work from an early age and was taught by her mother, and continues to produce beautiful work everyday in her home. Once she completes pieces, she sells them to establishments that sell or rent traditional clothing. Nely is dedicated to this work because it is very profitable, since her embroidery is often highly valued, and earns the profits necessary to cover the costs of her household. This is the first time Nely has a loan with MFP, she is a very supportive person, a value she shares with members of her community bank. The money she is requesting is to invest in the purchase of fabrics and thread which are the basic materials used to embroider. On average, each roll of thread is valued at 100 soles, she will buy 2 rolls and with the remaining 300 she will buy the fabric, this will help her improve the quality and production of her work.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for embroidery

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua la señora Rosa L. con gran dedicación se desempeña en su actividad de venta de ropa comercializada todos los días con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.

Es de suma importancia destacar que hoy en día ella con mucha esperanza acudió a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la ropa para comercializarla y por esto espera ser aprobada para continuar de esta manera con su actividad en el mercado
texts.en:
In the wholesale market of the city of Managua, Rosa L. sells clothing with great dedication and the purpose to bring money home. It is very important to indicate that she was very hopeful when she approached Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase clothes for sale and hopes to be approved for the loan and this way continue with her activity at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Josue Fernando

texts.es: Don Josué Fernando T. A. con residencia en el paraje Chuijuchanep del Canton Juchanep de Totonicapán, ha ocho kilometros del departamento de Totonicapan, su actividad principal, es la carpinteria  el desde niño aprendio el arte como operario en el trancurso del tiempo fue el creciendo y decidio hacer su propio negocio la cual dia a dia fue creciendo, decidio casarse y su esposa tenia el mismo arte. Conjuntamente decidieron  vender sus productos en otros municipios del pais de Guatemala, hoy necesita un credito para fortalecer el negocio en la compra de herramientas mas tecnificada, cierras electrica, sepilladora electrica y otros que lo utilizan para tallar el producto, don Josue por sus conocimientos adquiridos en la carpinteria lo trasmite a los jovenes en aprender algun arte, como al el le enseñaron.
texts.en:
Mr. Josue Fernando T. A. resides in the area of Chuijuchanep in the region of Juchanep Totonicapán, eight kilometers from the state of Totonicapan. His work is carpentry since he was a child he learned the art of an operator. Throughout the course of time he grew and decided to start his own business, which grew day by day. He decided to marry and his wife also practiced the same art form. Together they decided to sell their products in other municipalities in the country of Guatemala, now he needs a loan to strengthen the business by purchasing more advanced tools such as electric saws and sanders, and others tools used to carve the product. Josue imparts his carpentry skills to the young so they learn an art form such as the one he was taught.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Sheyla

texts.es: Sheyla tiene 26 años y vive  con su pareja en una casa arrendada. Ella trabaja elaborando diseños a computadora para avisos publicitarios en su negocio, los cuales elabora al gusto de sus clientes, quienes cada vez son más. Ella se preparó estudiando los programas de computadora utilizados para el diseño gráfico y poder realizar ese tipo de trabajos que incluyen mucha creatividad y novedad. El gran sueño de Sheyla es ser una de las mejores diseñadoras gráficas de su zona y también invertir en nuevas oportunidades para su negocio, es decir incursionar en otro tipo de negocios como en la venta de otros productos, como comestibles y venderlos a sus vecinos y amistades para generase mayores ingresos. Es la primera oportunidad de Sheyla en solicitar un préstamo dentro de MFP, y asume un compromiso de ser una de las integrantes más activas y responsables de su grupo. Es dinero que requiere es para invertir en la compra de mercadería para su nuevo negocio, así como en capacitarse en un curso rápido de diseño gráfico que será cubierto por el monto que ella está solicitando.
texts.en:
Sheyla is 26 years old and lives with her partner in a rented house. She works to create graphic design's used for advertising in her business, which she develops based on the tastes of her customers who are increasing. She studied the computer software used for graphic design, so she could accomplish this type of work that includes a lot of creativity and innovation. Sheyla’s great dream is to be one of the best graphic designers in her area and invest in new business opportunities. She would like to venture into other businesses such as selling other products such as groceries by selling them to neighbors and friends and generating more income. This is Sheyla’s first opportunity to apply for a loan with MFP, and she is committed to being one of the most active and responsible members of her group. The money she requests is to invest in buying merchandise for her new business, as well as to take another training course in graphic design.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for a course to improve her business and invest in a new one

loans.name: Viviano

texts.es: Viviano tiene 40 años y vive  con su esposa e hija en su casa propia. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde su niñez ya que proviene de una familia de agricultores, aprovechando esta herencia de vida para generar los ingresos que ahora son el sostén de su familia. Como jefe de hogar trabaja arduamente en  el cultivo de sus tierras para lo cual sale muy temprano a cuidar sus extensiones de terrenos; la época de cosecha es de mucha alegría, ya que ve producir sus campos es gratificante, aunque Viviano sabe que en varias oportunidades las condiciones climáticas pueden tener resultados negativos en ellas. Lo que más siembra es papa y una vez realizada la cosecha la selecciona por calidades a la cual denomina papa de primera (las más grandes y sin daños) y de segunda (las que son pequeñas y tienen algunos daños), llevando su producción a venderla a los mercados mayoristas por sacos, variando sus precios según la calidad. Esta es la primera ocasión que Viviano solicita un préstamo con MFP, él  tiene toda la disposición de ser responsable y colaborador en su banco comunal. El dinero que requiere es para la compra de fertilizantes para sus tierras de cultivo e incrementar la cantidad de animales que posee para vender.
texts.en:
Viviano is 40 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in their own home. Since his childhood, he has been involved in agriculture and comes from a family of farmers, taking advantage of this legacy to generate income to support his family. As head of household he works hard at cultivating his land and wakes up very early to tend to his plots of land; the harvest season is a very happy time because watching the production of his fields is rewarding, but Viviano knows that the weather can have negative results on his harvest. What he grows most is potatoes and after the harvest he selects the potatoes based on quality, the first and largest batch (the biggest and undamaged) and the second batch (smaller and have some damage). He takes the produce to sell at wholesale markets by the sack, varying in price according to quality. This is Viviano’s first time applying for a loan with MFP, he is fully prepared to be responsible and contribute to his community bank. The money he requests is to buy fertilizer for his land and increase the number of farms animals to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and farms animals

loans.name: Zenon

texts.es: Zenón tiene 20 años y vive en la casa de sus padres. Es un joven que trabajó desde muy temprana edad para adquirir sus propios bienes y superarse, hace 6 meses decidió implementar una granja de cuyes de raza para poder criarlos y venderlos en las ferias ganaderas, así como para situaciones donde haya demanda, como para grandes banquetes o evento especiales. Es por ello que el sueño de Zenón es ser un empresario de la producción de cuyes, la cual sea el sostén fundamental de su familia, y como muestra de su arduo trabajo, todos los días realiza el cuidado de su granja; en las mañanas corta el pasto, lo almacena, les da de comer a sus cuyes y por la tarde limpia su granja. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está con todos los deseos y disposición de emprender  un trabajo solidario como un integrante más de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita será invertirlo en la compra de más cuyes de raza y también en ampliar la extensión de su granja, para lo cual comprará maderas y mallas metálicas todo esto será cubierto por el monto del préstamo.
texts.en:
Zenón is 20 years old and lives with his parents. He is a young man who began working from an early age to acquire his own assets and to improve himself. Six months ago he decided to start his own farm, breeding guinea pigs in order to raise and sell them at livestock fairs, and for occasions where there is demand such as large banquets or special events. It is Zenón’s dream to become a businessman and breeder of guinea pigs, which will be his family’s source of support. He works hard every day to care for his farm. In the mornings he cuts the grass, stores it, feeds the guinea pigs, and in the evening cleans the farm. This is the first time he requests a loan with MFP, and with desire and willingness he will work as one more supportive member of his community bank. The money requested will be invested in the purchase of more guinea pigs and also to expand the size of his farm; he will buy wood and wire mesh which will all be covered by the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number of guinea pigs and expand his farm

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es: Zoraida tiene 40 años y vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a trabajar y por eso es algo vital y muy necesario en su vida, es así que hoy en día se dedica al bordado y también al comercio de ropas interiores. Desde hace muchos años atrás su trabajo consiste en bordar fustanes, los cuales tiene como pedido. Esta actividad normalmente la efectúa en su casa de lunes a viernes, ya que los fines de semana  se va a las ferias comerciales para vender de manera ambulatoria ropas interiores; en estas épocas el negocio no es muy rentable, pero en época escolar es donde ella tiene mayores entradas económicas. El gran anhelo de Zoraida es poder establecerse en un puesto de ventas. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, está muy animada para trabajar en equipo y formar este nuevo banco comunal, con personas que ella considera que son de confianza. Con el dinero que está solicitando, una parte la usará para el pago de los trámites de su puesto, y con el resto comprará material para sus bordados y más prendas de vestir para vender.
texts.en:
Zoraida is 40 and lives with her husband and three children. Working has been a necessity and part of her life since childhood, and nowadays she works in the embroidery and sale of intimate clothing. For many years her work has consisted of doing needlework on intimate clothing , which are made to order. She usually performs this activity at home from Monday to Friday, and on weekends goes to commercial marketplaces to sell her merchandise; at this time of year business is not very good, but during school season is when she has the most cash inflows. Zoraida’s big dream is to have a sales location. This is the first time she requests a loan from MFP, she is very optimistic about working with a team to form a community bank, with people that she considers trustworthy. With part of the money requested, she will pay for the procedures to set up the new location and with the remainder she will buy material for embroidery and pieces of clothing to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Set up a local store and buy materials for embroidery

loans.name: Balvino  Ramiro

texts.es: El Señor Balvino Ramiro A. P. es originario del Paraje Coxomo del Canton Patzarajmac del departamento de Totonicapán se encuentra ha seis kilometros de la ciudad, el necesita un credito para surtir de mercaderia para incrementar su negocio que es la venta de articulo de consumo diario y con la colaboracion de su esposa, que esta bajo su responsabilidad de atender a los clientes, don Balvino para vender su producto al precio mas bajo su productos son comprados en la ciudad de Quetzaltengo por mayor y con los provedores de los productos compra vastante.Y ademas se su tienda tiene un su molino de Nixtamal,y que las persona busca su negocio  por el horario que tiene de atencion a las persona de sies de la mañana hasta la seis de la tarde y por cualquiera ocacion los puede atendera hasta de noche.
texts.en:
Balvino Ramiro A. P. is from Coxomo of the Patzarajmac canton in the Totonicapán department of Guatemala. He is located 6 kilometers from the city. He needs a loan to stock his store with merchandise to grow his business. He sells daily household consumables with the help of his wife, who is responsible for attending to the customers. In order to sell his products at the lowest price, Don Balvino purchases most of his goods in large quantities from suppliers in the city of Quetzaltengo. Also, he owns a nixtamal mill in his store and he is looking for a person to work the mill from six in the morning to six in the afternoon, occasionally working until the evening.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of daily consumables

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en una casa arrendada. Se dedica a los tejidos desde hace 3 años, su decisión por tener un trabajo independiente fue lo que la impulsó a tener un negocio propio, antes trabajaba de manera dependiente como empleada doméstica y la dueña de la casa donde trabajaba le enseñó a tejer todos los puntos, fue un aprendizaje que hoy le sirve para producir en grandes cantidades chalinas y gorros, así como bolsos y carteras. Cada 2 semanas termina de tejer lo que va a vender y luego viaja a los asientos mineros para comercializar sus prendas, a parte de ello también se dedica a la venta de animales los fines de semana, por esto guarda sus animales en casa de sus suegros. Marlene quiere superarse y está pensando en abrir una tienda grande donde pueda comercializar todo tipo de productos entre ellos sus tejidos y a la vez ofrecer el servicio de locutorio porque ha notado que en la zona donde vive  existe esa necesidad. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, además le gusta trabajar en el banco comunal que actualmente integra porque aprendió a ahorrar y a trabajar en equipo. El dinero que solicita es para invertirlo en la compra de lana en grandes cantidades para abastecerse y aumentar su producción ya que por estas épocas del año las ventas tienden a mejorar. El precio de una bolsa grande esta valorizada entre 20 y 40 soles dependiendo de la calidad, comprara todo lo que le alcance el dinero.
texts.en:
Marlene is 34, lives with her husband and three children in a rental home. She has done knitting work for three years, her decision to work independently is what pushed her to start her own business; she used to work as a domestic employee where the owner of the house taught her to knit all the types of stitches, it was a learning experience that now allows her to produce in great quantities shawls, caps, as well as bags and wallets. Every two weeks she finishes knitting what she is going to sell and then travels to mining areas to sell her pieces, she also sells animals on weekends, which are kept at her in-law’s house. Marlene wants to get ahead and is thinking of opening a big store where she can sell all sorts of products including her knitting pieces and at the same time offer phone calls service because she has noted in the area where she lives there is a need for this service. This is the second time that she gets a loan through MFP; she also likes to work with the community bank that she is currently part off because she learned to save money and work with a team. The money requested is to be invested in the purchase of large quantities of wool to have supplies and boost production because during this time of year sales tend to increase. The price of a large bag is estimated between 20 and 40 soles depending on the quality, she will buy as much as she can with the money.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool for knitting

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: Máximo tiene 53 años, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la ganadería desde hace 30 años, empezó a dedicarse a este trabajo porque es una actividad que viene de familia, su labor consiste en llevar a lugares lejanos a pastear a sus animales,  en promedio de 3 horas de caminar hasta conseguir buenos pastizales y regresa casi al anochecer. Para Máximo esta actividad es muy gratificante y rentable porque después lleva a vender sus animales y las ganancias son buenas, él espera mejorar su establo y tener mayor cantidad de animales. Es la primera vez que Máximo tiene un préstamo con MFP, y asume el compromiso de trabajar por la unidad y responsabilidad de su banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de un torete para incrementar su capital de trabajo. El torete está valorizado en 1000 soles.
texts.en:
Maximo is 53, lives with his wife and four children in a house they own. He has been farming for 30 years, starting in it because it’s a family activity; his work consists of walking his cattle to different areas to get feed, approximately three hours of walking to find good areas with grass to then get back almost at dusk. For Maximo this activity is very gratifying and profitable because he then sells the animals and the profits are good, he hopes to improve his cowshed and have more cattle. This is the first time that Maximo requests a loan through MFP, and he assumes the commitment to work for the unity and responsibility of the community bank. The money requested will be invested in the purchase of a young bull to have more working capital. The bull’s price is estimated to be 1,000 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a young bull

loans.name: Ma.shellane

texts.en:
Ma.Shellane P. raises pigs in her backyard. She is 39 years old and has 2 children. Her husband Elmer P. helps her to raise the pigs. This augments their limited income.

Previously, Ma.Shellane worked as a food vendor, where she sold a variety of snack items like peanuts, cassava rolls and other street foods. Now, she raises hogs because she loves the work. She is also convinced that she will earn a bigger profit from raising hogs.

Ma.Shellane is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy 4 piglets, pre-starter feeds, vaccines and anti-bacterial medicine. She believes that she will earn a bigger profit if she takes good care of the pigs; she will be able to sell them for more money. She hopes that with the money she earns, she will be able to send her children to college.

CEVI is helping Ma.Shellane grow her hog business. She has access to credit assistance, training and insurance coverage. CEVI helps all of its clients in these ways.

loans.use: To buy 4 piglets and feed

loans.name: Nathaly

texts.es: Nathaly tiene 19 años y vive en casa de sus padres. Se dedica en la atención de su puesto de ventas desde hace un año, empezó desde que era muy joven ayudando a su mamá, ahora administra su propio negocio aplicando lo que aprendió en los pasados años. Nathaly atiende durante todo el día, lo que vende son artículos de ferretería, todo lo concerniente para instalaciones eléctricas, llaves, candados entre otros. Para Nathaly este negocio es rentable a pesar de que existan épocas del año en las ventas son bajas, sin embargo siempre le deja ganancias. Ahora tiene planes de aumentar su mercadería para tener artículos más diversos y obtener otro puesto de venta. Es la primera vez que Nathaly tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella integra su banco comunal con muchas expectativas positivas, ya que escuchó recomendaciones favorables de lo que es trabajar en un banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para comprar grandes cantidades de focos, fluorescentes, conectores eléctricos, etc.
texts.en:
Nathaly is 19 and lives with her parents. For a year she has worked attending a sales location, she started when she was very young helping her mother, now she manages her own business and applies to it what she has learned over the years. Nathaly works all day, what she sells are hardware products, anything related to electric installations, keys, locks, among others. For Nathaly this business is profitable in spite of parts of the year in which sales are low; however there have always been earnings. She now has plans to increase merchandise and have a large variety of products as well as having another sales location. This is the first time that Nathaly gets a loan with MFP, she forms part of the community bank with positive expectations, because she heard good references about how it is to work in a community bank. The money requested is to purchase large quantities of bulbs, lights, electric connectors, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase amount and variety of merchandise

loans.name: Petrona Maribel

texts.es: La Señor Petrona Maribel R. C. Es originaria de la comunidad de Patzarajmac Totonicapan, cuando tenia doce años aprendio hacer bordado manuales hoy sigue realizado dicha actividad, ya cuenta con dos operarias, ella visita las instalaciones de la oficina Asdir para solicitar un credito que lo utilizara para la compra de materiales por mayor y herramientas porque tiene un pedido del bordado para estas epocas de semana santa ya que la activida economica principal es para damas ya que es un traje tipico de la region, que necesita mucha paciencia al momento de realizar es carisma de su trabajo le ha permitido crecer economicamente para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Petrona Maribel R. C. is from Patzarajmac, Totonicapan. She has been doing embroidery by hand since she was 12 years old, and now employees two assistants. She visited the offices of Kiva's partner ASDIR to request a loan to purchase wholesale materials and tools to prepare for the upcoming busy season. Holy Week is a busy time for her business since she makes her region's traditional women's clothing, and she already has orders to fulfill. Doing the embroidery requires much patience, and the affinity that Petrona has for her work has enabled her to prosper economically, which has supported the well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda tiene 40 años, vive  con su esposo y sus 7 hijos en su propia casa. Se dedica a la fabricación de sogas desde hace 12 años, empezó primero vendiendo al por menor las sogas ya fabricadas, luego tuvo la oportunidad de trabajar en una fabrica de sogas, lo que la favoreció, ya que aprendió rápidamente y decidió fabricar ella misma las sogas y lo que produce lo reparte al por mayor en distintas ciudades. Por la calidad de la producción,  ha notado que ha mejorado bastante sus ventas y produce en mayor cantidad, sus hijos son los que la ayudan a fabricar. El gran sueño de Olinda es la de tener una fábrica a gran escala e innovar en sus productos. Es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, está decidida a continuar en el trabajo que realiza en su banco comunal y en las reuniones que se dan, ya que es un persona de confianza por haber demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fardos de plástico y retazos de tela que son el material básico para la fabricación de sus  sogas, cada fardo tiene un precio aproximado de 300 soles y comprará 10 fardos.
texts.en:
Olinda is 40 years old and lives with her husband and seven children in her own home. For twelve years she has made ropes. She began by selling manufactured ropes, but later had the opportunity to work in a rope factory. She was a quick learner and found that the work really suited her, so she decided to start her own business manufacturing ropes and now sells them wholesale in various cities. Because her ropes are of higher quality, she has noticed an increase in sales, and, with her children's help, she is able to produce rope in greater quantities. Olinda's big dream is to have a large-scale factory and be able to create innovative products.

This is Olinda's third loan from Kiva's partner Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she is committed to continuing her work with the bank, including attending their meetings. Olinda is a trustworthy person and has been very punctual in her repayments.

She will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of bundles of plastic and fabric remnants, which are the raw materials from which she produces her ropes. Each bundle costs approximately 300 Peruvian nuevos soles (US $92.50) and she will buy ten bundles.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to make ropes

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es: Rocío tiene 23 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 2 años en una casa arrendada. Se dedica a la venta de balones de gas desde hace un año, pero hace 4 meses decidió abrir una distribuidora en una ciudad cercana debido al comercio más activo que existe en ese lugar. Rocío arrendó un local donde vive momentáneamente y a la vez vende sus balones de gas para uso doméstico, adicionalmente vende comida a los trabajadores  de una empresa de refinería de metales, lo cual significa un ingreso más. Lo bueno es que ella cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su madre que la apoya en el cuidado de su pequeño hijo mientras ella trabaja en su establecimiento, es por ello que el deseo de Rocío es crecer en este negocio para poder  contratar personal en le reparto de los balones de gas para tener más tiempo para atender a su pequeño. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella fue invitada a integrar el banco comunal y demostró que era responsable en sus pagos, además se siente muy bien con los integrantes de su grupo porque para ella ha sido un espacio de amistad. El dinero que solicita es para comprar más balones de gas, que en promedio están a 80 soles cada uno, comprará 25.
texts.en:
Rocío is 23 years old and lives with her husband and 2-year-old son in a rented house. For the last year she has sold gas bottles, and four months ago she decided to move her business to a nearby city where there is potential for more sales. Rocío rented a place to live and from there sells gas bottles for home use. She also sells food to workers from a local metal refinery, which is an additional source of income. Rocío is lucky to have the unconditional support of her mother, who takes care of her son while she works. Rocío wants her business to grow so that she can hire employees to help sell the gas bottles so that she can have more time with her son.

This is Rocío's second loan from Kiva's partner Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she has been invited to become a member of the community bank. She has been responsible in her repayments and she enjoys being a part of the group, which for her is a place of friendship.

Rocío will use the money from the loan to purchase more gas bottles, which cost an average of 80 Peruvian nuevos soles (US $25). She will purchase 25 of them.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 33 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en una casa arrendada. Se dedica a realizar manualidades desde hace 7 años, su ingenio, agregado a la capacitación que ha recibido en las artes manuales han potencializado sus habilidades para mejorar en la elaboración de trabajos hechos a base de accesorios como perlas, hilos de colores, etc., con las cuales elabora bellas carteras o adornos de acuerdo a la ocasión; por ejemplo para la navidad, adornos decorativos para la sala, cocina, etc. Todos estos detalles los vende viajando a los asientos mineros donde ya tiene clientes seguros y que también la recomiendan. También viaja a otras ciudades  para venderlos pero, solo cada quincena porque sus ventas son más seguras en los asientos mineros. Vilma quiere crecer en este negocio porque le es rentable y además una gran distracción, ya que disfruta de los trabajos que realiza. Es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y es una de las socias más responsables de su banco comunal e impulsa en los demás este valor. El dinero que está solicitando es para invertirlo en la comprará de materiales; tales como botones y asas, ya que elaborará bolsas y mochilas para la época escolar.
texts.en:
Vilma is 33 years old and lives with her two children in a rented home. She has dedicated herself to making handcrafts for the last seven years. Her ingenuity, in addition to the training she has received in handcrafted arts, has allowed her to reach her potential in her abilities and to improve her work by using accessories such as pearls, colored threads, etc. Vilma makes beautiful wallets or accessories depending on the occasion. For example, for Christmas she makes decorative ornaments for the living room or kitchen. Vilma travels to the different mining districts where she already has clients to sell her decorations. She also travels to other cities but only does so twice a month as her sales are more certain in the mining districts. Vilma wants to expand her business because it is profitable and because it is a good pastime as she enjoys her work. This is the third loan she has received from MFP and she is one of the most responsible members of her bank and urges others to do the same. The loan she is requesting will be invested in purchasing materials such as buttons and bag handles as she makes bags and backpacks for the school year.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for her handcrafts.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen A. raises pigs in her backyard. She would like to raise more pigs, but she does not have enough capital to run her business. Helen has been an active and a good CEVI client. She has a good credit history. For almost two years she has maintained good repayment records as she has established her business.

Helen is 56 years old and has 3 children.

Aside from raising pigs, she also has a small farm. She grows rice help to support their family. Her husband Eddie A. helps her manage their livelihood.

She now is asking for a loan so she can buy feed for her pigs. She believes a business line of credit will help to contribute more to their family income. She may start another business; her loan will help her get started in building a sari-sari store.

CEVI provides their clients the credit assistance that they need. They also receive training and insurance coverage from CEVI to help their small businesses to grow.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Florinda Petrona

texts.es: doña Florinda Petrona  es originaria de la comunidad de chiyax del departamento de Totonicapan ella esta trabajando dedes 12 años con una persona que se deica a la venta de productos de ceramica y lozas ella fue aprendiendo ha como lo vende con quien lo vende y donde se compra, sus patrones le digieron en una oportunidad que inicie su propio negocio pero no se decidio de realizar pasaron los meses y le conto a  sus amigas de lo queria realizar y le dieron animo para inicir su propio negocio, hablo con sus patrones y le comento que iniciava su negocio  hoy necesita un capital para hacer realidad su sueño necesita de la colaboracion de ASDIR para Compra sus productos y crecer poco a poco en su nueva experiencia de vidad de ser duena de su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Florinda Petrona is originally from the community of Chiyax in the department of Totonicapan. Shee has been working for 12 years with someone who sells ceramics and china. She has been learning how to sell these products, who to sell them to and where to buy them. Her employers had given her an opportunity to open her own business but she did not make the decision to do so. Many months went by and she told her friends about her plans and they encouraged her to open her own business. She spoke with her employers and told them she was started her business. She now needs capital to turn her dream into a reality; she needs ASDIR's help to buy her products and grow little by little in this new life experience of being in charge of her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva B. owns a rice field. Everyday, she and her husband go out to their farm. They cultivate the soil, work under the heat of the sun, and remove all the of weeds that grow to ensure a quality harvest.

Genoveva is 53 years old. She has 5 children. Her husband Jose B. is a carpenter. He also earns income to help support their children's education. Together, they do their best to uplift their lives. Through hard work is their best chance to achieve their goals.

Now, Genoveva is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers. Specifically, she will use the loan to buy 2 bags of fertilizers, urea and triple 14. She also hopes to supplement their income with other income-generating projects.

CEVI provides its clients the credit assistance that they need. They also receive training and insurance coverage from CEVI to help their small businesses grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah B. earns a living growing rice. She tills the land with the help of Tereso, her husband. Tereso is also a farmer.

Leah wants to help her children complete a college education. She wants them to earn a college degree so that when they grow up, they can have better job to support their own children.

Aside from farming, the family earns money from selling a variety of goods. They own a sari-sari store, which gives them additional income.

Leah is requesting a loan from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers for her farm. This will allow her to increase the yield on her farm. This will give her more rice to sell in her store.

Leah is just one of the thousands of entrepreneurs helped by CEVI to improve their lives and businesses. Through credit assistance, training and insurance coverage, CEVI helps its clients grow their small businesses.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie A. earns a living growing rice. She has been planting rice since she was a child. Because her parents are farmers, she is highly experienced in planting the seeds and harvesting the grains.

Rose is 48 years old. She has 9 children. She has a strong desire to help her husband support their family, so she also sells sampaguita in the nearby barrio. Rose is happy in her marriage. She will do her best to sustain her family.

Rose needs a loan of Php 10,000. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers. Specifically, she will use the loan to buy 2 bags of urea and triple 14. She will also seek out other income-generating projects to augment their limited income.

Joining the CEVI credit program gave Rosemarie access to the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage that CEVI gives.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma G. is a 40-year-old mother of 6 children. She earns a living farming rice. She tills the land because she enjoys the work. She is an experienced farmer and has been tilling their farm for 21 years. Her husband Vicente G. helps her work the farm.

Gemma uses the harvest to feed her children. Because of their farm, she and her husband are able to send their children to school. Aside from farming, their family also raises farm animals. They raise chickens in their backyard as well.

Gemma needs a loan of Php 8,000. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers. Specifically, she will use the loan to buy 2 bags of fertilizers. She will also develop other income-generating projects to support her family.

CEVI provides their clients the credit assistance they need. They also receive training and insurance coverage from CEVI to help their small businesses to grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Manuela Francisca

texts.es: La Señora Manuela Francisca A. G. Es originaria de la comunidad de Chuixchimal  del departamento de Totonicapan ella es una  persona muy humilde que se dedica a las actividades domesticos y su esposo es agricultor tiene diez años de casados tiene tres hijos hoy necesita del apoyo de ASDIR en un credito para la compra de materiales de construccion, principalmente en la compra de lamina para techado de su humilde hogar para no terner problemas en la epoca de Invierno
texts.en:
Mrs. Manuela Francisca A. G. is originally from the Chuixchimal community, Totonicapan department. She is a humble person who performs domestic work and her husband is a farmer. They have been married for 10 years, and they have three children. Today she needs ASDIR’s support in the form of a loan to buy construction materials, primarily laminate for roofing her humble home so she doesn’t have problems in winter.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for home repair

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn M. grows rice to earn a living. She is 37 years old and she has 5 children. She dreams of sending all her children to college. She and her husband were not able to go to college. She thinks that education is important; it will help her children get a better job. She wants her children to graduate soon and find better jobs to support their future.

When Jenelyn is not busy on her farm, she arranges flowers. She prepares flower arrangements for weddings and special occassions in her village. This is another source of income for the family; Jenelyn uses the income to support the family's needs.

Jenelyn is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers. Specifically, she will use the loan to buy 2 bags of fertilizers, urea and triple 14. She will also try to develop other income-generating projects to augment their limited income.

CEVI provides its clients with more than just credit. It also gives its clients training on managing a business and insurance coverage to help protect its members.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Sorm

texts.en: S., 52, lives in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has owned a plot of land since 1999. She grows both rice and vegetable crops. She can plant her crops twice a year: the dry season and the rainy season. Her husband Saron, age 56, works with her cultivating crops. They have six children; two of them are married and the others are single. To help meet the family's needs, one of their daughters is working as a garment worker. Crops are the family's main source of income. S. is asking for a $400 loan to buy some fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for growing cucumbers.

loans.use: To buy some of fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina V. is a 37-year-old married woman with three children. Her husband is a driver, which helps to support their family from a financial standpoint. She, meanwhile, has 2 years of experience in the farming business, and she explains that she sells her crops to the public three days per week. On average, her weekly net cash flow is approximately 400 Tala ($166).

Notably, she has already received four previous loans from SPBD. Indeed, SPBD loans are Sina’s only access to capital because she is unable to qualify for any loans via traditional banks. She is now seeking a loan in the amount of $575, all of which will be used to expand and improve her business (e.g., to purchase chemicals and equipment).

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing chemicals and equipment

loans.name: Sandab's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Sandab K., 41, is the leader for this group of six people who all live in Troneam Pich village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is a motor taxi driver. His wife, Mrs. T. Chhoeurm, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she has a problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer. In order to deal this problem, Mr. Sandab K.'s wife decided to request a loan to purchase fertilizer to make her crops more productive. This couple has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, another attends the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Mr. Sandab K. is not requesting the loan but his wife is, so she is shown in the photo.  

All the members of this group have end-of-term (EoT) loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana E. has been engaged in growing rice for 13 years. She and her husband work together to sustain their farm. Their children help them by removing weeds and snails, which improves the yield.

Rosana is 36 years old. Her 3 children all study in school. She mainly depends on the rice harvest to pay the children's school fees. Now, Rosana is trying to develop business opportunities to earn more for her family. In the past, she worked as a fish vendor. She was not happy selling fish because she only earned a small amount; there was too much competition in the market.

She now is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her farm. She believes that a loan will help to bring her a good harvest. Therefore, she will have more to give to her children.

CEVI provides its clients the credit assistance that they need. Clients also receive trainings and insurance coverage from CEVI to help their small businesses grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice A. has been farming rice for 10 years. Her farm is growing and is well sustained. 

Alice is 56 years old and she has only one child. 

She feeds her family and supports their daily needs with what she earns from the rice harvest. Her husband is an experienced farmer as well. Together, they till the land to increase the yield of their farm. They feed their family with the rice harvest and sell the remainder to rice traders in their village. When Alice is not busy on the farm, she also makes high-quality dresses for her clients.

Alice needs a loan of Php 8,000. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers. Specifically, she will use the loan to buy 3 bags of fertilizers. She will also try to develop other income-generating projects to help support her family.

CEVI helps Alice to sustain her farm business. By joining the program, CEVI clients gain access to credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong K. is 18 years old and lives with his brother and his mother in the Battambang province. He is not married yet, and works as a construction worker building houses. He makes about US$5 per day. He has requested a loan of US$300 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. This will reduce the transportation costs that he pays for every day.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Maryle

texts.en:
Maryle A. grows rice to earn a living. Her life is on the farm. Her parents taught her everything she knows about farming, such as how to plant rice and other crops. They hoped that when the time came for her to have her own family, she would know how to support her children. Her husband Marlino A. is a very experienced farmer. Together, they work hard for their family's future. Eleven years ago, that they started their rice farm business. They reserve a portion of the harvest for their family and they sell the remainder to rice traders in town.

Maryle is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds. She believes that the loan will help to give her a better return on her business investment. She hopes that increased income will hep to improve their living conditions.

Joining the CEVI credit program gave Maryle access to credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Mrs. C. Khun is 46 years old and lives with her husband in the Battambang province. She works in a grocery store, making around US$5 of profit per day. Her husband earns around US$7, working as a moto-taxi driver. She and her husband have four children, two of whom work as a construction worker and a tailor, and two of whom are in school. C. Khun is asking for a loan of US$600 to expand her grocery store. (C. is pictured on the left.)

loans.use: To expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Mrs. Pao Uk Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is for 16 people who all live in Krang Samroang village in Kampong Chhnang province. They will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Pao U., 43, is the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. So Sreng, are farmers who own a piece of land where they cultivate vegetables. In this plantation, they have an obstacle because they do not have enough money for planting the field. Thus, Mrs. Pao U. decided to ask for a loan so they can grow vegetables to earn some income. She has five children, one of whom is a firewood seller while the others are enrolled in the local school. 

Thirteen members in this group loans have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To plant vegetables

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: T. is 35 years old and runs a medium-size store out of her home, providing a service for buying and selling used-goods. She can earn an income of $5 per day from her investment, and has been in this business since early 2007. She is married and has given birth to one child who is teenager and attends school. Her husband's name is Ra, 39, who is a Cambodia military policeman. T. needs the capital to manage her financial investment; thus, she is applying for a $500 loan in order to increase inventory in her store. The family lives in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. (T.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To increase inventory in her store.

loans.name: Sanch

texts.en: Sanch P., 42, sells fish and lives with her husband in the Battambang province. On average, she makes around US$1.80 each day. Her husband earns US$2 per day by working as a farmer and fisherman. This couple has five children, three of whom are employed and two who are in school. Mrs. Sanch would like to take out a loan of US$500 to purchase fish for sale and fertilizers to expand her husband’s cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Mrs. Sambin Chhim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, consisting of thirteen members, is located in Smeth village in Kampong Chhnang province. The members plan to use the loans they have obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Sambin C. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She is a farmer wH. owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. She does not have enough money to buy rice seeds to grow, S. she is requesting a loan to purchase rice seeds to cultivate on the field to earn her living. Mrs. Sambin C. is a 58-year-old widow with a child wH. works as a jeweler.

Six members in this group loans have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. Such loans allows borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to purchase rice seed to cultivate on the field to earn for living.

loans.name: Kith

texts.en: Kith S., 41, is married and lives with her husband in Battambang, Cambodia. She makes and sells rice noodles at the market and earn approximately US$2 per day, while her husband earns US$2 a day working as a farmer. She and her husband have three children. Kith would like to take out a loan to purchase fertilizers to expand her husband’s cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Chic

texts.en: Chic S. is 27 years old and lives with her husband in Battambang province. Since 2006, she has planted vegetables to sell at the market and earns approximately US$ 3 every day. Her husband earns US$ 4 a day by working as a construction worker, building house. This couple has just one young child.  Mrs. Chic is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike to transport her vegetables to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport her vegetables

loans.name: Ratha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ratha M. is a group leader of five borrowers who all live in Damnak Key village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a basket middleman and pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing two more piglets for breeding to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Neang Samnang, is a worker in the government department in the local district. Mrs. Ratha M. is 19 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. Such loans allows borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy two more piglets for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Lon

texts.en: Lon K., 27, is a corn farmer who lives in Battambang province with her husband and two young children. She typically makes US$ 4 each day and her husband earns US$ 4 working as a construction worker. She would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike to transport corn to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport her corn to the market

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en: Ellen P., 42 years old, is married to Enitiquio P. and is blessed with 6 children. She works so hard to earn money for her family. Early in the morning, she cooks food to be peddled for the day in the neighborhood and nearby villages. She wants to increase her income and to have her own stall beside their house for her business. She needs financial assistance amounting to PHP 11,000.00 for the stall and for additional capital for her business. This is her 3rd loan with HSPFI. She used a PHP 5,000.00 loan to start her peddling business. If granted, she can send her children to school and can start to have a comfortable living.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients and materials for stall construction

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun C. is 47 years old and lives with his wife in Battambang, Cambodia. He works in a grocery store, making around USD $5 per day. His wife, pictured here, stays at home to look after the children and to cook food for them. She also raises pigs and makes about $1 per day. This couple has two children. Mr. Bun C. would like to take out a loan to purchase more grocery products.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items

loans.name: Yot

texts.en: C., 33, has requested a loan of $600 to buy a new motorbike to support her business investment because she wants to have an easier work flow during her buying and selling procedures. C. currently sells fish and vegetables in the local Takmao Market and earns around of $5 per day. She is married and has two children who are are teenagers and attend school. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and also assists her in selling fish. C. usually gets up every dark morning to buy vegetables and fish for her store in bulk and resells them to the customers in retail. She works very hard because she wants to send both her children to get a university degree. The family lives in Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to support her retail business investment.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is managing a small variety store to help her husband, who is a farmer, augment their family income. Farming alone is not enough to provide for their basic needs, and all the more that they have three children to send to school. Thus, Jocelyn was very thankful to HSPFI as she was able to access a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 that she used to start her variety store business. She aspires to further increase the stocks for her variety store, and so she needs an additional capital amounting to PHP 8,000.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her variety store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca P. is 35 years old. She is married with 8 children. Two of her children are now in the elementary grades, and rest of her children stay in the house. The family resides at Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, and Rebecca wants to have a mini-grocery store to serve their village.

Rebecca decided to engage in a village store business to assist her husband with their financial needs. Due to lack of capital, Rebecca is applying for a third loan with HSPFI amounting to PHP 11,000 to sustain her small business. With this loan, she can buy additional grocery items like as canned goods, beverages, basic commodities, toiletries and baking flour for her cakes. She hopes that her current weekly income will increase so that she can provide for the needs of her children and be able to send her sons and daughter to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items like as canned goods, beverages, basic commodities, toiletries and baking flour

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Thuok's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuok T. is a group leader of three who all live in Khnong village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a buffalo breeder. Her husband, Mr. Phang Meth, is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he grows rice. Unfortunately, he does not have enough money to hire laborers to work on the field. Additionally, he needs fertilizers to support the field to make his crop more productive. Thus, Mrs. Thuok T. has decided to ask for a loan for her husband’s plantation. She is 46 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a farmer while the others are enrolled in the local school. Mrs. Khut Yoeurn, who is a group guarantor, is also presented in the picture with the group members.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. Such loans allows borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make his crop more productive.

loans.name: 01-Đông Sơn Group

texts.vi:
Nhóm 01 thuộc phố 2 phường Đông Sơn- Thành phố Thanh Hoá cách Hà Nội 156 km về phía Nam. Nhóm gồm 6 thành viên do chị H. Thị Khuyên làm nhóm trưởng, năm nay chị 29 tuổi,chồng chị là anh Hiếu. Gia đình chị có bố mẹ già,bố chị bị ốm liệt giường vừa mới mất, tình hình kinh tế gia đình chị hiện nay rất khó khăn, anh chị có 1 con trai 3 tuổi. Chị vay mức vốn 3.079.800 VND(~177 USD) để buôn bán nước mắm, trang trải cuộc sống hàng ngày. Các thành viên trong nhóm đều có cùng mức vay.
*  Chị N. Thị Thanh, 64 tuổi, chị vay vốn mua nước mắm về bán.

 Chị Vũ Thị Toan, 47 tuổi, chị vay vốn mua nước mắm về bán.

*  Bác N. Thị Hằng, 61 tuổi, đầu tư vào ngành vận tải.

 * CHị N. Thị Hoe, 47 tuổi, vay vốn đầu tư vào mở hàng sửa chữa xe đạp và xe máy.

 * Chị N. Thị Minh , 41 tuổi, vay vốn đầu tư vào hàng bún chả, giò chả.
texts.en:
Group 01 lives in 2nd Street, Dong Son province, Thanh Hoa city, which is about 156 km south of Hanoi. Mrs. Hoang Thi Khuyen is the leader of Group 01 with five other members. She is 29 years old, and her husband's name is Hieu. They live with their parents. Her dad was very sick and just passed away. Her family is in such financial hardship. Mrs. Khuyen and Mr. Hieu have a son who is three years old. She wants to borrow 3,079,800 VND( approx. 177 USD) to sell fish sauce. Other members in her group also request the same amount of loan. - Mrs. Nguyen Thi Thanh, 64 years old, and Mrs. Vu Thi Toan, 47 years old, want to borrow money to sell fish sauce. - Mrs. Nguyen Thi Hang, 61 years old, borrows money for her transportation business. - Mrs. Nguyen Thi Hoe, 47 years old, wants to open a motorbike and bicycle repair shop. - Mrs. Nguyen Thi Minh, 41 years old, wants to invest in her rice vermicelli shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mua nước mắm, giò chả.

loans.name: Saret

texts.en: Mrs. Saret U. is a villager in Kraing Touch Village in Takeo province. She is a duck breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks and duck food for her breeding. She is a 46-year-old mother with a child who is a horse cart driver making a small income to support the family.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more duck and duck food for her breeding.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en: Mrs. Ra C. was born in 1957 and she now lives in Kraing Touch Village in Takeo province. She is a poultry breeder who raises ducks. Since her ducks are growing bigger and bigger, she does not have enough money to buy food to feed them so she has decided to request a loan to buy more duck food. Her husband, Mr. Pheuk Khe, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice for a living. Mrs. Ra C. is 52 years old and the mother of three children: one is a construction worker while the remaining two are attending the local school. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy duck food for breeding.

loans.name: Seutaatia

texts.en:
Seutaatia T., 34, is married with 2 children. She is involved in a plantation business and she sells to the public 1 day per week. She had 2 previous loans with SPBD. She is a retrained member restarting in the program. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (approximately $145 USD).

SPBD loans are Seutaatia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The money will be invested on improving her plantation.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals and equipment.

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: Mrs. Moeun C. is a villager in Srae Kruos village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Mao Mean, makes baskets with bamboo. Since this business is doing well, he wants to expand it. Hence, Mrs. Moeun C. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more bamboos for her husband to make baskets. She is 61 years old and the mother of two children employed in a garment factory. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more bamboos for her husband to make basket.

loans.name: Vuong's Group

texts.vi:
Vương Thị Nhạn sinh năm 1976,( mã số: 010117050027) chị ở cùng chồng và hai con. Chồng chị là lái xe có thu nhập ổn định, bản thân chị ở nhà bán quán bia hơi. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng: 4.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Chu kỳ vốn này chị vay mức: 3.132.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng bán giải khát( bia, nước ngọt,..). Cùng vay vốn với chị còn có:
 Nguyễn Thị Phiên sinh năm 1969, ( mã số: 010117050026) gia đình chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp. chồng chị đi làm có thu nhập ổn định, chị đi chợ bán hoa quả có thu nhập theo ngày. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 4.500.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị vay mức: 3.132.000 vnđ để đi chợ.
 Nguyễn Thị Lệ sinh năm 1968, ( mã số: 010117050025) Vợ chồng chị có ba đứa con. Chị làm nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi gà, chồng làm thợ xây, thu nhập bình quân khoảng 4.000.000 vnđ /tháng. Chị tham gia vay mức vốn: 3.132.000 vnđ để đầu tư thức ăn cho gà.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vuong T. N. (ID: 010117050027), born 1976, lives with her husband and two children. Her husband is a driver with stabL. income, and she stays at home selling draught beer. The average income of the family is about VND4,000,000 per month. In this loan cycL., she wishes to borrow VND3,132,000 to invest in the beverage shop (beer, soft drinks). Other borrowers in the Group include:

- Mrs .Nguyen T. P. (ID: 010117050026), born 1969. The family's main business is farming. Her husband is employed with stabL. wages. She trades fruits at the market to get the daily income. The average income of her family is about VND4,500,000 per month. She wishes to borrow VND3,132,000 to trade.

- Mrs. Nguyen T. L. (ID:010117050025), born 1968. Her family has three children. She farms and raises chickens. Her husband is a construction worker. The average income is about VND4,000,000 per month. She wishes to borrow VND3,132,000 to buy foods for chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for petty trades

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Laumoe

texts.en: Laumoe S., 53, is married with 6 children. She has 3 years of experience in a plantation business. She sells to the public 1 day per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (approximately $125 USD). SPBD loans are Laumoe’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All of the loan will be used for the business, in which her husband does all the farming.

loans.use: To maintain business needs

loans.name: Soeut

texts.en:
Soeut P., 47, lives in Battambang province. He is a construction worker, building houses, earning around US$ 3 per day, while his wife raises cows for sale and makes less than US$ 2 per day. This couple has four children, two of whom are construction workers; two are students.

Mr. Soeut P. would like to use this loan to purchase construction materials. (Soeut's wife is pictured from their home.)

loans.use: Construction materials.

loans.name: Talaleu

texts.en: Talaleu M., 44, is married with 5 children. She has 5 years of experience in a plantation business. Her husband does the work on the plantation. She sells to the public 2 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (approximately $125 USD). She has had 6 previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Talaleu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of the loan will be used to pay for her kids' school fees.

loans.use: To fund business needs

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun R. is 45 years old and lives with his wife in Battambang province, Cambodia. He is a local mechanic, working out of his home and makes around US$ 6 per day. His wife is a good housewife who stays at home and cooks for family members. This couple has three children and two of them are students.  Mr. Bun R. is asking for a loan to purchase mechanic's tools.

loans.use: To purchase mechanic's tools

loans.name: Tsend

texts.en: Tsend Z. is a 28-year-old man who lives with his parents and younger sister. His family has a grocery store. Two years ago, he began borrowing from the bank to buy a car to use in a taxi business. From his profits, he repaid the full amount he borrowed and bought another car for his father. Now, his father is running a taxi business, too. Besides the taxi business, they also use the car to pick up and drop off food products for the family grocery store. They live in a "ger" (a traditional nomadic Mongolian home) district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Z. is taking a loan to buy car supplies and tires. All the family members are working hard to make their little grocery store a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy car supplies and tires

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim R., 52, is a widow and lives with her child in the Battambang Province. Her child is a student. Since 2003, Kim has run a vegetable store in the market to earn a living. From this, she is able to make around USD $8 per day. Now, Kim would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike to transport vegetables to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en: Mrs. Sarun S. is a villager in Pech En village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Nop Toeurn, is a pig breeder. Aside from pig breeding, he is a palm juice collector. Mrs. Sarun S. is applying for a loan to add to her savings with which she plans to buy construction supplies to build a better house for her family. She is 42 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study.  Her husband is presented in the picture with her in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add her saving to buy construction supplies to build the house.

loans.name: Ngay

texts.en: Mr. Ngay N. lives in Prey Meas village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Pech Phea, uses the rice to make rice wine. Mr. Ngay N. is applying for a loan to purchase rice as well as two piglets to start a pig breeding business. He hopes to increase his income and help improve his family's living conditions with this loan. He is 45 years old and the father of five children, one of whom stays at home to help keep house while the others are attending the local school. His wife is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to purchase rice to make wine and two piglets for breeding pigs business.

loans.name: Yeom

texts.en: Yeom S. was born in 1974 and lives in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has two children, both of whom are students in the primary school. Yeom's husband drives a motorbike taxi. Since 2000, Yeom S. has been selling fish in the local Toulkok Market, and she currently earns an average of $6 each day. Beside this business, she rents rooms to garment workers. Renting rooms is a profitable investment for the family. She is requesting a loan of $500 to build more rooms to rent.

loans.use: To build more rooms

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Mrs. Soy L. is a villager in Prey Meas village in Takeo province. She is a grocer. Her husband, Mr. Kong Seng, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. He faces an obstacle because he usually needs to paya lot of money to plow the field. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Soy L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen to plow the field. She is 45 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed, another stays at home to do housework and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy two oxen to plow a rice field.

loans.name: Klout

texts.en: Klout N. is a 52-year-old who lives with his wife in the Battambang Province. To earn a living, he has been working as a construction worker building houses. On average, he makes USD $4 per day. His wife stays at home and makes rice wine. Everyday she makes $3 of profit per day. This couple has four children, two of whom are in school and the two others help their mother make rice wine at home. Klout N. would like to take out a loan to purchase rice for his wife to increase their production of rice wine.

loans.use: To purchase rice to make rice wine

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita N. works hard to provide for the needs of her family. She is 52 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City in Eastern Philippines. She started a business selling rice and other items at a variety store. She is planning to expand the business so that she can cater to the needs of their community. She needs a loan of PHP 8,000. This is her second loan from HSPFI.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for sale

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Phea

texts.en: Phea S. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two young children in the Battambang Province. She sells rice and makes USD $7 per day, while her husband works as a farmer and earns $6 every day. Mrs. Phea is asking for a loan to purchase rice in bulk to resell.

loans.use: To purchase rice to resell

loans.name: Mrs. Nen Nov Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of ten people living in Pech Entrea village in Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. They will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Nen N. is 47 years old and the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Uk Tab, is a construction worker and cow breeder. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Nen N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy another cow to breed and earn more income. The couple has two children, one of whom is a construction worker while the other is employed in a garment factory.

Four members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan A., also known as  “San,” lives in Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 51 years old, happily married, and blessed with eight children. Farming is the primary source of income for the family. Sometimes her husband accepts carpentry works from a near-by village. She dreams that her children will finish college and have decent jobs that will help them improve their standard of living. Susan decided to start a sari-sari store (variety  store) to augment the family's income. She joined HSPFI Trust Bank Program and with her first her first loan of PHP.5, 000, she was able to improve her sari-sari store. The demands for her goods are now outgrowing her sari-sari store. She plans to go into gasoline retailing to respond the needs of the jeepney divers in her village. Susan is now requesting PHP 10,000 to purchase grocery items for sale and to start her new business as a gasoline retailer.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and to start her new business as a gasoline retailer

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Sun H., 30, is married and lives in the Battambang Province with her husband and six children. All of their children are in school. Mrs. Sun H. and her husband are fish sellers at the market and earn a combined income of around USD $6 per day. She is asking for a loan to buy more fish to resell.

loans.use: To purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Sithy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sithy Y., 47, and her husband, Mr. Heang Chea, 57, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Her husband is a soldier. They were married in 1980 and have six children, three sons and three daughters. One of her sons studies in the university and three other children have full-time employment.

Sithy has been a silk weaver for twenty years; it’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Sithy is requesting her first loan of $400 to pay the tuition fee for her son who studies in university.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s school fees

loans.name: Alfrido

texts.en:
Alfrido C., 53, is married to Susana C.. They have three children, the youngest of whom needs special care and medication.
	
Alfrido C. owns a small house with a small store. Previously, this store was full of various goods available for sale, but when a landslide made the roads impassable to the city, they had to use their goods for personal consumption. In a year time, he was able to take out two loans from HSPFI that helped him start his business again. Presently, he sells food items such as fried chicken legs and cooked vegetables. But he now needs to fully stock his store, so he is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000.00.

loans.use: To stock his store

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sokhorn S., 58, and his wife, Mrs. Oeun Ben, 53, were married in 1980 and have six children, two sons and four daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home. Three children have full-time employment, and the other three children are in school. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Two, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sokhorn has been driving motor remoque taxis (motorbikes with trailers at the back) since 1994. He carries people and goods from his home to Phnom Penh. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. Sokhorn is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for his son to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his son to drive to work

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: At the age of 48, Marlyn L., married with 3 children, continues to struggle to earn money for her family. She is a farmer and produces vegetables and rice and sells these. She is only a tenant of the land where she grows these vegetables and rice. The most painful thing that happened to her life and her family was when the vegetables and rice planted on the farm were flashed out by flood due to a typhoon on January 11, 2009, which lasted for almost a week. Due to this incident, she wants to start a new farm and buy seedlings which requires about PHP 5,000.00. If she and her husband increase their income, she wants to buy a carabao that could help them plow the farm land.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and rice seedlings

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Phun

texts.en: Mrs. S., 37, is married to Choum, 29, They live in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. The couple currently earns a living by working as domestic building workers, and they can make income of $8 each day. They have five teenage children, who all attend school. Mrs. S. has applied for a $500 loan to purchase a cow to raise and breed.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Mrs. Tang Kuoy Naing Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, consisting of nine members, is located in Pech Entrea village in Kampong Chhnang province. They plan to use the loans which they obtain for different purposes. Mrs. Tang Kuoy N. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery goods for her business. Her husband, Mr. Pa Touch, is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. Mrs. Tang Kuoy N. is a 57-year-old mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory. Mrs. Tang's husband is shown in the picture.

Seven members in this group loans have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen S. is 41 years old and works as a teacher in the Battambang Province. He has been teaching for 14 years and makes about USD $10 per day.
