His wife sells grocery products at the school campus and earns $7 each day. This couple has three children, all of whom are in school. Sen S. would like to take out a loan to build a store for his wife and to purchase more products to sell at the school.

loans.use: To build a grocery store and purchase its merchandise

loans.name: Seab

texts.en:
Mrs. Seab S., 45, and her husband, Mr. Vannak Roeung, 46, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Her husband is a soldier. They were married in 1990 and have four daughters. One of their daughters is a silk weaver and the other three are in school.
 
Seab has been a silk weaver since she was 20 years old. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes it to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Seab is requesting her first loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther C. is 57 years old, married, and blessed with 2 children. She looks forward to having a better life for her family in the future. She is struggling to earn money for the family, for her husband is sickly and needs maintenance of medicines daily while her children are in school. The only income she gets to support the family is from the variety store. Her family lives in a house without electricity and she wants it to be lighted to have a comfortable living situation.

Esther is planning to increase the income of their variety store. To be able to do this, she needs additional capital in the amount of PHP 11,000.00 for her business. If this will be given, this will be her 3rd loan cycle from HSPFI.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Mrs. Ry M. is a villager in Tonle village in Takeo province who breeds ducks for a living. Her husband, Mr. Seas Soeun, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. Although they work hard, they still don't earn enough to support their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Ry M. is applying for a loan to buy a motor-vehicle for her husband to use as a motorbike taxi. She is a 28-year-old mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a motor for her husband use as a motorbike taxi.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom M. lives in Tonle village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Sin Cham, is a palm juice collector. Mrs. Mom M. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy wood to build a house for her family. She is a 47-year-old mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add her savings to buy wood to build a house for her family

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Tuy A. is 47 years old and lives with her husband in Bati, Takeo province. She runs a grocery store from her home and typically makes US$ 15 in revenue per day. Her husband, pictured with her, is a construction foreman, earning US$ 15 a day as well. This couple has two children. Mrs. Tuy would like to take out a loan to purchase more grocery products for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for re-sale

loans.name: Choup

texts.en: Choup L., 40, runs a small-size store out of her house, selling groceries like cooked foods and some sweets for kids. She is widowed and has one child, a daughter who is single. To help provide more food for the family's living, her daughter works in a garment factory and currently gets a salary of $70 a month. Choup L. is applying for a loan to purchase more groceries for her store.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Som

texts.en: M., 47, is a widower. He earns a living by raising pigs, which he sells when they mature. He currently lives with his daughter who is a garment worker at a garment factory in Phnom Penh City. M. wants his daughter to stop her work at the garment factory, so he want to provide her with a grocery store to run. Therefore, M. is asking for a $1000 loan for his daughter to use as capital to begin a grocery store. (He and his daughter are pictured.)

loans.use: To start a grocery store

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna F., a 57 year old widow with two children, owns a rice field. Previously, she worked in the Middle East where she bought a small parcel of land. Now, in the Philippines, she would like to expand her business. Her harvest serves both for family usage and business sales.  She sells rice to traders in their village and the profit that she receives from her harvest goes to pay for her family's daily expenses, her children's college fees, and their other needs.

She is asking a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and insecticide. She will also buy quality seeds for her farm. Myrna is also thinking of venturing into other business. Aside from farming, she is interested in trying other possible income areas to support her family's needs.

CEVI provides clients like Myrna not only credit assistance, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticide

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: Moeun S., 59, lives with her niece in the Bati, Takeo Province. She is a weaver and works from her home, earning about USD $10 every day. She weaves scarves and sells them in the market. Her niece has been an English teacher since 2004 and makes around $1.60 per day. Moeun S. would like to take out a loan to purchase silks to weave scarves. She is pictured here behind her niece.

loans.use: To purchase silks to weave into scarves

loans.name: Khin

texts.en: Khin K., 51, is married and lives with her husband in Bati, Takeo province. She is a farmer and raises pigs. On average, she earns around US$3 per day, while her husband stays at home and has a business selling cows. He makes US$27 in revenue each day. This couple has four children, three of whom are construction workers and one who is a student.  Khin K. would like to take out a loan to purchase cows for her husband to resell. (Mrs. K. is pictured with her husband at their home.)

loans.use: To purchase cows.

loans.name: Maylyn

texts.en:
Maylyn B., a 28 year old mother with two children, grows rice for a living. Previously, she previously worked as a personal maid in Bohol. She was not happy with her job so she decided to get married. Her family has been engaged in farming for eight years. Through her family experience, Maylyn knows the importance of fertilizer and insecticide to achieve maximum yield. 

She is asking for a loan from CEVI to buy fertilizer and seeds. She will also use the loan to buy insecticide for her farm. She believes that her loan will bring her a good harvest. Consequently, she will be able to give more support to her children who are currently studying.

CEVI helps Maylyn grow her business. They give all their clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: S., 40, is a palm climber. He taps palm trees for the palm juice, which he then boils to make palm sugar or he turns it into palm wine. He currently earns an average of USD $5 a day to help feed his family. He is married to Mrs. Mom, 38, who is a good housewife, cooking tasty meals and caring for their three children. They live in the Phnom Penh City. All their children are teenagers and attend school. S. requests a loan to purchase a cow to raise for its offspring and to rent out to farmers, providing the family with another source of income.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Ung N., 32, is married and lives in the Bati, Takeo province. She owns a hair salon business in her home and is able to make around US$12 per day. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver. He uses a trailer to transport goods and people. On average, he makes US$10. Mrs. Ung N. would like to take out a loan to purchase cosmetics and other supplies to expand her shop.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and hair salon supplies

loans.name: Nhim

texts.en: Nhim C., 41, (pictured with his wife), has a business selling cows and makes US$50 in revenue every day. His wife is a farmer, who grows rice and vegetables to sell at the market. She earns about US$1.50 per day. The couple has five children and all of them are in school. The business of selling cows is making good money to support the family, thus Mr. Nhim C. is asking for a loan to purchase additional cows for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: S. is 35 years old and lives in Dongkor District of Phnom Penh City, where he makes a daily income by selling ice-cream. He currently uses his trailer-motorbike to transport ice-creams and sell them in and around Phnom Penh City. Most of his clients are pupils. He is married to Creb, 41, who is a rice farmer. The family has three children; two of them are employed as garment factory workers. S.'s family faces a problem with transportation expenses as they always pay for taxis. To solve the problem, S. is requesting a loan to purchase a new motorcycle for the family to ride to work.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Vith

texts.en: Mrs. Vith P. is a villager in Tonle village in Takeo province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Phang Phat, is a construction worker. Since his workplace is far from the house, he usually has to pay a lot of money for a motor taxi to get to work. Thus, Mrs. Vith P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband to go to work. She hopes to reduce the transportation expenses. She is 38 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school. Her husband is with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Chem

texts.en: Chem P., 45, is a true entrepreneur who has a business making wooden boats. He employs other craftsmen in the building of his boats. This business provides him a profit of US$5 per day. His wife makes and sells fermented fish at the market and earns approximately US$5 per day as well. The couple has four children and all of them are students. Mr. Chem P. would like to take out a loan to purchase more wood for his boat-making business.

loans.use: To purchase wood for the boat-making business

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mrs. Yem Y. lives in Tonle village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Touch Pheap, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate both rice and vegetables. Mrs. Yem Y. is a applying a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She has three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other one helps with the farm work. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en: Mr. Chanthol T. lives in the Sophy Village in theTakeo Province. He is employed in a garment factory. He is a 31-year-old father of a child who is too young to work or study. His wife, Mrs. Ney Chorvy, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she breeds pigs and chickens. Even though they try to work hard, they still earn an insufficient income to support their household. Thus, Mr. Chanthol T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to breed in order to earn more income. His wife is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Sary T., 27, (pictured with her niece), is single and resides with sister in the Battambang province. She owns a grocery store, earning around US$5 per day. Her sister stays at home and helps her sell grocery products when needed. Sary T. is asking for a loan to purchase additional grocery products for expanding her store to meet her clients demands.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of grocery products.

loans.name: Voeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Voeurn P. lives in the Skoul Village in the Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder. Since her pig breeding business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food to earn a better income. Her husband, Mr. Nget Chhoeurng, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he uses rice to make wine. Mrs. Voeurn P. is a 39-year-old mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to breed and more pig food

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en: Mrs. Sokunthea S. is a villager in the Thkouv Village in the Takeo Province. She is 29 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Aside from this business, she is a pig breeder as well. Her husband, Mr. Ly Thoeurn, is a motor-taxi driver. Additionally, he is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he has a problem because his field is too far from the irrigation system; thus, Mrs. Sokunthea S. decided to request a loan to buy a pump machine in order to allow water to support the field, making her crops more productive. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine to help irrigate the crops

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en: Mrs. Sophat S. is a farmer in the Boeung Tranh Village in the Takeo Province. She is 43 years old and the mother of eight children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory; another is a vegetable seller in the local market; three are enrolled in the local school; and the remaining two are too young to work or study. Mrs. Sophat S. owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. With this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile which has badly affected her crops. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, and she would use the rest of money to buy a cow for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Sam Chay, is laborer who has been hired the other villagers to pump the water into their field. He is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and to buy a cow

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en: Mrs. Chinda P., a 31-year-old mother of two preschool children, is a resident of Boeung Tranh village in Takeo Province,  where she owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Sean Sambo, is a motor taxi driver.  To earn more income, Chinda is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Song

texts.en: H. is 28 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She presently earns a living by selling dried clam in the village. She normally buys freshwater clam from a market seller, cleaning and drying them, then selling her product to villagers. Her husband assists her in the business. They together have given birth to two children, who are still young and enrolled in the primary school. To make transportation easier, H. is applying for a $1000 loan to buy a motorcycle and a cart to be used for their business activities.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle and a cart

loans.name: Khy

texts.en: Khy S., 49, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She has been running a grocery store to earn a living since 2004, and is able to make around US$8 every day. Her husband is a taxi driver and makes US$8 a day as well. The couple has two children, each with different jobs. Mrs. S. would like to take out a loan to purchase more groceries for her store to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries for the store

loans.name: Kak

texts.en:
Kak L., 54, is married and lives with her husband in the Battambang province. She works in a grocery store, earning around US$5 every day. Her husband is a soldier and makes US$1.50 per day. They also get income from their child who works as a motor-taxi driver.

Mrs. Kak L. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for her son to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and operate a moto-taxi business.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan C. is 32-years-old and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She is a rice farmer and makes about US$3 per day, while her husband earns US$5 by selling salt. She and her husband have two young children. Both of them are in school. Mrs. C. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to begin operating a motor-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and start a motor-taxi business

loans.name: Nol

texts.en: Mrs. Nol N. is a villager in Chhkei Slab village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Kuoy Tha, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice and vegetables. In this plantation, they earn a little income to support their household. Thus, Mrs. Nol N. decided to request for a loan to buy a motorcycle to use as a motor taxi for her husband to earn more income. She is 31 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school, while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is with her in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to use as a motor taxi

loans.name: Laiy

texts.en: Laiy E., 59, lives in the Battambang province with his wife and three of his children. He works as a blacksmith and earns around US$2 per day. His wife, pictured here with their oldest daughter, sells desserts and soft drinks in the village. On average, she earns US$5 per day. This couple would like to take out a loan to invest in a new business selling ice-cream for extra profit.

loans.use: To purchase ice-cream for resale.

loans.name: Talaleu

texts.en: Talaleu T., 43, is married with 6 children. She has 2 years of experience in a plantation business. Her husband does all the farming. She sells to the public 1 day per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (approximately $145 USD). She has no previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Talaleu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All of the loan will be used for her business.

loans.use: To maintain business needs

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en: Chorn S. A., 39, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She is a vendor who sells shoes at the market and earns around US$5 per day. Her husband is a police officer. On average, he earns about US$2.50 per day. This couple has three children and all of them are in school. Mrs. S. A. would like to take out a loan to purchase more shoes to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao S. is 30-years-old and has a business making shoes to earn a living. He uses the wheel of a big truck to make shoes and sells them at the market. On average, he makes US$4 of profit per day. His wife stays at home doing house work and helps him in this activity when needed. The couple has one little child.

Mr. Mao S. would like to ask for a loan to purchase materials to make more shoes.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make more shoes.

loans.name: Nem

texts.en: Mrs. Nem T. lives in Serei Douch village in Takeo province. She is a rice middleman in the local village. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more rice to re-sell to earn more profit. Her husband, Mr. Chhroeung Sun, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivaT. rice. Mrs. Nem T. is 52 years old and the mother of six children, five of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is a laborer. Her husband is with her in the picture.

loans.use: to buy more rice to re-sell

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Moeun R., 52, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She has a business as a wedding planner and makes around US$3 per day. Her work is to prepare clothes for the groom and bride, and then take photos for them when they get married.

Her husband is a painter and he typically makes US$8 a day. This couple has five children, three of whom are in school and two who are employed.

Mrs. Moeun would like to take out a loan to purchase a printer and wedding equipment.

loans.use: To purchase wedding props and a printer

loans.name: Uini

texts.en: Uini F., 35, married with three children, has many years of experience in the taro and banana plantation business, selling to the village people and general public three days per week. Her weekly net cash flow is about 350 Tala ($145).  She has had one previous loan from SPBD, Uini’s only access to capital because she has never qualified for a loan from the traditional banks.  Her loan will be used to improve both her business and home and pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase taro tubers, weed killer, pesticides, chemicals, etc. for her farm.

loans.name: Houy

texts.en:
Houy S. C., 25, is a vegetable vendor at the busy market in the Kampong Cham province. She has had this business for about four years and makes approximately US$4 per day. Her husband is a policeman and earns US$4 a day as well. The couple has one little child who just began attending school.

Mrs. Houy S. C. would like to take out a loan to fix the leaky roof on her house.

loans.use: To fix a leaky roof on the family home

loans.name: Papaloa

texts.en:
Papaloa P., 56, is married with 9 children. She has 4 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public/villagers 4 days per week. She has 5 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 750 Tala (~312 USD).

SPBD loans are Papaloa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Papaloa wants to improve her business in order for it to sustain her and help her family financially.

loans.use: buy chemicals, knives, plant-sprayer, barbed wire, gromozones, and a spade

loans.name: Nut

texts.en:
Nut K. A., 42, is married and sells cakes and candies in the Kampong Cham province. She typically makes US$3.60 per day. She has owned this business since 2005. Before 2005 she was a farmer. Her husband, pictured here, is a motor-taxi driver and earns about US$4.50 every day. The couple has three children, one of whom is a student.

Mrs. Nut K. A. would like to take out a loA. to purchase cashew nuts in bulk and then resell them as a wholesaler to retail customers.

loans.use: To purchase bulk cashews to sell at the market

loans.name: Gaualofa

texts.en: Gaualofa F., 49, is married with 7 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the vegetable business. She sells to the village people and the public 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 70 Tala.  SPBD loans are Gaualofa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Buy vegetable seeds, fertilize, and barbed wire

loans.name: Maeataanoa

texts.en:
K. 70, is a widower with 7 children. He has many years of experience in the shop business. He sells to the villagers and the public 7 days a week. He has 5 previous loans with SPBD. He expects his weekly net cash flow to be 208 Tala.

SPBD loans are K.’s only access to capital because he was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. K. is the only male who has joined the SPBD programme since 2004 and he is one of the most outstanding members in the programme. K. chose to join SPBD when his wife died; he decided to continue what his wife had begun. His loan will be used to buy goods and a new refrigerator for his shop.

loans.use: Purchase goods and a new refrigerator for his business

loans.name: Neneta

texts.en: At the age of 38, Neneta C. has to find ways to earn a living to provide for the needs of her family. Her husband died 2 years ago, leaving her with 6 children. Currently, she is into buying and selling bananas; at the same time, she joins her neighbor in their traditional system of gold mining. Her first and second loans from HSPFI were used for family expenses and helped her finance her small business. She wants to engage in ready-to-wear buying and selling and needs PHP 11,000.00 as capital. She wants to see all her children finish their studies and open up a ready-to-wear store of her own.

loans.use: To purchase ready-to-wear clothing

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Abdugaffor

texts.ru: Абдугаффур серьёзный мужчина ,который уже кредитуется пятый год в Микроинвесте.Он каждый свой займ использует для увеличения ассортимента своего товара.Его товар в основном состоит из книг и канцелярских товаров.Товар привозит из Бишкека.По бизнесу в его отсутствии ему помогает его сын.Как отметил сам Абдугаффур благодаря кредитам у него увеличился оборотный капитал и улучшилось состояние семьи.Его жена нигде не работает ,домохозяйка.
texts.en:
Abdugaffor is a serious man who is taking out loans at MicroInvest for five years. He uses every loan to increase the assortment of his merchandise. His inventory consists mostly of books and stationary supplies. He brings in the items from Bishkek. His son helps him with the business when Abdugaffor is absent. As he pointed out himself, thanks to the loans his working capital has increased and the wellbeing of his family has improved. His wife does not work and is a housewife.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy books

loans.name: Vean

texts.en: Vean C. is 51-years-old and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She owns and also works in a grocery store, making around US$5 per day. Her husband helps her sell the products. She would like to ask for a loan to expand her grocery store by adding more products to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and expand store

loans.name: Rosamoda

texts.en:
33-year-old Rosamonda A. owns a small rice farm. She has two children who are studying; therefore, both she and her husband need to work hard to pay for their children's tuition. Everyday she goes out to check the rice harvest and other crops with her husband.  The rice from harvest feeds her family, as well as helps her earn a small income. She sells her extra rice to a friend who then re-sells the rice at the market. 

Aside from farming, she also opened a small sari-sari store in her village. Her children help manage the store during their spare time. She is asking for a loan of Php 4,000 from CEVI. She will buy fertilizer and insecticide to increase her rice yield. Part of her loan will also be used to increase the merchandise in her store.

CEVI supports Rosamonda to venture into different lines of business. She is provided with CEVI credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
34-year-old Elizabeth J. is a pig breeder and a rice farmer. She invests in these businesses because she loves the work and finds them the most profitable businesses. She wants all of her four children to graduate from college so that they can get good jobs when they grow up. This will help them to better support the needs of their future children when they have their own families.

She is asking a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. She will also buy four piglets and bags of feed for her pigs.

CEVI supports Elizabeth with her growing business. Through CEVI, she enjoys credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
44-year-old Noel B. is a rice grower. Aside from farming, he also raises ducks and chickens. He earns income from selling rice, ducks, chickens and eggs . He is currently single but hopes to get married soon. He is saving money for his future family. 

For 30 years, he has been tilling his family's farm where his parents taught him to grow rice. Part of his harvest is given to his parents while the rest is sold to his friends and rice traders.

He is asking a loan of Php 10,000. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his farm. He is also interested in venturing in other lines of business so that he will have more money to save for his future family.

CEVI gives all their clients credit assistance to support their business. They also provide training and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Boun

texts.en: E., 42, is living in a medium-sized stone house in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She is a homemaker and she cooks delicious meals and cares for the children. She now has two children and is married to Saret, 47, who works as a staff member for an association and currently gets a salary of $200 per month. The family's living conditions are not so comfortable due to their house lacking furniture; therefore, E. is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase furniture to decorate their house.

loans.use: To purchase furniture to decorate their house

loans.name: Peter Rey

texts.en:
Peter Rey L., who is 40 years old with two children, owns a small parcel of land to plant rice. His wife, Rita L., is very supportive of Peter's business efforts. Aside from farming, Peter earns income from driving a 'Sikad,' also known as passenger tricycle. This is a popular form of transportation in the Philippines. For 13 years, he has been farming and driving a 'Sikad'. 

He is asking a loan of Php 10,00 from CEVI. He will use the loan purchase four sacks of rice seeds, two sacks of Urea fertilizers and other farm inputs. His loan will help him obtain the maximum yield from his farm. 

CEVI supports Peter to sustain his businesses. He is provided with credit assistance, training and insurance coverage by joining the CEVI credit program.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda H. is 38 years old with five children currently in school. As a rice grower, she has been tilling her farm for 13 years. She and her husband work happily to increase their harvest. They are doing their best to meet the needs of their family. 

Aside from farming, she breeds pigs. She sold all of them to meat traders in her village. Meat is consistently in demand in the market. She wants to raise more pigs to earn more cash for a living.

She is asking a CEVI loan of Php 10,000 to purchase fertilizer and seeds for her rice farm. She will also use part of her loam to buy feed for her pigs. She hopes that her loan will bring her more harvest and help her grow both her pig and farm businesses. 

CEVI supports Nilda with her business by providing credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en:
Melvin M. is a rice farmer. Every day he touches the wet soil and works under the heat of the sun to ensure that there is enough food for his family. He has gained a wealth of farming experience by tilling his land for 23 years. He wants to increase his yield to support all three of his children. 

He needs a loan of Php 10,000 to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. He dreams of expanding his farm by purchasing another lot of land to plant more rice and earn a greater harvest yield. This loan will provide immense help to Melvin to increase his harvest.

CEVI helps their clients expand their businesses. CEVI provides credit assistance, training and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Mrs. Pha C. is a villager in Serei Douch village in Takeo province. She is a firewood seller. Aside from this business, she is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces a problem because she usually pays a lot of money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox to add to her old one for plowing the field and to reduce her expense.

Mrs. Pha C. is a 45-year-old widow with five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: to buy an ox  for plowing the field

loans.name: Armando

texts.en: Armando D., 38 years old, married with 7 children, lives in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, Southern Philippines. He is striving to cope with the expenses of his family. He started his poultry business with 8 chickens, and  it lasted for 2 years. Due to financial incapacity, he sold some of his chickens and that left him with 4 hens. He is also interested in restoring his variety store for additional income for the family, and that’s why he needs the amount of PHP 11,000 that will be used to purchase grocery items and  for his poultry. This will be his 3rd loan cycle with HSPFI.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for sale and use for his poultry business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Tiem

texts.en:
Mrs. Tiem K. is a villager in Thkouv village in Takeo province. She is a Khmer cake seller. Her husband, Mr. Um Vath, is a construction worker. Aside from this career, he is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. Even though they try to work hard, they still don't earn enough income to support their household.

In order to improve their income, Mrs. Tiem K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She is a 35-year-old mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is with her in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: At the age of 33, Christopher D., married, with 3 children, lives in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, Southern Philippines. He strives to earn money for his family. Currently, he is engaged in the poultry business just like his brother. But the income from their poultry business cannot cope with the expenses they incur every day. That’s why he wants to open a  variety store business and is planning to ask for a loan from HSPFI amounting to PHP 11,000. The money will be  used to build a variety store  and purchase grocery items for re-sale. With this loan, he  may able to  send his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for his variety store and grocery items for sale

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Kem's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is made up of three members, all of whom are residents of Siem Reap Province. R., the group leader, is 54 years old. Her husband's name is Sean, aged 52, and he is a firewood seller. The couple has four children; all of them are married and live separately. R. earns a living by raising pigs and she is famous for her work because she is a responsible person. R. has sold her pigs for the slaughter as usual and now she wants to increase her income. To do that, she needs to raise a larger number of piglets in her pigpen. R. is looking for a loan to buy more piglets for her pigpen for raising.

The other two group members are R., 46, who sells firewood in the village and she is requesting a loan to enlarge her business, and M., 33, who is a Khmer fritter seller and she is applying for a loan to buy more rice for her stock.

loans.use: To buy more pigs into her pigpen for raising

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en: Roberta B. is 45 years of age and a mother of 5. She is married to Paolo B. and lives in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, Southern Philippines. She is a hard working mother who finds many ways to earn money for the family. Early in the morning, she cooks puto, suman biko (Filipino native foods) and peddles them through neighborhoods and nearby villages. She then goes to the river, under the heat of the sun, and mines for gold dust using the traditional system; a bilinganan (Philipino mining tool) and shovel. This request will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI, in the amount of PHP 11, 000.00 to finance the buying gold mining tools and additional capital for her peddling business. She eventually would like to stop in her mining work so that she can take care of her children and be able to send them to school.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making Philippino native food for sale and to buy gold mining tools

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Bui's Group

texts.vi:
Bùi Thị L. A. sinh năm 1981( Mã số: 010105030023 ) gia đình chị có 4 người, vợ chồng chị có một con còn nhỏ. Chồng chị có thu nhập ổn định theo tháng, A. hiện đang là đầu bếp cho một khách sạn ở Hà Nội. Còn chị, hang ngày đi bán hang quà bánh cho học sinh có thu nhập theo ngày. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 4.000.000 vnđ/ tháng.Với món vay trả dần theo tuần là rất phù hợp với gia đình chị và tạo cho vợ chồng chị có thói quen tiết kiệm nên A. chi rất thích và muốn tham gia lâu dài tại tài chính vi mô Bình minh.
Lần vay vốn này, chị tham gia mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư buôn bán nhỏ. Cùng vay vốn với chị còn có: 
 Ngô Thị A. sinh năm 1970, ( Mã số: 010105030019) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đi chợ buôn bán trứng gà, chổi tre,…. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.000.000 vnđ/ tháng.
 Mai Thị N. sinh năm 1957( Mã số: 010105030020 ) . Gia đình chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp, thu nhập bình quân vủa gia đình chị khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.142.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi ao cá.
 Hoàng Thị Thường sinh năm 1958. ( Mã số: 010105030021 ) Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị klhoảng: 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng.
 Vũ Thị Lương sinh năm 1982 . ( Mã số: 010105030024 ) Chị có nghề đan chiếu thu nhập bình quân khoảng 2.500.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để mua nguyên vật liệu đan chiếu.
texts.en:
Bui T. L. A. (ID:010105030023 ) was born in 1981. Her family has four members, with one child at young age. Her husband has a stable monthly salary, he is currently a chef at a hotel in Hanoi. She sells sweets and cakes to school children to get a daily income. The average income of her family is about VND4,000,000 per month. A loan with weekly repayment is suitable to her family and creates a saving habit, therefore she is interested in a long term participation with Binh Minh Micro Finance. In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND4,142,000 for her petty trade. Other members in the group include:

Mrs. Ngo T. A., born 1970 (ID:010105030019), wishes to borrow VND4,142,000 for petty trades (hen's eggs, bamboo brooms, etc). The average income of her family is about VND2,000,000 per month.

Mrs. Mai T. N., born 1957 (ID:010105030020 ). Her family main business is agricultural, with the family's average monthly income of VND3,000,000. She wishes to borrow VND4,142,000 to invest in her fish pond.

Mrs. Hoang T. T., born 1058 (ID: 010105030021 ), wishes to borrow VND4,142,000 to raise chickens. The average income of her family is about VND3,000,000 per month.

Mrs. Vu T. L., born 1982 (ID: 010105030024). She weave mats with average income of VND2,500,000 per month. She wishes to borrow VND 4,142,000 to buy materials for mat weaving.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For petty trades

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Mrs. Phat M. is a villager in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo province. She breeds chickens and ducks. Since breeding ducks is going well, she wants to expand by purchasing more ducks and duck feed to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Pach Ngem, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice. Additionally, he is a construction worker.

Mrs. Phat M. is 38 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is with her in the picture.

loans.use: to buy more ducks and duck feed

loans.name: Norng

texts.en: Mr. Norng N. is a villager in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo province. He is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Tom Ley, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces a problem because her field is far from the irrigation system which has a bad effect on her crop. Thus, Mr. Norng N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump in order to have water to support the field. He is a 40-year-old father of a child who is attending the local school. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a pump for her field

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: P., 40, lives with her child who attends school everyday. P. is married to Vanna who sells ice-cream with his tri-wheel motor. P. owns a house which contains many rooms for renting. Recently, in order to meet her customers' demand, P. wants to build a few rooms upon the available space of her land. To do so, P. is looking for a loan of $700 to build the other rent rooms for another income for her family.

loans.use: To build the other rent rooms

loans.name: Lermie

texts.en: Lermie T. is 31 years old and a mother of 6 children. She is married to Rosalito T., who is a farmer and they live in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, Southern Philippines. She is very determined to earn money for the family. With her first loan from HSPFI amounting to PHP 5, 000, she started a little variety store. Sadly, the business failed due to the unexpected pregnancy of her 6th child. She was able to make a 2nd loan and part of it was used for her  medication . Now, Lermie would like once again to strengthen her variety store and support his husband with improving  the living conditions of their family. With an amount of PHP 11, 000, she will purchase grocery items to sale in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sale in her store.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Norn

texts.en:
Mrs. Norn M. is a villager in Trapaing Kok village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Oun Chrin, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a fisherman to earn their living.

Mrs. Norn M. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, eight more piglets, and to build a piggery for her pig-breeding business. She hopes to increase their income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. She is 59 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, eight more piglets, and  build a piggery

loans.name: Yonn

texts.en: Mrs. Yonn K. is a villager in Krang Chhoeur Neang village in Takeo province. She is a pork seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Sorn Phorn, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a pig breeder. Since his pig business is doing well, he wants to expand it; thus, Mrs. Yonn K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more pigs for breeding to earn more income. She is a 33-year-old mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more pigs for breeding

loans.name: Shabana Shahzadi M. Khalid Group

texts.en:
Shabana Shahzadi Baji is 29 years old, married, and has been a citizen of a historical place called Yadgar of the famous city of Lahore in Pakistan for the past three years. Shabana Baji is an educated lady. She completed her education through the tenth standard. Her parents always felt proud of her because she was a brilliant student in the class. She married a man named M. K. who has a Punjabi food (biryani) selling business. “Biryani” is a dish  made from rice and chicken meat. Pakistani people are fond of this dish. He has been doing this business for the past ten years. Shabana Baji is a very devoted and caring wife. She helps her husband in preparing this dish. She is applying for a loan to buy material (rice and meat) to expand the biryani selling business. 

Shabana Baji is a group leader of other women in her locality. Razia Baji wants a loan to buy another motorbike for their rented motorbikes business. Irshad Baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her parlor. Rashida Baji wants a loan to buy artificial jewelry to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own businesses. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more material for their food selling business

loans.name: Pheas

texts.en:
A resident of Krang Chhoer Neang village in Takeo Province, Mrs. Pheas K. sells chickens in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand by purchasing more chickens to earn more profits. Her husband, Mr. Noup San, is a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which he cultivates rice.

Pheas is 43 years old and the mother of seven children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while four are attending the local school and the remaining child is of preschool age. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to resell to earn more profits.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
44-year-old Epifania V. owns a small rice farm. She lives in Norala, South Cotabato, a town of 40,744 people and 8,263 households. She loves growing rice because her work feeds her three children. Her husband, Joselito V. is also a farmer. They work together to support their daily needs. Aside from farming, they also raise pigs to earn a small profit. 

Epifania is requesting a loan of Php 5,000 to buy fertilizer and seeds. Part of her loan will be used to buy feed for her pigs. One day, she dreams of having a bigger income to send all her children to college.

CEVI supports entrepreneurs to grow their businesses. CEVI provides credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Nhao

texts.en:
A farmer in Chen village in Takeo Province, Mr. Nhao Y. owns a plot of land upon which he cultivates rice to earn a living. Because his soil is now infertile, he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for the land and fuel to operate his irrigation system. He will use the remainder of the loan to hire laborers to work in his field.

Nhao is 50 years old and the father of six children, four of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. His wife, Mrs. Kel Choeurn, shown on the left in the photo, is a chicken breeder.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his land and fuel for his irrigation system, and to hire laborers to work on his field.

loans.name: Khursheed Sadiq Masih Group

texts.en:
Khursheed Sadiq M. keeps herself busy with her clothing business. She buys clothes from Multan and sells in her community and to clothing shops. She is 55 years old and a widow; her husband Sadiq M. died of a heart attack. She is a citizen of a historical place named Yadgar, Pakistan for the past 20 years.  Khursheed is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her sons have an iron business. They make iron rods and sell to different shops. Her daughter reads in 8th standard. Khursheed successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now, she is applying for a loan to buy iron to expand her son’s business. 

She is a group leader for women in her locality. Shamim Baji and Rubina Naz Baji each want a loan to buy iron to sell. Nasreen Baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her business. Khalida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw, a local three-wheeled motor vehicle. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee on each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy iron to sell, scrap to sell and an auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao C., 39, is married to Kheoun, 40, a local construction worker. They have three children, all of whom are still young and attending school. Kheoun works very hard and has profited from his work. Recently, due to the family's expenses, he has been working every day. He would now like to spread his service to more people in Phnom Penh. C. works in a garment factory. She is a responsible mother and good to her family and her neighbors. She is requesting a loan of $200 to buy more construction supplies for her husband. The loan will help her family achieve a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more construction supplies for her husband

loans.name: Bushra M. Afzal Chouhan Group

texts.en:
Bushra Baji is a very hardworking and caring lady. She is 46 years old, married and a citizen of a historical place named Yadgar, Pakistan for the past 17 years. Her husband's name is M. A. C., who runs a grocery shop in the community. She supports her husband by sewing clothes because inflation is increasing day by day and it’s tough to manage the household by one person. She is the mother of five kids: two sons and three daughters. All of her kids are in school located near their house.  She pays the school fees for her kids with the money she earns from sewing clothing. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is applying again for a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

She is a group leader for women in her locality. Zareena Baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Kishwar Sultana Baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Khursheed Begum baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (switches, wires and tube lights) to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The member's mutually guarantee each loan will be paid back. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Eileen

texts.en:
Eileen B. is 37 years old with two children who are currently studying. She happily grows rice on her farm with little concern about doing laborious tasks under the heat of the sun. She works hard to make sure she has enough food for the family. Her husband, Rene B., manages their farm. When Eileen has spare time, she works extra hours in a parlor.

She is asking a loan of Php 8,000 to buy fertilizer and seeds. Part of the loan will be used to start a new business.

Eileen is just one of the thousands of entrepreneurs who are provided assistance from CEVI. As a CEVI client, she has access to CEVI credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement and sand

loans.name: Gulzaran M. Ashraf Group

texts.en:
Gulzaran M. A.  is 46 years old, married and a citizen of a historical place named Yadgar, Pakistan for 2 years. Her husband's name is M. A. who has a scrap business for 10 years. Gulzaran Baji belongs to a very poor family but her parents taught her to live happily in every circumstance. She delivers the same message to her kids. She is the mother of two kids: one son and one daughter. Gulzaran baji runs a grocery shop to pay off the education expenses for her kids because she wishes to give them a good education. She is applying for a loan to buy scrap for her husband’s scrap business. 

She is a group leader for women in her locality. Parveen Baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Zainab Shahnaz Baji wants a loan to pay off the remaining installments of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Jamila baji wants a loan to buy iron to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy scrap

loans.name: Khon

texts.en:
Mr. Khon S. is a villager in Krang Chhoer Neang village in Takeo province. He is a 38-year-old father of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. 

Mr. Khon S. is a cow breeder. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more cows for breeding so he can earn more income. 

His wife, Mrs. Touy Srey, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice.  His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more cows for breeding

loans.name: Uok

texts.en:
Mrs. Uok M. is a villager in Ta Preas village in Takeo province. She is a 29-year-old mother of two children who attend the local school. She breeds ducks to earn income. Her husband, Mr. Mom Horn, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows rice. 

Even though they try to work hard, they still do not earn enough income to provide a better life for their family. Thus, Mrs. Uok M. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her family to use.  Her husband is shown it him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Mussarat Riaz Masih Group

texts.en:
Mussarat baji, a 36-year-old resident of Yadgar area of Lahore, Pakistan, uneducated because of the school's distance from her home, is married to R. M., a factory worker. This mother of two sons, one in the 11th standard and one in the 9th standard, has operated a cosmetics business for the past four years. She has repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for another to buy cosmetics to sell.

Mussarat baji is a group leader of four other women in her locality. Guddu baji, Akbari baji and Safia baji each want a loan to buy vehicular spare parts to sell. Fahmida baji is requesting a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

The funds for this group loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans, so if someone does not repay, the others are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Mrs. Thorn L. lives in Thmey village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Uok Kang, is a farmer who cultivates rice on his plot of land. He has to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow his field, because they have only one ox. To reduce her expenses, Mrs. Thorn L. needs a loan to buy a second ox to help plow the field.  She is 43 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory. The others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: Buy a second ox to help plow a field.

loans.name: Srey Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Mao N. is 29 years old and lives in Tonle village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Em Nop, is an ice-cream seller. Even though they try to work hard, they do not earn enough to support their family. In order to increase their income and improve their standard of living, Mrs. Srey Mao N. needs a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She has two children, one of whom is attending the local school. The other is too young for school or to help with the work. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: Buy a cow for breeding to increase income.

loans.name: Hing

texts.en: Mrs. Hing L. lives in Kos Nhoei village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who cultivates rices on her plot of land. Her husband, Mr. Touch Nan, is a construction worker. They want to build a better house for their family. Mrs. Hing L. is applying for a loan to add to her savings in order to buy building supplies for the house. She is 41 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. The others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: Build a better house.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is a sari-sari store owner (a community-based store) in her village.  She is glad that she is able to earn a weekly income of PHP1,000 that they use for their basic needs.  According to her, financial difficulties have hindered her from improving her business, so she decided to ask for a loan of PHP 5,000 as business capital.  Aside from increasing her merchandise, she is also planning to buy a piglet and start in hog-raising for extra income.  She hopes that her loan will be granted and that she will become really successful someday.  

She is 35 years old and married to Gerry, who works as a welder and "tricycle" (local three-wheeled vehicle) driver in their village.  The couple was blessed with two children: Dennis Jayvee - 9 years old and Reina Grace - 8 years old; both are in elementary level.

loans.use: Buy additional merchandise and a piglet

loans.name: Pol

texts.en: Pol K., 47, lives in Pursat Province. She is married to Nol, 48, who is a fisherman. They have six children: the first two are married and live away from home, two others work in a garment factory, and the last two children attend school every day. The salary of those who work helps with the family's expenses, while K. raises pigs. K. is a very responsible mother, and she has earned a good profit for her family. The many family members live in a small house. So K. is requesting a loan of $500 to build a house for her and her family. K. and her husband are pictured.

loans.use: To buy wood to build her house

loans.name: Presley

texts.en:
Presley C. is from the village of San Lorenzo, Ilagan, Isabela. He is 29 years old and married to Jonalyn who works as an elementary teacher in their public school. They already have a daughter named Alyssa Preslyn, one year old. The couple works hand in hand for the progress of their family.

Presley decided to join ASKI, the MFI providing the loan, in order to improve his store. He came up with this kind of business because he wanted to help his wife to earn a living because her income is limited. He would like to receive a loan of PHP 6,000 that he can use to purchase more stock for his store, and he also plans to buy a piglet to start in the hog-raising business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is currently in the business of selling locally brewed alcohol and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Agnes is 25 years old and is married to a husband who is an administrator in PACT Sudan. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to increase her income.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her business

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Mrs. Channy N. is a villager in Ta Pang Choeurng village in Takeo province. She is a coconut seller. Her husband, Mr. Seim Mech, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, he helps his wife’s business.

Since this couple's business is doing well, they want to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Channy N. decided to ask for a loan to purchase more coconuts; she would use the rest of the loan to fix her truck for her business to earn more income. She is a 30-year-old mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school. Her husband and son are shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts and  fix her truck

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a dealer in cosmetic products by AVON. Engaging in this business is her way of helping her husband in supporting the needs of her family. She also helps her husband in the farm planting "monggo" beans when she is not busy delivering her products. She wants to improve their standard of living through their business; this is her reason why she would like to receive a loan of PHP 5,000 as business capital. One important thing that she considers necessary in order to succeed is time management.

Angelita is thankful for the support she receives from her husband. Their 14-year-old daughter Myla is her inspiration in life. Angelita is hoping that her daughter will persevere in her studies until college.

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
“Helping one another is also building a good and happy family,” says Maricel.

Maricel B. is living in Barangay (township) San Lorenzo with her husband Dante and two children: Marjulaine, 8 years old, grade three and Mark Jay, 2 years old. The family's source of income is farming, which is being managed by her husband while she works as a vendor in their public school.

Maribel sells different kinds of snacks in their village. She is planning to increase her merchandise and sell different flavors of juice and ice candies and some snacks like "banan cue" (sugar coated banana) and sweet potatoes. To fulfill her plan, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 as additional capital. She has been in this business for four years and according to Maricel, she can generate a weekly income of PHP 400 that she needs to budget between family needs and business capital. Her income is not enough but still, it sustains the needs of their family.

loans.use: To increase her range of merchandise

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hog raiser.  In need of financial assistance, she decided to borrow a loan of PHP7,000.  She plans to utilize the loan to purchase feeds for her hogs and buy another piglet.  For three years, her business has been part of her daily routine. She wanted the business to grow and she is hoping that her hogs will always be free from any kind of disease.  

Her husband drives a jeepney driver in their village and they have three children: Richard, 21, a nursing student, Sharon, 17, and Chanda, 15, both high school students.  Marites is hoping that all her children will someday finish their studies and find good jobs before they get married.

loans.use: To purchase feeds supply and piglet

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Mrs. Navy N. is a villager in Pong Toek Choeurng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Kheim Nat, is a laborer who earns only a little income to support his household.

In order to improve their living standards, Mrs. Navy N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She is a 28-year-old mother of four children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is with her in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Darios

texts.en:
Darios is a hog raiser residing in Villa Gamiao.  With his wife as his business partner, hog-raising has become their main source of livelihood. His desire of growing his business leads him to avail a loan of PHP 4,000.  He believes that this amount will generate increased income for his business.  With the income from the business, he can provide the growing needs of his family and hopefully give a better future for their children.  
 
He is married to Analyn and they are living happily together with their two children: Darlene Rose - 4 years old and Gian Carlo - 5 months old.

loans.use: Additional working capital for his hog-raising business

loans.name: Basenta

texts.en:
Basenta P. is currently in the business of selling beer and sugar and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Basenta is 22 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bigger bar. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Additional working capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Pisey

texts.en:
Mrs. Pisey U. is a villager in Thkouv village in Takeo province. She is a Khmer noodle seller. Her husband, Mr. Nak Sam Oeun, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a construction worker.

Mrs. Pisey U. is applying a loan to add to her savings to buy cement and other supplies to build a house for her family. She is 27 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to add her to savings to buy cement and other supplies

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
Leonides sells glutinous rice cakes in their village while her husband Danilo operates their old motorcycle.  Through her business, she was able to assist her husband with their needs. She wants to develop her business because her products are very in demand in their community.  For this, she wants to request a loan amount of PHP5,000 to further develop her business and for the maintenance of their motorcycle .  Leonida said that hard work and humility are very important virtues in order to succeed in life. 

Leonides is already 55 years old and a mother to their three children: Israel -31 years old, Ariel - 30 years old, and Daniel - 28 years old.  Leonides is proud that they have a happy family despite the hardships in life.

loans.use: To repair motorcycle and additional working capital for her rice cake business.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.en:
Salvador H. of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City, Philippines is 50 years old and lives with his wife and seven children, three of whom are still studying in secondary school. He is engaged in a retail business (buying and selling bananas) while his wife has a variety store (sari-sari store) in their residence. He goes to the public market in Cagayan de Oro once a week, about 37 kilometers away, to sell the bananas.

Salvador believes that through their business they could send their children to school and be able to earn sufficient income for the family needs. He decided to join HSPFI to get additional capital for the business. He is requesting a loan of Php 11,000.

loans.use: to purchase more  bananas to re-sell

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, 52, is married to Benjamin, a farmer in their village.  The couple has four children, three boys and one girl.  The eldest is Joel, 32, college undergraduate, Jason, 31, college graduate and currently working as a teacher, Julius, 30, college under graduate and the youngest is Janice, 24, a graduate of Hotel and Restaurant Management.  Her family lives in the village of Divisoria, Santiago City, situated along the national highway and two kilometers from the city proper. Farming is the common livelihood of the residents and some are engaged in different micro-enterprises. 

Cecilia is a food vendor in their village selling different kind of viands.  Aside from food, she also sells used RTW clothes and she is also plants different vegetables in their front yard like eggplant, string beans and tomatoes for extra income.  With her diligence, she can earn at least PHP1,000 a week.   She wants to expand her business so she requests for a loan of PHP5,000 to sustain her business.  She hopes that her income will increase so she can assist her husband in providing their daily needs and household expenses like electric and water bills without depending from their children who already have their own families.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Nely

texts.en:
“Having a timeframe in developing a business is one of the best methods in attaining goals in life,” said Nely.

Nely is a vegetable vendor in her village, and she earns a weekly income of PHP 800.00. She is married to Wilfredo, a good and responsible husband and father to their six children. Her children are Winnie, 31; Nerissa, 29; Joemar, 27; Noel, 24; Winniefredo, 20; and Jocelyn, 18. Their children are all high school graduates and some of them are working as drivers and their eldest is a sales lady in Manila.

Nely dreams of starting a hog-raising business if she can raise enough capital. To fulfill her dream, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 that she will invest in the business. She plans to use the loan to start a hog-raising business and eventually to open a village store. The improvement of her business will help her to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To stare a hog-raising business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. sells beer at a bar and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Agnes is 21 years old and is married. Her husband that is a peasant. They do not have any children. With the loan, she hopes to be able to increases her profits.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Increase her business

loans.name: Borei

texts.en:
Mrs. Borei K. is a villager in Damnak Sangke village in Kandal province. She is employed in a casino club. Since her workplace is far from their house, she usually pays a lot of money for a motor taxi as transport to work.

Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to reduce her transport expense. Her husband, Mr. Tang Kok Heng, is a soldier. Mrs. Borei K. is a 35-year-old mother of a child who is attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan K., 22 years old and the married mother of one preschool-aged child, is currently in the business of selling fried eggs and bread. She is requesting a loan to expand her business, hoping to build houses for rent with the resulting extra profits.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en:
Freddie M. is a responsible husband to his wife Claire and father to their three children: Ken - 5 years old; Kevin Gold - 4 years old, and Kim Devine - 2 years old. Since their children are not yet studying, the couple is doing their best in preparation for their studies. 

Freddie is a college graduate with a degree in Education.  However, due to difficulties in finding a teaching job, he works as a tricycle driver in their community to support his family and save for the children’s education.  Earning a weekly income of PHP 1,400 by simply transporting passengers to and from their community to the city, Freddie now wants to put up a small piggery in their backyard that his wife will manage.  He is therefore requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to pursue this business plan.

“Perseverance and concentration in my work as a tricycle driver is a big challenge; that is why I’m looking forward to the future of my children,” says Freddie.

loans.use: To start a hog-raising business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita owns and manages an internet café located in their village of Barangay Divisoria, Santiago City, just two kilometers from the city proper of Santiago. Thankful that she is able to earn at least PHP 7,500 a month to support their daily family needs and school allowance of their children, she is hoping to expand into electronic loading because some of her customers are looking for a loading station. To cater to this demand, Nenita is now asking for a loan of PHP 6,000.00.

Nenita is married to Nick and they are gifted with five children: Mike Angelo – 10 years old, grade five; Mark Anthony – 7 years old, grade 2; Michael Ian – 5 years old, grade one; Princess – 4 years old, a daycare student. and Precious – 3 years old. Nenita is proud of her children and the fact that they are doing well in their studies. She and her husband are working hard to generate income for the family.

“Hard work and focus on the business are the most important things I do,” Nenita adds as she strives for the success of her enterprise.

loans.use: To fund an electronic loading business.

loans.name: Novelina

texts.en:
Novelina C. is already a widow and she was left with their only daughter Llewelyn, 26 years old and working in the City Hall of Santiago City. Novelina is grateful and proud of her daughter for being responsible in the absence of her husband. 

She manages a sari-sari store (a community based store) business in their village. She is thankful that she is generating a weekly income of PHP1,000.00 that she uses as a rolling capital and to provide their basic needs and some medicines since she is prone to sickness.  Aside from her store, Novelina is also planning to start in the hog raising business for additional income.  With this, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP 5,000.00 that she can use for business expansion.  With her small businesses, she can save something for herself for she does not want to depend too much on her daughter financially, especially when she gets sick.  She hopes that her request will be granted by the lenders.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Perina

texts.en:
Perina A. is currently in the business of selling alcohol and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Perina is 45 years old and is married with a husband that is a peasant. She has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: construct a shop

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 41 years old and married to Efren.  The couple was blessed with three children: Jhonson – 21 years old; Roxan - 18 years old; college student and the youngest is Peter Jhon P. - 6 years old, a Day Care student.  The family is currently living in Barangay Rizal, Santiago City where most women in the community venture into different micro-enterprise like food vending. 

Perlita is engaged in the food vending business selling different viands.  Aside from food, she is also into the direct selling of personal products for males and females for additional income to support the educational needs of her children.  Her weekly income of PHP2,000.00 contributes a lot in their family.  She wants to improve her vending business and plans to put up a small restaurant in the future for them to have a stable source of income.  In order to do this, she must start now.  She is asking for a loan oh PHP5,000.00 that she will use to make it grow.  
	
“I must work hard for the future of my children” said Perlita. She also said that cooperation of her family is one of the keys in uplifting their living condition out of poverty.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong Y. is 55 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. She has two children: one serves as a firewood provider, and another one works and lives separately. Y. is married to Sroe, 33, who grows potatoes in his field. Y. sells groceries, such as cooked food, plastic, and kids' sweets. She wakes up in the early morning for the garment workers' arrival so that she can earn enough money. To help increase the family's income, Y. is requesting a loan to buy more grocery products for her store.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for her store.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena A. sells groceries like biscuits, canned products and other food supplies at Abura. Philomena has received primary level education. She is married and has 3 children; her husband is a building sprayer. Philomena has been selling groceries and food supplies since about 10 years ago. She is responsible for paying housekeeping expenses since her husband takes care of the family’s financial needs. Her loan will be used to buy more groceries and food supplies to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more groceries and food supplies to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace P. is currently in the business of selling cosmetics at the shop and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Grace is 35 years old and is married with a husband that is a news reader in the radio station. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to  begin an agricultural farm.
