BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Initiate agricultural farm

loans.name: Orakwue

texts.en: Orakwe’s store is located inside Alaba International Market, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells DVDs wholesale. Orakwue is 31-years old and married with four children. She is requesting a loan to purchase more DVDs to sell so she can expand her business opportunities. She is very grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more DVD plates

loans.name: Bayarhuu

texts.en: Bayarhuu T. is a 62-year-old woman who lives with her husband. All three of her children are married and have moved out. In 2003, her family moved from Hovd, a western province, to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since she moved in, she bought a children's clothing stall at the "Narantuul" market and began to run a clothing sales business. Narantuul is the biggest market in Mongolia. She took her first loan from XacBank (Kiva's Partner Microfinance institution of Mongolia) in 2006 to buy her second stall at the same market. Bayarhuu is one of best borrower's at XacBank, whose business has expanded quickly in the past few years. With the lunar New Year celebration approaching, small items have sold quickly, therefore she wants a loan to buy more kids clothes to increase her business inventory.  She is hard-working person who is fastidious with her money.

loans.use: To buy more kids clothes to increase her business inventory.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Rose is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has two children, and her children go to school.

With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a shop.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is 38-years old and married with six children. Juliana sells provisions and foodstuffs in her house, and she wishes to expand this business because she is determined to increase the prosperity of her family.  Juliana is requesting a loan so she can increase her inventory and expand her business opportunities. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Sek S., 28, is a mother of two children: both of them are students living in Kompong Tom Province. She is married to Vat, 37, who is a pig raiser. S. sells charcoal to the villagers; she gets wood from the mountain, and then she burns the wood into charcoal. She has been in this business for more than four years, and she has earned a good living. She works very hard and is a responsible mother. S. is looking for a loan to build a house for her and her family. The loan will help her family achieve a better standard of living.

loans.use: To build a house for her and her family

loans.name: 25 -Quảng Hưng Group

texts.vi:
* Nhóm 025 gồm 6 tH.nh viên, sinh sống tại thôn 7 xã Quảng Hưng, là một thôn nghèo của tỉnh Thanh Hoá, cách thị xã Sầm Sơn khoảng 10 Km về phía đông.Chị N. Thị H. là nhóm trưởng, nay chị 40 tuổi, chồng chị là N. Văn Nam, 10 năm nay anh bị bệnh hiểm nghèo nên không có khả năng lao động, một mình chị phải lo cho gia đình từ chi phí sinh hoạt, ăn uống,tiền học cho con. Chị sinh được một cháu trai, năm nay 16 tuổi, vì gia đình quá khó khăn nên chỉ học hết lớp 9 rồi phải nghỉ học để đi học nghề sửa xe ô tô. Chu kỳ này chị vay vốn 3.079.800 VND ~ 180 USD để mua rau giống, phân bón và lợn giống. Các tH.nh viên khác trong nhóm có cùng mức vay .
* Chị N. Thị Tiến mang mã số tH.nh viên 0003 vay vốn để mau rau giống và lợn giống.
* Chị N. Thị Bình mang mã số tH.nh viên 0004 vay vốn để mua rau giống và phân bón.
* Chị Hà Thị Xuân mang mã số tH.nh viên 0007 vay vốn để mua gà giống và thức ăn cho gà.
* Chị N. Thị Bích mang mã số tH.nh viên 0006 vay vốn để mua lợn giống và phân bón ruộng.
* Chị P. Thị Dung mang mã số tH.nh viên 0002 vay vốn để mua rau giống và phân bón.
texts.en:
Group 25 has six members. They live in Village 7, part of Quảng Hưng commune, a poor village in Thanh Hoá province, about 10 km east of the town of Sầm Sơn. Mrs. N. Thị H., 40 years old, is the group leader. Her husband, N. Văn Nam, has suffered from a life-threatening illness for the past ten years and has been unable to work. Thus, she had to find a way to meet the family’s living expenses alone, from buying food to paying her son’s school fees. Because of the family’s difficulties, her son, now 16, had to leave school after ninth grade and go to work as an apprentice auto mechanic. In this lending cycle, she is requesting a loan of 3,079,800 VND (~180 USD) to buy vegetable seedlings, fertilizer, and breeding pigs. The other members of the group are requesting the same amount. Mrs. N. Thị Tiến plans to use her loan to buy vegetable seedlings and breeding pigs. Mrs. N. Thị Bình plans to use her loan to buy vegetable seedlings and fertilizer. Mrs. Hà Thị Xuân plans to use her loan to buy breeding hens and chicken feed. Mrs. N. Thị Bích plans to use her loan to buy breeding pigs and fertilizer for her rice field. Mrs. P. Thị Dung plans to use her loan to buy vegetable seedlings and fertilizer.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vegetable seedlings, fertilizer, and breeding pigs

loans.name: Flara

texts.en:
Flara S. is currently in the business of selling books in the bookshop and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Flara is 25 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has one child, and her child goes to school.  

With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a shop

loans.name: 29 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.vi:
* Nhóm 29 gồm 5 thành viên,sống tại thôn 5 xã Quảng Hưng là một đơn vị nghèo của tỉnh Thanh Hóa cách Hà Nội 156 Km về phía nam.Chị Phạm Thị Thư mang mã số thành viên 0095 là nhóm trưởng.Gia đình chị kinh tế rất khó khăn,chồng chị mất sớm để lại một mình chị nuôi 5 người con ăn học. Chu kỳ trước chị vay vốn để mua gà giống và số gà chị đã được thu hoạch. Số tiền lãi từ chăn nuôi gà chị thu được là 500.000 VNĐ chị dành  cho con đóng tiền học. Chu kỳ này chị vay tiếp mức vay với số tiền là 2.442.600 VND ~142 USD để mua gà giống và phân bón ruộng.Các thành viên trong nhóm cũng có cùng mức vay.
* Chị C. Thị Phúc vay vốn để mua gạo tráng bánh cuốn và bánh đa.
* Chị Q. Thị Tiến vay vốn mua rau về bán.
* Chị N. Thị Chung vay vốn để đầu tư vào cửa hàng tạp hóa.
* Chị N. Thị Hòa vay vốn để mua cá về bán.
texts.en:
Group 29 has five members. They live in Village 5, Quảng Hưng commune, a poor village in Thanh Hóa province, 156 km south of Hà Nội. Mrs. Phạm Thị Thư is the group leader. Her family has faced serious financial difficulties ever since her husband passed away at an early age, leaving her to raise five young children alone. In the previous lending cycle, she used a loan to buy breeding hens and then sold off the additional chickens produced. The profit from that enterprise, 500,000 VND (30 USD), she set aside to pay for her children’s education. In this lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 2,442,600 VND (~145 USD) to buy breeding hens again, as well as fertilizer for her rice field. The other members of the group are requesting the same amount. Mrs. C. Thị Phúc will use her loan to buy rice to make rice pancakes and rice paper. Mrs. Q. Thị Tiến will use her loan to buy vegetables she can sell at the market. Mrs. N. Thị Chung will use her loan to invest in a grocery shop. Mrs. N. Thị Hòa will use her loan to buy fish she can sell at the market.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Breeding hens, fertilizer

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing  is 35-years old and married with three children. Blessing rents DVDs and CDs. She also sells drinks. Blessing wishes to expand and increase her business by adding variety to her inventory, such as weavons, shoes and bags. She is requesting a loan to purchase this new stock which will increase her income. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase new items to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia is 45-years old and she is married with four children. Antonia sells foodstuffs and dried fish in her house. She is optimistic about the continuous growth of her business and improving the well being of her family.  Antonia is requesting a loan to purchase more foodstuffs and dried fish so she can increase the number of customers she serves. She says thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary G. is currently in the business of selling groundnuts at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Mary is 20 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman.She has no children. 

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business and buy more nuts for sale.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business and buy more nuts for sale

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret A. is currently in the business of transporting clothes to the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Margret is 23 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has one child, and her child goes to school.  

With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nyamjamyan

texts.en: Nyamjamyan J. is a 40-year-old woman who has been running a clothing sales business since 2000 at "Narantuul," the biggest outdoor market in Mongolia. Ninety percent of the clothes she sells are sewn by her husband. Her husband used to work at a clothing factory as a cutter and tailor. In 2000, her husband was laid off because of adverse conditions with the business. Nyamjanyan had had her own clothing business since 1996 -- buying clothes at the Chinese border city of Ereen and reselling them at a local market -- but in 2000, they began to run a family clothing business together. Nyamjanyan's husband sews men's suits and topcoats, and she irons and sells them. He sews and she irons 2-3 items per day. The average cost of each suit and coat is MNT 20,000-30,000 (USD $13-20), and they resell them for an average price of MNT 35,000-60,000 ($25-40 USD). When Nyamjamyan took her first loan, her family lived in a "ger" (a traditional nomadic Mongolian home) on a plot of land the family owns. She has one daughter, who goes to elementary school. From their business profits, they built a house to live in. The loan she is taking now is to buy more cloth to make suits and coats.

loans.use: to buy more cloth to make suits and coats

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Folake N. is 42-years old and she is married with four children. Folake N. sells plantains in her shop. She travels to markets in villages like Okada and Ugboghui in Edo state to purchase plantains to sell in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a LAPO client. She is requesting a loan to purchase more plantains to sell so she can increase the number of customers she serves. She says thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more plantains to sell

loans.name: Latifat

texts.en: Latifat is 39-years old and she is married with four children. Latifat is a fashion designer who also sells clothes and tailoring materials. She lives in Akeson, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tailoring materials and one industrial sewing machine. She is very grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva lenders for their financial assistance, which is helping her improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and  one industrial machine

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is currently in the business of selling tea at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Mary is 31 years old and is married. Her husband is an officer with the United Nations Mission in Sudan. She has five children, and her children go to school.  

With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her tea business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mrangi Rangi Group

texts.en:
Mwanahamis K., age 51, is married with five children ages 28, 23, 20, 18 and 16.  She has a chicken business. She started this business in 1996 and works daily from 5:00 a.m. until 11:00 p.m. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $150. 

This will be Mwana’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock from 300 to 500 chickens and has repaid all of the loans successfully. She now hopes for a third loan to open a café to sell snacks and tea.
	
Mwanahamis will share this loan with her loan group, Mrangi Rangi, which has 21 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture,  Mwanahamis is 1st on the left in a pink dress.

loans.use: Increase her stock from 300 to 500 chickens

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is currently in the business of selling shoes at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Mary is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has two children, and her children go to school.  

With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her shoe business and pay for her children's school.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abosede

texts.en: Abosede is 45-years old and married with a child. Abosede sells drinks, bottled water and handkerchiefs in her shop. She has been in this business for many years. Abosede lives in Ilaje, Lagos State, Nigeria.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more drinks and bottled water to sell. She says thank you for helping her improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and bottled water to sell

loans.name: Hol

texts.ru: Давлатов Хол житель города Яван. Имеет высшее образование. Работает учителем в средней школе. Женат но детей не имеет. Кроме работы в школе , он как и многие жители сельской местности занимается земледелием. Имеет участок земли , который засеивает пшеницей и другими видами злаковых культур. Сейчас он должен закупить семена пшеницы  и удобрения , поэтому решил получить кредит . Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hol N. is a resident of Yavan. He has a university diploma and works as a teacher in secondary school. He is married with no children. In addition to his work at school, like many rural residents, Hol is involved in agriculture. He has his own plot of land where he grows wheat and other grains. Now Hol must buy wheat seeds and fertilizers, and he is applying for a loan that he would be able to pay off within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina P. is currently in the business of selling cold drinks at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Elina is 25 years old and is married. Her husband is a laboratory technician. She has no children. 

With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a bus for her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy a bus for her drinks business.

loans.name: Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
Zakia S., age 36, is single with one 4-year-old daughter. She has a beauty salon. She started this business in 2007 and works daily from 8 a.m. until 8.30 p.m. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $371. 

This will be Zakia’s seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her salon's stock. She had opened a retail shop, but she has closed it because she had no helper in that shop. She has repaid all of the loans successfully.  
	
Zakia will share this loan with her loan group, Nia Njema, which has 15 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Zakia is second from the left in orange.

loans.use: Increase salon equipment

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru: Ерова Зебо проживает в городе Яван. Замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Домохозяйка , но занимается животноводством. Имеет хозяйство , где разводит молодых бычков. Откормленных животных ее муж выводит на рынок , где продает по более выгодной цене. В данный момент планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zebo Y. lives in Yavan. She is married with six children. She is a homemaker and she raises bull calves. Her husband sells grown bull calves at a higher price at the market. Zebo is applying for a loan that would allow her to purchase more bull calves. She would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bull calves

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 31-years old and married with three children. Victoria sells clothes, and she wants to expand her business by also selling of palm oil in addition to her clothes business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase the palm oil needed for selling. This will increase her earnings and improve her family's living conditions. She says thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil to sell

loans.name: Vali

texts.ru: Дадоев Вали 1963 года рождения, имеет 3 детей, жена домохозяйка. Вали работает стоматологом в городской стоматологической клинике более 15 лет, лечит зубы и устанавливает протезы. В этом году он планирует выдать замуж одну из дочерей. Дочь студентка и к ней  сватаются много молодых парней. Ему потребуется необходимая сумма что бы докупить  приданное и провести некоторые мероприятия. Он хороший врач и унего много пациентов, но из-за отсутствии электричества потребность его услуги снизилась. Он также работает в одной из частной клиники, где есть  электричество , и он может проводить свои операции. Погашать он планирует от сдельной работы своих услуг. Он благодарен Микроинвест и кредит от КИВА. В дальнейшем планирует получить кредит на открытие своего частного дела.
texts.en:
Vali D. -- born in 1963, married, has 3 children. His wife is a homemaker. Vali is a dentist with 15 years of experience working at the local dental clinic. This year, Vali plans to celebrate a wedding for one of his daughters. His daughter is a college student and many young men wish to marry her. Vali needs this loan to provide for a proper dowry and pay for the wedding party. Vali D. is a good doctor and has many loyal patients. Unfortunately, due to frequent interruptions of electric power in the local clinic, Vali's workload there decreased. As an alternative, Vali D. is working at a private clinic where he can work without interruption. Vali thanks all Kiva lenders for their generosity and hopes to apply for another Kiva loan soon to finance opening of a private practice.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For weddings

loans.name: Adiru

texts.en:
Adiru C. is currently in the business of selling fruits like guava and mangoes at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Adiru is 20 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has one child, and her child do not go to school.  

With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a tractor that will be used for plowing at the farm.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy a tractor for plowing on the farm

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo is 55-years old and married with three children. Titilayo sells provisions, bottle water, and drinks, a business she's been doing for many years. Titilayo is requesting a loan to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. This will improve her income and help her better provide for her family. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Saifullo

texts.en:
Saifullo A. is 42 years old. He is married with three children. He and his family live in Khujand city. Saifullo rents a minivan and offers transportation services. His business is the only source of income for the family. Saifullo has been in this business for 18 years and has gained rich experience on driving. To be able to decrease the expenses for  fuel and consequently to reduce the fees for his services, Saifullo is planning to replace the fuel supply system on his minivan. He is requesting a loan of $800 USD. Saifullo thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: To a new fuel supply system for his minivan

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Composé de sept femmes(dont trois enseignantes), les membres du groupe Benkadi de l’association Lafia sont tous mariés et ont une  moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec les sœurs, frères, enfants et époux dans le village de Tinimbougou dans la préfecture de Dioïla région de Koulikoro république du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des relations amicales. Elles font principalement la vente d’habits.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire le besoin de la clientèle, elles ont intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles veulent acheter avec ce prêt, 40 pièces de six pagnes auprès des fournisseurs de Dioïla pour les revendre en détail  au comptant et à crédit dans le village de Tinimbougou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Ces femmes espèrent avoir avec ce prêt 7 000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune, qu’elles  utiliseront pour l’épanouissement de leur activité.
texts.en:
Composed of seven women (out of which three are teachers), the members of the Benkadi group of the Lafia association are all married and average 26 years of age and 2 children. They live in extended traditional families, with their sisters, brothers, children and husbands, in the village of Tinimbougou in the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, in the Republic of Mali. They got acquainted through bonds of friendship, and their businesses mainly consists in selling clothing.

Anxious to better satisfy their customers' needs, they joined Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan). All previous loans were repaid without problems. With this new loan, they intend to buy 40 bundles of six pagnes (colorful African cloth) from furnishers in Dioïla, to retail them for cash or on credit in the village of Tinimbougou, to a clientele comprising men and women. These women hope to turn a monthly profit of XOF 7'000 (ca US$ 14) each, to be used to bolster their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and retail pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena sells food and groceries. Philomena opens her shop daily from 7am to 10pm. Philomena is 30 years old and is married with 4 children. She is enthusiastic and optimistic about the future of her business and that of her family. Philomena hopes for the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more food and groceries to sell. She expresses her profound gratitude to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more food and groceries to sell

loans.name: Davlatnisso

texts.ru: Ибрагимова Давлатниссо проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 40 лет, замужем и имеет четверых детей. Домохозяйка , занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет участок земли , где засеивает пшеницу . Планирует получить кредит сроком на 8 месяцев. А использовать деньги планирует для покупки семян и удобрений.Если она сможет  вовремя закупить качественные семена , то сможет получить качественный урожай.
texts.en:
Davlatnisso I. lives in Yavan. She is 40 years old and is married with four children. She is a homemaker and is involved in agriculture. She owns a plot of land where she grows wheat. Davlatnisso I. would like to receive an 8-month loan that she would use for buying seeds and fertilizer. If she buys quality seeds in time, she will be able to get a good harvest.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Abdugani

texts.en:
Abdugani E. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the town of Khujand. Abdugani is an animal farmer. He owns cows and, with the help of his wife and children, sells their milk. In order to further develop his business, Abdugani wants to take out a loan and buy one or two more cows and feed for them. After fattening them up, he will be able to sell them for a more favorable price. Then Abdugani will be able increase his business and  use some of  the profits for the wedding of his elder son. He is asking for a loan of $800 for this purpose. He will repay the loan in 5 months.

loans.use: To purchasing  cattle for developing his business

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Tous mariés, les membres du groupe Danaya de l’association Lafia  ont en moyenne 31 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies à Tinimbougou, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro  république du Mali. 
A travers les relations de mariage, ces femmes se sont connues et font essentiellement l’achat vente des fruits et légumes.
Dans l’intention de développer leurs activités afin de satisfaire plus de clients elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ces femmes comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 250kg de papayes, 130 kg d’orange et 50 kg de carottes. Elles achètent ces fruits dans les jardins de Tinimbougou et ses villages environnants pour ensuite les revendre sur le marché de Dioïla en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Ces femmes espèrent avoir avec ce prêt, 10 000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune, qui leurs permettra d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires des enfants.
texts.en:
All married, the women of the Danaya group of the Lafia association average 31 years of age and 4 children. They live in extended traditional families in Tinimbougou, prefecture of Dioïla, Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali. They got acquainted through marital bonds, and their businesses mainly consist in buying and reselling fruits and vegetables. In order to bolster their businesses to satisfy a larger number of clients, they decided to join Kiva's partner, the microfinance organisation Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan). Previous loans were repaid without problems.

These women intend to use the loan to buy 250 kilograms of papayas, 130 kilograms of oranges, and 50 kilograms of carrots. They buy these fruits and vegetables in the gardens in Tinimbougou and in the surrounding villages, to retail them at the Dioïla market, for cash or on credit, to a clientele comprising men and women. They hope to turn a profit of XOF 10'000 (ca US$ 20) each, to be used to improve the living conditions of their children, especially on the food front.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and retail fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nurmuhammad

texts.en:
Raising calves is a very common business in the village of Somgor in Khujad city. Nurmuhammad N.  has dedicated himself to this business with great effort in order to provide for his wife and three school-age children. To support his nuclear family, he sporadically purchases calves to raise them, fatten them, and then sell them or butcher them to sell the meat. Today, his major need is to acquire a calf for his business. For this reason Nurmuhammad asks for a loan of $500 to buy more cattle to make his family’s sustenance possible.

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle for developing his business

loans.name: Sharaf

texts.en:
Sharaf O. is 47 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Sharaf owns a successful clothing sales business at the market in Khujand, Tajikistan. She has had this business for about 7 years. Her business has benefited from a good sales location and constant demand for her products. Sharaf tries to offer good prices to her customers while still making a profit. A normal monthly income from her business is around $ 300 USD. Sharaf has requested a loan of $ 800 USD with the term of 12 months to increase her product inventory. By purchasing additional inventory, Sharaf will be better prepared to meet increased demand. Her perseverance and natural liveliness will help her continue to succeed in her trade and repay this loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for the  purpose of developing her business.

loans.name: Kokadie Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Kokadiè sont tous des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et  5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies  dans le village de Tinimbougou, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro république du Mali.  
Unies par des relations professionnelles, elles font l’achat et la  vente  du charbon de bois. 
Dans le souci d’avoir assez de charbon de bois en stock et de mieux servir les clients, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro  Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ces femmes comptent acheter, 4 tonnes de charbon de bois auprès des producteurs charbonniers du village de Tinimbougou et environnants pour ensuite les revendre au comptant sur place dans le même village aux grossistes venant de Dioïla.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune avec ce prêt, 11 000 FCFA de bénéfice qui servira à développer leur commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Kokadiè group are all married women who average 30 years of age and 5 children. They live in extended traditional families in the village of Tinimbougou, Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali. Linked by professional bonds, their businesses consist in buying and reselling charcoal. Anxious to have enough charcoal in stock to better serve their customers, they decided to join Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan). All previous loans were repaid without problems.

These women intend to buy 4 tons of charcoal from producers in Tinimbougou and in the surrounding villages, to resell it for cash or on credit in the same village to wholesalers coming from Dioïla. They foresee turning a profit of XOF 11'000 (ca US$ 22), to be used to bolster their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell charcoal

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia N. is married and has 4 dependants. She has received schooling through primary level. Cynthia sells groceries like biscuits, canned products and others at Abura, which she has done for about 5 years. Her husband is a carpenter. Cynthia uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses since her husband takes care of the family’s financial needs. Cynthia will use the loan to purchase more groceries to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cynthia plans to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Cynthia will use the loan to purchase more groceries to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Egamberdi

texts.en:
Egamberdi S.  is a gentleman who dedicates himself to the business of farming and livestock. Egamberdi is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today, thanks to his example, are working adults. The necessity that he is currently faced with is the need to invest in the purchase of cattle. For this reason he is seeking a loan of $700to purchase cattle to sell. Egamberdi is grateful to everyone supporting him.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to develop his business

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 32 years old and is married with 5 children. Charity lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells food and she hopes to expand her business and increase her profits. Charity hopes for the loan of N50,000 ($350 USD) to purchase more food to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Muhamatzair

texts.en:
The business activity from which Muhamatzair U.  makes a living is the breeding of livestock. He started this business 5 years ago with a small number of livestock, but as his business has developed, he has acquired greater quantities of animals for their eventual sale. According to Muhamatzair, he works very hard so that he can maintain his three children. For that reason, he is always looking for a way to improve the living conditions of his family. Currently Muhamatzair needs a loan of $800 USD in order to purchase more cattle and to later resell them after breeding. This will allow him to fully meet the needs of his family and educate all three of his  children.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle for developing his business

loans.name: Chizoba

texts.en: Chizoba sells groceries, drinks and food. Chizoba is a LAPO client. She hopes for a loan of N50 000 ($350 USD) to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell.She is 41 years old and is married with 4 children. She says "thank you."

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and groceries to sell

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kototala est composé des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et  3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles dans le village de Tinimbougou, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro  république du Mali. 
Ces femmes exercent essentiellement le commerce de condiments alimentaires.
Afin de satisfaire leur clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 200kg de sel de cuisine, 130kg d’oignon, 10 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi et une grande quantité de condiments divers. Ces produits sont achetés sur le marché de Dioïla avec les grossistes et revendus dans le marché local de Tinimbougou en détail au comptant et à crédit. Leur clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elles envisagent avoir 8 000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune  qui sera utilisé pour agrandir la taille de leur activité.
texts.en:
The Kototala group is made up of married women who average 26 years of age and 3 children. They live in traditional families in the village of Tinimbougou, prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali. Their businesses essentially consists in selling food condiments.

To satisfy an ever-increasing clientele, they decided to join Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan). Former loans were repaid without problems. With this loan, they intend to buy 200 kg of salt, 130 kg of onions, 10 packs of 100 "Maggi" bouillon cubes, and a large amount of various condiments. These products are purchased from wholesalers at the Dioïla market, and retailed at the local market in Tinimbougou, for cash or on credit, to a clientele comprising mostly women. They foresee turning a profit of XOF 8'000 (ca US$ 16) each, to be used to expand their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and retail condiments (salt, onions, bouillon cubes, ...)

loans.name: Shazada

texts.en:
Shazada A. is a dynamic and ambitious 42-year-old woman. She is married and has two children. For 6 years she has had a small business processing dried apricots. Thanks to the quality of her products and the experience she gained in this sphere of business, she has earned a solid reputation among her customers and the demand for her goods has grown.  This has allowed Shazada to contribute significantly to the household. Now Shazada requests a loan of $550 USD for the term of 8 months. She is going to use the loan to purchase dried apricots with the purpose of processing and reselling them. Shazada hopes that she will continue providing for her children so they will be able to get an adequate education. She expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase dried apricots for processing and selling.

loans.name: Jalgash

texts.ru: Искандаров ДЖалгаш житель города Яван. Работает в средней школе, учителем.Кроме того, чтобы обеспечить свою семью он занимается растениеводством. Сажает овощи , а затем продает на рынке. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить семена и удобрения. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 8 месяцев.Он женат и имеет пятерых детей.
texts.en:
Jalgash I. lives in Yavan. He is a high school teacher. In order to provide for his family, he grows fruit and vegetables at the market. He plans to get a loan in order to purchase seeds and fertilizer. He would be able to pay off the loan within 8 months. Jalgash is married with five children.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Wassa Group

texts.fr:
Elles sont toutes mariées, les membres du groupe Wassa  ont  en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies  dans le village de Tinimbougou, préfecture de Dioila région de Koulikoro, république du Mali. 
 Avec l’idée de développer leurs activités commerciales, ces femmes ont intégré l’institution  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Tous les précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles veulent acheter avec ce prêt, 30 pièces de 6 pagnes auprès des commerçants grossistes de Dioila pour être revendus en détail au comptant et à crédit dans le village de Tinimbougou. La clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Ces femmes espèrent  avoir avec ce prêt,  7500 FCFA de bénéfice chacune qui sera utilisé dans l’entretien de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
All married, the women of the Wassa group average 32 years of age and 3 children. They live in extended traditional families in the village of Tinimbougou, in the prefecture of Dioïla, Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali. In view of bolstering their businesses, these women joined Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and are seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan). All former loans were repaid without problems.

With this loan, they intend to buy 30 pieces of 6 pagnes (colorful African cloth) from wholesalers in Dioïla, to retail them for cash or on credit in Tinimbougou. Their clientele comprises both men and women. With this loan, these women hope to turn a profit of XOF 7'500 (ca US$ 15) each, to be used to provide for their children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and retail pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora A. lives in Kanibadam town in the  Sugd region. Her husband works far away from home. Currently he is in Russia. Together they have four children, two of whom are school age. Nigora has to spend a lot of money on their education considering that her husband doesn’t earn enough money. She is responsible for caring for 2 cows and 4 sheep. Now Nigora wants to borrow $700 USD to buy more calves. She hopes that with her loan she will be able to earn more and cover all the expenses of her children.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key place along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Badenya est composé des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et  5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans le village de N’Tobougou dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec les sœurs, frères, enfants et époux. Le village de  N’Tobougou fait partie de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro république du Mali.
Elles se sont connues à travers les activités agricoles hivernales et exercent essentiellement le commerce de condiments alimentaires. 
Pour développer leur commerce et générer plus de profits, elles ont intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Ces femmes comptent acheter, 500kg de sel de cuisine, 80 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi, 200kg de feuilles de baobab séchées et une grande quantité de condiments divers. Une partie de ses  produits est achetée sur le marché de Dioïla et l’autre partie dans le village de N’Tobougou et environs. Tous les produits sont revendus sur le marché de N’Tobougou au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes.
Ces femmes espèrent avoir 20 000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune qui sera utilisé pour renforcer  leur activité.
texts.en:
The Badenya group is made up of married women who average 34 years of age and 5 children. They live in the village of N’Tobougou, in extended traditional families, with sisters, brothers, children, and husbands. The village of N’Tobougou is located in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region, in the Republic of Mali. They got acquainted through winter farming activities, and mainly deal in selling food condiments.

In order to bolster their businesses and make more profits, they joined Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their fifth solidarity loan (group loan). Previous loans were repaid without problems. These women intend to buy 500 kg of salt, 80 packs of 100 "Maggi" bouillon cubes, 200 kg of dried baobab leaves, and a large amount of various condiments. These products are purchased in part at the Dioïla market, and in part in N’Tobougou and in the surrounding villages. All goods are resold at the N’Tobougou market, for cash or on credit, to a female clientele. These women hope to turn a profit of XOF 20'000 (ca US$ 40) each, to be used to bolster their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and retail condiments (salt, bouillon cubes, dried baobab leaves ...)

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice sells groceries, drinks and sachet (bottled) water. She has been in this business for a long time. She 60 years old and she is a widow with 4 children. She is saddled with the responsibility of taking care of her children. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profits. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 ($350) to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says "thank you."

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and groceries to sell

loans.name: Ominajon

texts.en:
Ominajon B. is 54 years old. She is married with four children. Since she has lived with her husband, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle. She walks through the farms and several settlements to buy cattle at the lowest price to be able to increase her profits. She currently has two cows and four calves. Now Ominajon wants to expand her business. Since her children are grown up, she thinks that she will be able to look after more cattle with their help.  She asks for a loan of $800 USD for the term of 9 months in order to purchase cattle. Ominajon expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 42 years old and is married with 3 children. Esther sells local gin. The demands for her local gin are high within her community. Esther needs a loan of N50,000 ($350) to purchase more local gin to sell. She says "thank you."

loans.use: To purchase more local gin to sell

loans.name: Adiru

texts.en:
Adiru V. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Adiru is 20 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has two children, and her children go to school.  

With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a lorry for hire.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy a lorry for hire

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Benkadi sont  en majorité mariées. Elles ont  une moyenne d’âge de 23 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans la ville de Dioïla région de Koulikoro république du Mali. Elles se sont connues  par des relations de commerces.
 Dans le souci d’améliorer leurs activités elles ont adhéré à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire. Aucun prêt précèdent n’a fait l’objet de mauvais remboursement. 
Avec ce dixième prêt elles comptent acheter, 600 kg d’aubergines, 280 kg d’oranges, 120 kg de papayes et une grande quantité de légumes vertes. Elles achètent ces produits dans les jardins potagers de Dioïla pour les revendre dans la même ville au grand marché en détail au comptant et à crédit. Leur clientèle est composée de restauratrices, de ménagères et les amateurs de fruits et légumes.
 Elles comptent obtenir avec ce prêt un  bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
Most of the women in the Benkadi group are married. They average 23 years of age and 3 children. They live in nuclear traditional families, with their children and husbands, in the city of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali. They got acquainted through business bonds. Anxious to improve their businesses, they joined Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their tenth solidarity loan (group loan). None of the previous loans was affected by bad reimbursement.

With this loan, they intend to buy 600 kg of eggplants, 280 kg of oranges, 120 kg of papayas, and a large amount of green vegetables. They purchase these products in vegetable gardens in Dioïla, to retail them at the grand market of that same city, for cash and on credit. Their clientele mostly comprises women working in the food serving business, housewives, and people fond of fruits and vegetables. They foresee turning a profit of XOF 35'000 (ca US$ 70), to be used to provide for their children's school expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and retail fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
En majorité des femmes mariées, les membres du groupe Benkola ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et  4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec les sœurs, frères, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le village de N’Tobougou dans la préfecture de Dioïla région de Koulikoro république du Mali.  
A travers les relations coutumières ces femmes se sont connues et ont décidé de travailler en commun dans le cadre de l’épanouissement de leurs activités génératrices de revenu avec pour créneau le commerce du bois de chauffe.  
Après quatre prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) tous correctement remboursés, elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles comptent acheter, 7 tonnes de bois de chauffe auprès des fournisseurs de N’Tobougou. Elles revendent au comptant aux grossistes qui viennent hebdomadairement de Dioïla dans le marché local de N’Tobougou. 
Elles espèrent générer avec ce prêt 7 000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune, qui sera utilisé pour les frais de santé et d’habillements des enfants.
texts.en:
Most being married women, the members of the group Benkola average 30 years of age and 4 children. They live in traditional extended conjugal families with sisters, brothers, children, and spouses. These women reside in the village of N’Tobougou, Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali. They know one another through customary ties and have decided to work together in the framework of fully developing their income-generating businesses having a niche in firewood commerce.

After four group loans (solidarity loans), all correctly repaid, the women are on their fifth solidarity loan with Soro Yiriwaso. They plan to buy seven tonnes of firewood from suppliers in N’Tobougou. The women sell the goods to wholesalers who come each week from Dioïla to the local marketplace in N’Tobougou. With this loan, the group members each hope to generate a profit of 7,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover the cost of health care and clothing for the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. is currently in the business of selling smoked fish at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Rose is 27 years old and is married. Her husband is a fisherman. She has one child, and her child does not go to school.  

With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a house for rent

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce S., married with three children, received schooling through junior high. Married to a trader, Joyce has sold used clothing at Abura for the past three years, using her income to pay for house-keeping expenses since her husband takes care of the family’s financial needs. Joyce will use the loan as additional capital to increase the sale of fried fish to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce plans to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Joyce will use the loan to purchase as additional capital to enable her increase the sale of fried fish to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Anuncio

texts.es:
El Sr. Anuncio G. de 63 años de edad esta casado con la Sra. Juana Ramirez 58 años, ellos tienen 2 hijas.

Don Anuncio se inició en este negocio con un pequeño capital vendiendo aceite para motos, aproximadamente en el año 1.979.- Tiempos despues decidió aprender mecanica para motos, y decidió montar un taller mecánico, para fortuna de él era el unico la zona, aprovechando de esa forma para ofrecer sus servicios, hoy en dia ya tiene su clientela formada. 

El Sr. Anuncio invertiría este crédito para comprar más mercaderías, para que de esa forma sus clientes encuentren la solución en su taller.
texts.en:
Mr. Anuncio G. is 63 years old and married to 58 year old Juana Ramirez. They have 2 daughters. Anuncio began this business around 1979 with only a little money selling oil for cars. A hosrt time later he decided to learn how to be a car mechanic and decided to open a car repair shop. Fortunately he was the only shop in the area, so he took advantage of this situation to offer his services, resulting in what is today a well-established clientele. Anuncio will invest this loan in buying more merchandise so that his customers find the solution to their problems in his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Sharifjon

texts.en:
Sharifjon M. is the father of four adult children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation, and after much time, he has been able to get ahead in business through the purchase of animals to breed on his property. His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It's for this reason that Sharifjon is asking for a  loan of $800 USD for the purchase of animals so that he may breed them.
