Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase animals for breeding and sales

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya ont une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales nucléaires  dans la ville de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro république du Mali.  
Par des liens professionnel, et de voisinage elles se sont  connues et exercent la même activité à savoir la restauration.
 Dans l’objectif de mieux rentabiliser leur activité, en faisant des achats en gros, elles ont intégré l’institution  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles  sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire. Les précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt,  1 tonne  de riz, 100kg d’oignons, 20 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi et une grande quantité de condiments divers. Les produits sont achetés avec les grossistes de Dioïla et sont utilisés dans la restauration. Elles font  toutes sortes plats alimentaires qui sont appréciés par la clientèle composée d’employés de commerce du marché, des manœuvres, des chauffeurs et de voyageurs. 
Elles envisagent réaliser avec ce prêt 40 000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune qui sera utilisé pour aider les époux à subvenir aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The members of the group Danaya average 28 years of age and 2 children. They live in nuclear conjugal families in the village of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali. They know one another by community and profession ties, and they do the same work, namely food catering.

With the goal of make their business more profitable by buying in bulk, they have joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their tenth solidarity loan. The preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The group members plan to use this loan to buy: 1 tonne of rice, 100 kg of onions, 20 packets (100-count each) of Maggi bouillon cubes, and a large quantity of various condiments. The goods are purchased from wholesalers in Dioïla and are used in preparing meals of all sorts, which are appreciated by customers composed of marketplace personnel, laborers, drivers, and travelers.

With this loan, the group members each envision realizing a profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used to help their spouses to cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food catering

loans.name: Asikolaye

texts.en:
O. sells food. She travels to Edo State to buy her goods, a journey of about 5 hours by bus, and she travels to the market twice a month. O. sells palm oil. O. is 40 years of age and she has 3 children. O. has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past year and she lives in Igbo-leren, Lagos. 

O. needs a loan of N50,000 ($350) to purchase more food to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina A. is currently in the business of selling goats and sheep and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Regina is 32 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. She has four children, and her children go to school.  

With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more goats and sheep for sale.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more goats and sheep for sale

loans.name: Elsie

texts.es:
La Sra. Elsie V. de 36 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Heriberto Zarate de 39 años, ellos tienen un hijo que esta cursando sus estudios primarios. 

Doña Elsie empezó este negocio aproximademente en el año 2.004; con el capital que pudieron juntar del ingreso que tiene el señor, empezaron a comprar uno a uno las máquinas cada ves que podian, hasta que llegaron a comprar las máquinas básicas para poder empezar a trabajar, en la actualidad le provee muebles a dos personas, todo el tiempo.

La Sra. Elsie utilizaría este crédito en comprar más mercaderías, para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elsie V. is 36 years old, married to Heriberto Zarate who is 39 years of age, and they have one child who is in primary school. Elsie started her business in the year 2004 approximately. With the capital they were able to gather from her husband’s income, they began to buy machines one by one as they were able. They managed to buy the basic machines necessary to begin working. Currently, she provides furniture to two people at all times. Elsie will use this loan to purchase more merchandise to satisfy her customers’ demands.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase lumber.

loans.name: Kolabena Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf femmes du groupe Kolabena sont toutes mariées avec en moyenne 27 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Tobougou, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro république du Mali. 
 Elles se sont connues par des relations de voisinage et de parenté et exercent comme activité génératrice de revenu, l’achat et la vente de céréales. 
Afin d’améliorer leur activité commerciale, elles ont intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Tous les précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ces femmes comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 2 tonnes de maïs, 1 tonne de sorgho et 400kg de haricot. Ces produits sont achetés dans le village de N’Tobougou avec les producteurs de céréales pour être ensuite revendus sur le marché local de N’Tobougou en gros et en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de consommateurs et de revendeurs. 
Elles espèrent réaliser avec ce prêt, 15 000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune  qui  permettra de subvenir aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
The nine women of the group Kolabena are all married and average 27 years of age and four children. They live in traditional extended conjugal families in the village of N’Tobougou, Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali. They know one another through family and community ties, and they work to earn an income in the buying and selling of grain

To improve their commerce, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their fifth solidarity loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The women plan to use this loan to buy: two tonnes of corn, one tonne of sorghum, and 400 kg of beans. The goods are purchased in the village of N’Tobougou from grain producers and then are sold at the local market of N’Tobougou, wholesale and retail, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of consumers and retailers.

With this loan, the group members each hope to realize a profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will enable family expenses to be covered.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain

loans.name: Salune Ibrahim

texts.en: T. is 42 years old and is married with 4 children. T. sells cooked food in her shop at Shibiri Junction, T.’s business is doing well because of her location. There are dozens of motorcycles riders (okada) eating in her shop. This testifies to the high demand for her business. She is asking for a loan of N50,000 ($350) to buy more food and sachet (bottled) water to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more sachet (bottled) water and food to cook and sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary F., married with children, has been selling fried fish at Abura for about four years. She is responsible for paying house-keeping expenses since her husband takes care of the family’s financial needs. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of used clothing to meet increased customer demand. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her increase the sale of used clothing to meet the increase in demand by her customers.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La Sra. Estela D. de 48 años de edad esta casada con el Sr. Aniseto Cespedes de 50 años, ellos tienen 3 hijos, 1 de ellos esta cursando sus estudios secundarios, los demas ya estan trabajando.
Doña Estela empezó con este negocio aproximadamente en el año 2.005.- con un pequeño capital que poco a poco ahorró de su venta de ropas como macatera, ella decidió abrir para su copetin debido que tiene su local cerca de un colegio, donde tiene gran concurrencia de los alumnos y otras personas, gracias al buen trato y servicio que ofrece.
La Sra. invertiría este crédito para comprar más mercaderías para ofrecer variedades de productos a sus clientes
texts.en:
Estela D., 48, is married with Aniseto Cespedes, 50; they have three children: one is in high school and the other two are already working. Estela opened her business around 2005 with a small amount of capital which she had saved little by little from her street-vending clothing sales business. She decided to open a cafe as she is near a high school where there is a lot of foot-traffic of students and other people, thanks to the good treatment and service which she offers. She will invest this loan in the purchase of more merchandise in order to offer a greater variety of products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to retail

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe Sabaly de l’association Benkadi  est composé de huit femmes qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Tobougou dans la préfecture de Dioïla région de Koulikoro république du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce et de parenté.
 Dans l’objectif d’augmenter le volume de leur stock elles ont adhéré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
 Ces femmes comptent acheter, 600 sacs de charbon de bois auprès des charbonniers de N’Tobougou et environs. Les charbons de bois sont revendus en gros et au comptant dans le village aux grossistes venus de Dioïla. 
Elles comptent avoir, 10 000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune  qui  servira à acheter des petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The Sabaly group of the Benkadi association is made up of eight women who average 35 years of age and 6 children. They live in extended traditional families in the village of N’Tobougou, in the prefecture of Dioïla, Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali. These women got acquainted through bonds of business and kinship. With the goal of bolstering their stock, they joined Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their fifth solidarity loan (group loan). The previous loans were repaid without problems. These women intend to buy 600 sacks of charcoal from producers in N'Tobougou and in the surrounding villages. Charcoal is then resold, for cash, to wholesalers coming from Dioïla. They intend to turn a profit of XOF 10'000 (ca US$ 20) each, to be used to purchase small ruminants.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell charcoal

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en: Folashade sells groceries and drugs in her shop. She learned the business in 3 years and she has been in the business for the past 10 years. Folashade is 39 years old and is married with 5 children. Folashade lives in Igbo-leren. Folashade needs a loan of N 50,000 ($350) to purchase more groceries and drugs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drugs

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
El señor Hernan B. tiene 46 años, y esta casado con la señora Maria Roman tambien de 46 años de edad, ambos son padres de 2 hijos, y les gustaría que estudien medicina.

El cliente se dedicaba a la explotación de madera, y hace 5 años decidió cambiar de rubro y montó una gomeria, el cual progreso rápidamente, ya que su domicilio cuenta con muy buena ubicación, sobre una Ruta internacional, en donde circulan muchos vehículos de mediano y mayor porte.

El dinero del prestamo será invetido para la compra de cubiertas, y tiene proyectado para el futuro vender repuestos para vehiculos y ampliar su local.

Desea que el pais invierta más en crear industrias para aprovechar mejor la producción agricola y crear fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
Hernan B. is 46 years old and married to Maria Roman, also 46. They are the parents of two children and they would like them to study medicine. The client was in the lumber business and five years ago decided to change businesses and opened a tire centre which grew rapidly as his house is very well located next to an international highway with alot of traffic of medium and heavy vehicles. He will use the loan to buy tires and plans to sell spare parts in the future and expand his shop. He wishes the country would invest more in creating industries to take better advantage of agriculture create employment.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is happily married with 3 children. She is 48 years old. Mary sells yams. Mary lives in Igbo-leren. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past year. Mary is very grateful for the financial assistance rendered to her by Kiva and LAPO Microfinance, and she prays that God will protect these organizations from fraud and dishonest individuals. Mary needs the loan of N50,000 ($350) to purchase more yams to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more yams

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
En majorité des femmes mariées, les membres du groupe Sabaly de l’association Faida ont une moyenne d’âge de 22 ans et 1 enfant. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales nucléaires dans la ville de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro  république du Mali. 
Leur union est basée essentiellement sur l’amitié et elles exercent le commerce de condiments alimentaires et de légumes. 
Elles ont intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire. Les prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté. 
Ces femmes comptent acheter, 300kg d’aubergines, 500kg d’oignon, 90 kg de carottes et une grande quantité de laitue. Ces produits sont achetés auprès des jardiniers de Dioila et revendus dans le marché de la même ville en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent avoir avec ce prêt, 45 000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune  qui sera utilisé pour étoffer leur activité génératrice de revenu.
texts.en:
Mostly married women, the members of the Sabaly group of the Faida association average 22 years of age and 1 child. They live in nuclear families in the city of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali. The group is essentially based on friendship, and its members deal in selling food condiments and vegetables. They joined Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and are now seeking their tenth solidarity loan (group loan). The previous loans were repaid without problems.

These women intend to buy 300 kg of eggplants, 500 kg of onions, 90 kg of carrots, and a large amount of lettuces. These products are purchased from gardeners in Dioïla, and retailed at the market of this same city, for cash or on credit, to a clientele comprising men and women. They intend to make a profit of XOF 45'000 (ca US$ 90) each, to be used to expand their money-making businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell vegetables

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra.Isabel Román de 46 años, separada hace 17 años,tiene tres hijos de 29,25 y 24 años de edad, el mayor de ellos es casado y vive en forma independiente con su familia , el segundo vive y trabaja en el exterior y el último de ellos está cursando el 5to. Año de la carrera de Derecho, y el sueño de la señora es que su hijo llegue a terminar la carrera universitaria que está siguiendo.y se convierta en un buen profesional en el futuro.

Se inició en la fabricación de muebles en el año 2002 con un ahorro que había obtenido de su trabajo anterior y actualmente ya tiene su clientela bien formada, que recurren a ella por su excelente trabajo y su atención personalizada.

El cliente solicita el préstamos para la compra de maderas, clavos y terciadas, para realizar sillones de maderas, camioncito y de esta forma satisfacer la gran demanda de los mismos
texts.en:
Isabel Román is 46 years old, has been separated for 17 years and has three children aged 29, 25 and 24. Her eldest child is married and he lives independently with his own family. Her second son lives and works in another country. Her youngest son is in his fifth year of Law studies. Her dream is that her son will complete his university studies which he has begun and that he will be a good lawyer in the future. She began making furniture in 2002 with savings she had from a previous job and currently has a good customer base who keep returning to her because of her excellent workmanship and personalized attention. She is asking for this loan to buy wood, nails and plywood in order to make wood armchairs, small trucks and be able to satisfy the strong demand for these objects.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wood, nails and plywood

loans.name: Bisola

texts.en: Bisola lives in Igbo-leren.She sells drinks and groceries and she has been in the business for the past 2 years. Bisola is 29 years old and she has a child. She is a LAPO client. Bisola is requesting for a loan of N50,000 ($350) to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and groceries to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé de six femmes, toutes mariées et ayant en moyenne 32 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des foyers monogames dans le quartier Rails ko de Markala (4ème région administrative du Mali).
Les membres  du groupe se sont connues dans l’association traditionnelle Parissain qui veut dire  en dialecte Bobo. Elles font  plusieurs activités génératrices de revenu  telles que la vente du riz, la fabrication des boissons locales non alcoolisées et la transformation des légumes (oignon tomate). Leur bonne organisation et leur dévouement dans les activités leurs ont valu un appui de l’US AID avec l’octroi des séchoirs et une machine de collage de sachets.
Dans le but d’améliorer leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’approcher Soro  Yiriwaso qu’elles ont connu à travers l’Assemblée Générale des Artisans de Markala. Après avoir bien remboursés les  prêts précédents elles sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire, qui sera utilisé pour acheter 6 sacs de sucre, 2 sacs de gingembre, 1 sac d’oseille de Guinée, 2 douzaines de flacon d’essence (menthe), 10 douzaines de sachets plastiques et 32 pièces de pagnes wax. Elles s’approvisionnent hebdomadairement au marché de Diamarabougou pour les ingrédients des  boissons locales ; les pagnes wax sont achetés au grand marché de Ségou. Elles revendent en détail, au comptant et à crédit à domicile et au marché de Diamarabougou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et   de femmes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 38.000FCA  qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses de la famille. Leur ambition est  d’acheter un congélateur.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of six women, all married, and averaging 32 years of age and 4 children. They live in monogamous households in the Railsko neighborhood in Markala (fourth administrative region of Mali). The members of the group got acquainted through the traditional association Parissain. They run various money-making businesses, such as selling rice, making local non-alcoholic beverages, and vegetables transformation (onions, tomatoes). Their good organization and their devotion to their businesses got them help from US AID, which provided them with dryers and a machine to glue sachets.

To improve their businesses, they decided to join Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, which they got to know through the General Assembly of the Artisans of Markala. After having repaid the former loans without problems, they are now seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan). They will use it to buy 6 sacks of sugar, 2 sacks of ginger, 1 sacks of roselle, 24 flasks of mint essence, 120 plastic bags, and 32 pieces of wax pagnes (colorful African cloth). They get their weekly supplies of ingredients for the local beverages at the Diamarabougou market, the wax pagnes are purchased at the Ségou grand market. They retail for cash or on credit, at home and at the market in Diamarabougou to a clientele comprising men and women. They hope to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 38'000 (ca US$ 80), to be used to help with the family expenses. They ambition to purchase a freezer.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare local beverages, and to buy pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
El señor Rogelio G. tiene 50 años de edad y está casado con la señora Luzmina González de 46 años, ellos son padres de 6 hijos.
El señor era agricultor y vivia en otra ciudad, hace 8 años vendió su terreno y compró una casa en Caaguazú en donde está viviendo actualmente, y monto su propia micro empresa, consistente en la venta de articulos de bazar y mercería para lo cual adquirio una camioneta todo terreno,con el cual realizaza su venta.
El dinero del prestamo será invertido para la compra de remeras, ya que cuenta con muchos pedidos, por la temporada de verano. Más adelante quiere tener su propio local de ventas ya que cuenta con cliente formada.
Desea un pais en donde haya más justicia.
texts.en:
Rogelio G. is 50 years old. He is married with Luzmina González, 46, and they have six children. He is a farmer and was living in a different city. Eight years ago he sold his land and bought a house in Caaguazú where he is now living. He opened his own small business selling bazaar articles and merchandise for which he acquired a small all-terrain truck with which he makes his sales. The loan will be used to buy T-shirts as demand is high because it is Summer. In the future he wants to have his own store from which to sell as he has a good customer base. He wants a country where there is more justice.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy T-shirts

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo sells and produces nylon. She has been in the business for the past 4 years. Titilayo is 30 years old and married with 2 children. Titilayo hails from Igbo-Eleren and she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past year. Titilayo needs a loan of N50,000 ($350) to purchase more nylon and a nylon engine to produce and sell nylon. She appreciates the kind gestures shown to her by LAPO Microfinance and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more nylon and a nylon engine

loans.name: Horoniya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du  groupe Horoniya (une veuve et trois mariées) ont en moyenne 42 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent en majorité dans des familles monogames dans le quartier Rails ko de Markala (4ème région administrative du Mali).
Elles se sont connues dans l’association traditionnelle Parissain qui veut dire "travailler ensemble" en dialecte Bobo. Elles font  la vente du riz, de pagnes, de tasses et la transformation des légumes (oignon, tomate).
Dans le souci d’améliorer leurs activités  économiques, elles ont décidé d’approcher Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont  à leur troisième prêt solidaire  après avoir bien remboursés les deux  prêts précédents. 
Elles comptent acheter, 6 pièces de 6 pagnes wax et des habits pour femmes. Elles s’approvisionnent  au grand  marché de Bamako(capitale du Mali) et effectuent leurs ventes  en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et dans les quartiers de Markala à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 28.000FCA qui sera utilisé pour  contribuer aux dépenses de la famille et investir le reste dans les affaires.
texts.en:
The four members of the group Horoniya is composed of one widow and three married women who average 42 years of age and 6 children. They live, for the most part, in monogamous families in the Rails Ko district of Markala (fourth region of the Republic of Mali). They got know one another in the association Parissain, which means "to work together" in the Bobo dialect. They sell rice, pagne cloth, tubs and basins, and they process vegetables (onions, tomatoes). Concerned about improving their commerce, the group members decided to approach Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their third solidarity loan after having repaid the two preceding ones. The group plans to buy six lengths of Wax-brand pagnes and some clothing for women. They supply themselves at the grand marketplace of Bamako (capital of Mali), and they sell the goods at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, out of the house and in the districts of Markala, to customers composed essentially of women. The group members envision realizing an average monthly profit of 28,000 francs CFA that will be used to help cover family expenses and to invest the rest in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagne cloth

loans.name: Modinut

texts.en: Modinut sells kitchen items and drinks. Modinut is 27 years old. She is married and has a child. Modinut has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for almost 2 years. She used a loan to start her business and the business is  growing gradually. Modinut is asking for a loan of N50,000 ($350 USD) to purchase more kitchen items and drinks. She is very happy with LAPO Microfinance and Kiva for their financial assistance and promises to be faithful with her repayments.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen items

loans.name: Madina

texts.fr:
Madame   Madina   Dougouné  est une veuve de 64 ans qui vit avec sa coépouse et  ses 8 enfants dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Très tôt Madina commença les activités génératrices de revenu. Elle mena plusieurs activités  telles que la vente d’habits, de fruits  avant d’opter pour la vente de calebasses qu’elle fait depuis 20 ans et jouit d’une grande notoriété auprès des femmes de Ségou et  de Bamako. Ces calebasses une fois achetées sur le marché sont soigneusement lavées et emballés afin de leur donner un aspect attrayant. 
Pour pérenniser son activité elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elle est en relation depuis 18 mois. Après 3 prêts solidaires tous bien remboursés, elle  est à son 1er prêt individuel qui servira à acheter 715 calebasses sur place au grand marché de Ségou. Madame  Madina Dougouné vend au comptant et à crédit, à domicile, dans les quartiers et au marché à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Elle reçoit également des commandes de Bamako et de Ségou  à l’occasion des mariages  car les calebasses entrent dans le trousseau de mariage de la jeune fille.
Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000FCFA qui lui permettra  d’acheter au fur et à mesure les trousseaux  de mariage de ses 4 filles, de la nourriture pour la famille.
 Son ambition est d’acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Madina Dougouné is a widow of 64 who lives with her co-spouse and her 8 children in the Darsalam neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Early on, Madina began to work at earning a living. She had several businesses, such as selling clothing and fruit before settling on selling gourds, which she has done now for 20 years. She is known among the women of Ségou and Bamako for her gourds. These gourds, once she has purchased them in the market, are carefully washed and wrapped so that they look appealing.

To make her business stable, she turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she has been in contact for 18 months. After 3 solidarity loans, all correctly reimbursed, she is on her first individual loan which will be used to buy 715 gourds right there in the big market of Ségou. Mrs. Madina Dougouné sells for cash or credit, at home, in the nearby neighborhoods, and in the market, to a clientele composed mostly of women. She also receives orders from Bamako and Ségou when there is a wedding, since gourds make up part of the trousseau of every bride.

She expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 F CFA which will allow her to buy, little by little, the trousseaus for her four daughters and food for the family. Her ambition is to buy a lot to build a house on.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of gourds

loans.name: Moradeyo

texts.en: Moradeyo sells rice and palm oil wholesale. She learned this business in working with her sister for 4 years and she has been in the business for the past 7 years. Moradeyo is 32 years old and is married with 4 children. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more food to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more food

loans.name: Bamady

texts.fr:
Agé de 26 ans Monsieur Bamady Bouaré est un  célibataire sans enfant qui vit avec sa mère et  ses frères  dans le quartier Pelengana Nord de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Titulaire d’un diplôme  en technique comptable et financière, il a été initié aux activités d’aviculture par une de ses connaissances et cela  durant ses vacances scolaires pendant trois ans. Actuellement Bamady a beaucoup de sujets dans sa basse cour. Pour nourrir journalièrement ses 180 sujets il a besoin d’une alimentation composée de  (mais, sorgho, huître, poisson, tourteau, sel, os  et  premisponte)
Pour renforcer son activité en terme alimentaire et sécuritaire (c’est à dire donner une alimentation de qualité aux sujets et avoir une clôture en grille), il a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son 1er  prêt individuel.
Il compte utiliser ce prêt  pour acheter, 17 sacs de mais, 30m de grillage, 24 complexes vitaminés et 12 amproliums. Il s’approvisionne en matières ci dessus citées  sur place à Ségou. 
Monsieur  Bamady   Bouaré   vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Il envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 96 000FCFA, qui servira de fonds de roulement et à faire face à certaines dépenses familiales. 
Son ambition est d’avoir un bon poulailler et de pondeuses bien entretenues.
texts.en:
Mr. Bamady Bouaré, 26, is single and has no children; he lives with his mother and his brothers in the Pelengana Nord district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

He is certified in accounting and finance, but a friend taught him how to raise poultry during his school vacations over three years. At present, Bamady has quite a number of fowl in his yard. To feed his 180 birds daily, he needs food composed of maize, sorghum, oysters, fish, oil cake, salt, bonemeal and so on.

To bolster his business in terms of feed and a secure hen-house (that is, to give the birds quality feed and have a fenced area for them), he came to Soro Yiriwaso with whom he is on his first individual loan. He intends to use this loan to buy 17 sacks of maize, 30 meters of chicken wire, 24 vitamin complexes and 12 amproliums. He can buy these things right there in the market of Ségou.

Mr. Bamady Bouaré sells for cash or on credit to a clientele composed of men and women. He hopes to make a monthly profit of 96,000 F CFA which will be used as working capital and for certain family expenses. His ambition is to have a good chicken yard and well cared for layers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of feed and medicines for poultry

loans.name: Limpia

texts.es:
La señora Limpia P. tiene 49 años de edad y está casada con el señor Carmelo Martinez de 63 años, ambos son padres de 9 hijos.
La cliente se dedica al comercio hace más de 25 años, y comenzó con un pequeño ahorro que contaba. Su marido es carpintero y fabrica muebles para la venta, y mas adelante desean adquirir un camión para distribuir sus productos en zonas más lejanas ya que tienen muy buena venta.
El dinero del préstamo será destinado para la compra de madera para la fabricación de juegos de comedor, que serán vendidos a mueblerias de la zona.
La señora sueña con un pais con mayor seguridad y más oportunidad para los jovenes.
texts.en:
Limpia P. is 49 years old, married to Carmelo Martinez who is 63 years of age, and they are the parents of 9 children. She has dedicated herself to commerce for more than 25 years, and started her business with a small amount of savings that she had. Her husband is a carpenter and makes furniture to sell. Further ahead, they would like to acquire a truck to distribute their products throughout distant zones since they have very good sales. The funds from the loan would be destined to purchase lumber to make dining room sets to be sold in the furniture stores of the area. Limpia dreams of a safer country with more opportunities for young people.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of lumber.

loans.name: Jain

texts.en:
Jain S. is currently in the business of selling beans at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Jain is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a secondary school teacher. She has three children, and her children go to school.  

With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her bean business.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana, married with two children, has been selling women's robes and underwear at one of the markets in Nikopolfor for eight years. An honest and hard working person, she knows that having a large assortment of good quality products is one of the keys to business success.

Svetlana is now requesting a loan of 7,000 UAH to purchase a kiosk for a second business location. Her goal is to develop this enterprise further so she can help her daughter to cover her university tuition.

loans.use: To purchase a kiosk for a second business location.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra.María Báez de 30 años, separada hace 6 años, estubo casado por 3 años , el matrimonio no tiene hijos, y desde su separación empezó a realizar repartos de mercaderias , luego tuvo que viajar al exterior para trabajar por un tiempo de un año después vino de vuelta por la muerte de su hermano.

A su regreso con el capital que pudo juntar continuo con el negocio pero está vez en un local fijo, ubicado en la esquina del mercado municipal donde empezó a formar muchos clientes , teniendo en cuenta la variedad de frutas, hortalizas, articulos de primera necesidad, golosinas, bebidas gaseosas, y por la atencion personalizada.que ofrece a sus clientes.

El cliente solicita el préstamos para la compra de naranjas, tomates, zanahorias, harina, arroz, yerba, aceite, fiambres, quesos y golosinas en general y de esta forma ofrecer variedad calidad y con esto cubrir la gran demanda de los mismos.
texts.en:
María Báez is 30 years old and has been separated for six years, had been married for three years. She has no children and since the separation began delivering merchandise. She went outside the country to work for one year then returned when her brother died. Upon her return, she used her money to continue her business but from a fixed location: at the corner of the municipal market. She began to have a good customer base because of the variety of fruits, vegetables, staple goods, candies, soft drinks she carries and above all the personalized attention she offers her customers. She is asking for a loan to buy oranges, tomatos, carrots, flour, rice, herbs, oil, cold cuts, cheese and candies in general and thus offer a large variety in order to satisfy her customers' demands.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy oranges, tomatos, carrots, flour, rice, herbs, oil, cold cuts, cheese and candies

loans.name: Olawumi

texts.en: Olawumi sells groceries, food, and drinks. Olawumi is 29 years old and she has 4 children. Olawumi runs her shop from 6am to 10 pm Monday to Sunday. She is always determined to expand her business and to increase her profitability. Olawumi lives in Okoko. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 ($350) to purchase more groceries, drinks and food to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more food and groceries to sell

loans.name: Las Paraguayitas Group

texts.es: Este grupo de Señoras, con el espiritu emprendedor que poseen, se agruparón para la formación del comite y crecer todas juntas para el progreso personal y economico de las mismas, saben que la situación economica actual nos lleva a trabajar mas, porque son señoras que tiene la responsabilidad de mantener a su familia, son amas de casa que trabajan para sobrevivir, y con este apoyo crediticio que se les otorgara sera una herramienta muy útil para sobrellevar la situción economica actual.
texts.en:
This group of women, with the entrepreneurial spirit that they have, have gathered to form a committee and grow together for personal and economic progress. They know that their current economic situation requires them to work more, because they are women with responsibility to support their families. They are housewives that work to survive, and this help in the form of a loan will be a useful tool to overcome their current economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy items that each will use in her respective business

loans.name: Eyman

texts.en:
Eyman is a 43-year-old divorced woman who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon. Eyman has been working as a seamstress for nine years. She does all types of clothes as well as wedding and evening dresses. Eyman requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase beads and thread for her work.

This is the first time that Eyman has requested a loan. Eyman is special in her work because she does it well and likes what she does. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have the startup capital. In the future, Eyman plans to open a shop.

loans.use: Eyman will use the loan to purchase pearls and thread for her work.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 53-year-old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Mouhamad is a carpenter and he has owned a cocktail shop. Mouhamad requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his cocktail shop as well as change its décor. Mouhamad has been a microcredit client for ten years now and has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his business as a carpenter and start a new work which was the cocktail shop. Mouhamad is very satisfied and grateful for the opportunity to work with A. Majmoua. His clients are his family members, friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans on purchasing the cocktail shop.

loans.use: Mouhamad will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his cocktail shop as well as change its décor.

loans.name: Chetroi

texts.en:
This is Chetroi C., a resident of Cahul District, Brinza village. C. is requesting a loan from MicroInvest to increase his working capital in order to start a business cultivating vegetables and seeds that will be grown on land in Brinza that he inherited from his parents.

We want to thank all Kiva lenders for funding people who want to begin their own businesses.

loans.use: To start a business.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 44-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Mohamad has been working as a car mechanic for eight years. He also sells used and new spare parts. Mohamad requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his garage. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.

Mohamad is special in his work because he has a good reputation and has experience in his domain. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building a network. In the future, he plans to purchase the garage.

loans.use: Mohamad will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his garage.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 28-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon,, with his wife and their two children. Mohamad has owned a barber shop for a year and a half. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to change the décor of his salon. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.

Mohamad is speciA. in his work because he does nice hair cuts and knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his family member, friends and neighbors. In the future, Mohamad plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Mohamad will use the loan to change the décor of his salon.

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Majed has been working as a car repairer for eighteen years. He repairs cars radiators. Majed requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Majed has requested a loan.

Majed is special in his work because of his experience in cars. His clients are his family members, friends and neighbors. Majed decided on doing his business because he wanted to be independent in his work. In the future, he plans on expanding his garage.

loans.use: Majed will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 40-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Walid has been a car electrician for eighteen years. He also sells cars batteries. Walid requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools and merchandise for his work. Walid has been a microcredit client for eight years now and has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his business. Walid is very satisfied and grateful for the opportunity to work with A. Majmoua. Walid is speciA. in his work because of his experience in his business. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Walid decided on doing his business because he wanted to be independent in his work. In the future, he plans on expanding his garage.

loans.use: Walid will use the loan to purchase tools and merchandise for his work.

loans.name: Mujeres Humildes Group

texts.es:
El Grupo se formo en un Barrio denominado Ciudad Nueva de Caaguazú, se reunierón 17 señoras con muchas ganas de trabajar en conjunto, en unión para sobresalir en foram economica y personal, son humildes y trabajadoras cada una recibe un credito de 500.000 y tres de las integrantes 300.000 lo usaran en sus trabajos diarios cada una tiene una actividad en donde invertir.- Los deseos de estas señoras es que como grupo salgan adelante ayudandose en forma solidaria, y demostrando que unidas en un comité pueden lograrlo si se lo proponen, gracias al apoyo de la Fundación Paraguaya

Nº	Nombre y Apellido	Actividad

texts.en:
This neighborhood group called “Ciudad Nueva de Caaguazú” has 17 women with great desire to work together to be successful personally and economically. They are humble and hard working. Each will receive a loan of 500.000 and three of the members 300.000 to use in their daily work as each one has a business in which to invest. The wishes of these women is as a group to be successful and help each other, demonstrating in unity that a committee can achieve their goals, thanks to the Paraguaya Foundation. # First and Last Name,Business 1 Cefenina N., Store 2 Liz Mabel A., Vegetable and clothing sales 3 Silvina V.,Vegetable and clothing sales 4 Magdalena F., Street vendor 5 Alicia M., Street vendor 6 Cecilia A., Street vendor 7 Alice Ramirez F., Store 8 Liz Carina M., Fruit vendor 9 Carmen González, Street vendor 10 Idalina G., Vegetable and clothing sales 11 Mirna Raquel C., Vegetable and clothing sales 12 Pablina P., Fuel vendor 13 Primitiva López, Vegetable and clothing sales 14 MarizzaLuz V., Snack bar 15 Maria Estela González, Vegetable and clothing sales 16 María Angelica O., Store 17 Liz Mariela A., Store

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for each of their respective businesses

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 28-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Haytham has been working as a car repairer for two years. He repairs cars, as well as he changes cars oils, tires and steering wheels. Haytham requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase cars tools and merchandise for his work like cars batteries and other things. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his work. Haytham is special in his work because of his experience in his business. His clients are his friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans on purchasing his garage.

loans.use: Haytham will use the loan to purchase cars tools and merchandise for his work.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 26-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Mahmoud has owned a computer store since 2006. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new game for his shop. This is the first time that Mahmoud has requested a loan.

Mahmoud is special in his work because he is the only one in his region. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he faced a lack of cash.

loans.use: Mahmoud will use the loan to purchase a new game for his shop.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya, a mother of four, has been selling sweets and cookies at the market for 14 years, attracting and keeping her clients by maintaining a good assortment at low prices. Her net income is about 2,000 UAH per month. This is the family's only income, since her husband left them long ago.

A disciplined, hard working and very enthusiastic person, Mariya’s goal is to raise her children and help them to start their life journeys. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 UAH for two months to increase her assortment of goods, hoping to thereby earn more income for her family's needs.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of cookies and sweets for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Houssein will use the loan to purchase new games.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 26-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Abdallah has been working as an aluminum installer for four years. He repairs doors and windows. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase aluminum for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his income. Abdallah is special in his work because of his good reputation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Abdallah will use the loan to purchase aluminum for his work.

loans.name: Rabei

texts.en:
Rabei is a 27-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife. Rabei has been working as an aluminum installer since 2004. He repairs doors and windows. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase aluminum for his work. This is the first time that Rabei has requested a loan.

Rabei is special in his work because of his good reputation. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started, he didn’t have all the necessary tools for his business. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Rabei will use the loan to purchase aluminum for his work.

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se unierón con el proposito D. mejorar su calidad D. vida atravez D. un grupo solidarios dispuestas a ayudarse, cada una tiene una responsabilidad que asumen D. manera conjunta, son personas humildes y muy trabajadoras, poseen el espiritu emprendedor y las ganas D. progresar conjuntamente.-

They are humble and hardworking people, and they possess an entrepreneurial spirit and the desire to progress together. loans.use: Purchase merchandise for each of their respective businesses

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 19-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Alaa has been working as a house painter since 2006. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Alaa has requested a loan.

Alaa is speciA. in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he faced the lack of cash. Alaa decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Alaa will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 27 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Ali has been working as an aluminum installer for ten years. He repairs doors and windows. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase aluminum stock for his work. This is his second loan cycle and he has always repaid his loan payments on time. His previous loan helped him improve his income. Ali is special in his work because he is fast and knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Ali will use the loan to purchase aluminum for his work.

loans.name: Berdila

texts.en:
Berdila I., a 23-year-old farmer with more than two years of experience, has decided to extend his business and so is requesting a loan from MicroInvest to buy working materials and the seeds needed to plant vegetables in the garden he owns. In the future he wants to plant some winter vegetables that are difficult to grow; the advantage is that the demand for these vegetables will be high, so after he has repaid the loan I. hopes to get another to buy constructI. materials for a greenhouse.
 	
Despite his young age, Microinvest trusts this client.

loans.use: To extend his business.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 39-year-old woman who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with her husband and their three children. Hala has owned a beauty salon for four years. She does hairdressing as well as other beauty care. She requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for her work and change the décor of her salon. This is her third cycle and she has always repaid on time.

Her previous loans helped her improve her salon as well as her financial situation. Hala is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients can be anybody. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase tools for her work and change the décor of her salon

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Agustín tiene 28 años, vive en la casa de sus padres. Se dedica a su fábrica de ladrillos desde hace 8 años, se asoció con su hermano para juntos trabajar en esta ardua tarea, la cual les toma todo el día si quieren producir una considerable cantidad de ladrillos. La dificultad más grande es cuando es época de lluvia, ya que retrasa la producción y a veces se corre el riesgo de perder el trabajo realizado cuando los ladrillos no cocidos se desmoronan por estar por largo tiempo húmedos, pero afortunadamente solo son dos meses en los que se tiene estas dificultades lo cual es superable. Es la tercera vez que Agustín tiene un préstamo con MFP,  aprendiendo mucho durante este tiempo con su trabajo en su banco comunal y seguirá coordinando con todos para seguir creciendo. El dinero que solicita es para invertirlo en la compra de arena (una camionada) y palizadas que son el combustible para el horno, invertirá todo el dinero del préstamo además de parte de sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Agustín is 28 years old and lives in his parent’s home. He has been making bricks for 8 years, and works with his brother on this arduous tasks. It takes him all day to produce a considerable number of bricks. His greatest difficulty comes during the rainy season, as this delays his products and at times he risks losing his work when the unbaked bricks are exposed to humidity for an extended period of time. Fortunately there are only two months to the rainy season, which is endurable. This is the third time Agustín has a loan with MFP, he is learning a lot during this time with his work in the communal bank and he will continue working with everyone to continue growing. The money will be invested in buying a truckload of sand and combustible fuel for his oven. He will invest all the money from the loan and add part of his own savings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make bricks

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 43-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Ali has owned a school bus for eighteen years. Ali requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his bus. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

loans.use: Ali will use the loan to do some maintenance work on his bus.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucía se dedica a su negocio desde hace cuatro años. Anteriormente trabajó de cocinera durante ocho años, pero prefirió empezar su proprio comercio.  Ella cría y vende cuyes desde su casa. Sin embargo, recién la semana pasada, empezó también con un puestito de ceviche cerca del mercado de San Martín de Porres. Lo pidió prestado a una amiga para ver si en este negocio había más salida que en la venta de cuyes.
Hasta ahora lleva tres años con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO. No obstante, a sus edad, cuarenta y nueve años, aún no tiene muchos planes por el futuro ya que por ahora todavía llega a cubrir los gastos del hogar y de la familia, con la ayuda de su esposo. Lucía tiene dos hijos, un joven casi mayor de edad, y una niña.
texts.en:
Since four years ago, Lucia has had her own business. Before that, she was a cook for eight years, but she preferred to start her own business. She breeds and sells guinea pigs from home.

Yet, just last week, she set a little stall of sea food near "San Martin de Porres" market. She borrowed the money from a friend to see if this new business was more profitable than the guinea pigs selling. She's used EDAPROSPO loans for three years, so far. Nevertheless, she is 40 and has not many plans for the future, because she still takes care of the house and family expenses, with her husband's help. Lucia has two children, an almost adult young man, and a girl.


Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: food for guinea pigs breeding

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rabie

texts.en:
Rabie is an 18-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Rabie has been working as a mason since 2003. He requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Rabie has requested a loan.

His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started, he had difficulty purchasing his tools. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Onorina

texts.es:
Onorina trabaja desde los veinticinco años de edad y, en casi toda su vida, ha tenido una gran variedad de trabajos, desde la venta de ropa hasta una bodega de abarrotes en la selva.
Hace seis años empezó a dedicarse a su negocio de compra y venta de muebles. Los que compra Onorina los manda a fabricar ella misma según los pedidos que tenga. Después de tener más de cuatro años con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, ella planea seguir con su negocio ya que le gusta mucho, pero desea agrandarlo cada vez más.
A sus cuarenta y ocho años Onorina comparte los gastos del hogar con su esposo, que tiene un negocio propio a parte – una ferretería - , sin tener muchos gastos de familia ya que su único hijo es mayor de edad y trabaja para mantenerse el mismo.
texts.en:
Onorina works since she was 25. Almost all of her life she has had a variety of jobs, from apparel selling to having a grocery warehouse in the jungle. Six years ago she started a buying and selling furniture business. The furniture that Onorina buys, she has it made according to the orders she receives.

After more than four years of having EDAPROSPO loans, she is planning to continue with the business because she likes it very much and she wants to have it to continuously growing. Being 48, Onorina shares the house expenses with her husband who has a separate business -a hardware store-, and she has few family expenses because her only child is all grown up and works for self support.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in furniture purchasing, her merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mouamar

texts.en:
Mouamar is a 35-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife. Mouamar has been working as a carpenter since 2001. He requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase wood for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his business. His clients are his friends and neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase wood for his work.

loans.name: Cerilo

texts.es: Cerilo tiene 43 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Es transportista que desde hace 10 años, ofrece servicio de carga con su principal herramienta de trabajo, su camión, en el cual principalmente transporta ganado. En un inicio su camión  era solo para transportar los animales que él mismo vendía, pero al notar que en cada pueblo donde se comercializa ganado es muy solicitado el servicio de transporte, fue dedicándose a esta actividad. Viaja constantemente a diferentes ciudades, aprovechando para comprar productos de cada zona para venderlos en su próximo destino. Ahora que empieza la época escolar es cuando tiene mayores ganancias por haber mayor demanda del servicio de transporte. El anhelo de Cerilo es adquirir otro camión para  incrementar sus ganancias. Es la tercera vez que lleva un crédito con su banco comunal y MFP, para él ha sido una experiencia muy satisfactoria. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará para el mantenimiento de su camión, lo que está valorizado en un monto aproximado de 2300 soles y con la otra parte, comprará mercadería de ocasión para vender en otras ciudades.
texts.en:
Cerilo is 43 years old; he lives with his wife and two children. He has been a transport driver for the past 10 years: he offers cargo services with his truck, mainly transporting livestock. Initially he used his truck to only transport animals which he was selling but he noticed that in each village where livestock was sold, this transportation service was in high demand and so he went into this line of business. He travels constantly from city to city, always buying products from each area to sell at his next destination. Now, with the school year starting, it is the best time of year for him to make the greatest profit because demand for his services is so high. Cerilo's goal is to acquire another truck to increase his profit. This is his third loan with his community bank and MFP. He has found the loan experience to be very satisfactory. He will use the loan to perform maintenance on his truck, which he estimates will cost 2,300 soles, and the remainder will be used to buy second-hand goods to resell in other cities.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Truck maintenance

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 42-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Ali has been working as a livestock smallholder for nine years. He also sells milk. Ali requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase animal feed. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

His clients are his neighbors. Ali decided on doing his business because he always liked animals. In the future, he plans on improving his business in order to improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 27 años, vive en la casa de su madre. Ella fabrica ladrillos en su propio horno desde hace 2 años, comenzó con este negocio gracias a sus padres, quienes le cedieron un terreno de suelo arcilloso óptimo para la fabricación de ladrillos. En la actualidad se encarga de  buscar compradores para su producción de ladrillos, es por ello que su trabajo consiste  en  dar a conocer su producto y también buscar proveedores. Con esta actividad económica Gloria es independiente económicamente y puede solventar sus estudios,  tiene planes de seguir trabajando en su fábrica y también concluir su carrera. Es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las personas de más confianza en su banco comunal y siempre  ha sido puntual en sus pagos, además el trabajo que desempeña en su grupo es muy grato para ella. La cantidad que está solicitando la invertirá en la compra de aserrín y arena, además de contratar personal para que la ayude en su fábrica.
texts.en:
Gloria is 27 years old and lives in her mother's home. She has been making bricks in her own oven for the past two years. She started her business thanks to her parents who gave her land with clay soil perfect for making bricks. She is currently looking for buyers for her brick-making business, which is why her work entails advertising her product and finding suppliers. Thanks to this business, Gloria is financially independent and can pay her tuition. She plans to continue working in her enterprise and finishing her studies. This is her third loan with MFP. She is one of the most trusted members of her community bank and has always been punctual with her repayments. In addition she finds the group work very pleasant. She will invest the loan in buying sawdust and sand as well as in hiring people to help her in her enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make bricks

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad, 28, lives in Tyre in southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Ahmad has been working as a car painter since 2000. He is requesting a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua to purchase paint and tools for his work. This is his second loan request; he repaid his first loan on time. His previous loan helped him improve his business. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Ahmad decided on doing this business because of his experience.

loans.use: To purchase paint and tools for his work

loans.name: Jarumy

texts.es:
Anteriormente Jarumy trabajaba en una empresa que quedaba bastante lejos de su casa. No obstante, hace diecisiete años tuvo una hija especial y como la niña no podía ser dejada sola en casa, Jarumy tuvo que dejar su trabajo y dedicarse a la crianza de esta hija y de otros dos hijos. 
Sin embargo, hace cuatro años se dio cuenta que, de alguna manera, necesitaba ayudar a su esposo a cubrir los gastos del hogar, y pensó abrir una tiendita de abarrotes, dulces y gaseosas en su casa, para así poder seguir cuidando a su hija.
Jarumy se ayuda con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO desde hace cuatro años, y gracias a ellos pudo construir un negocio bastante estable. Además de esto también tiene otro negocio desde hace diez años: un taller de mecánica.
A sus treinta y ocho años planea en un futuro comprar un terreno para construir su hogar y una tiendita, ya que el local que tiene ahora es alquilado, y los precios del alquiler han subido mucho recientemente.
texts.en:
Jarumy used to work for a company that was quite far from her home. However, 17 years ago she had a special needs child and because she could not leave her daughter alone at home, Jarumy had to quit her job and devote her time to raising this child and her other two children. Four years ago she realized that she somehow needed to help her husband with household expenses and she thought of opening a small store for groceries, candy and soft drinks in her home so that she could still take care of her daughter. For the past four years Jarumy has been helped out with loans from EDAPROSPO, and thanks to these has been able to build up a fairly stable business. In addition, she has also had another business for the past 10 years; a mechanic workshop. Now 38 years old, she plans to buy some land in the future to build a home and small store, as the one she currently has is rented and the rent has recently increased a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reinvest in her business and cover expenses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo pequeño de 5 años en casa de su suegro. Ella realiza bordados desde hace 2 años atrás, como una fuente generadora de recursos, pero desde su niñez siempre ha trabajado ayudando a su mamá en su trabajo, que en ese entonces también eran los bordados. Judith trabaja tranquilamente en su casa para poder  bordar bellos fustanes, que son de muy buena calidad gracias a los detalles que le pone, lo que logra que muchas personas vayan a buscarla y solicitarle sus trabajos. La meta de Judith es tener un taller grande donde pueda contratar a varias personas que la ayuden a realizar su trabajo y seguir ahorrando para comprar un carro con el que pueda empezar a brindar servicio de transporte público. Es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las integrantes más puntuales, y siempre actúa con responsabilidad ante las decisiones de su banco comunal. Con el dinero solicitado comprará telas e hilos y de esa manera poder abastecer los pedidos de bordados que tiene, comprará todo al por mayor y con ello obtendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Judith is 27 years old and lives with her husband and 5-year-old son in her father-in-law´s house. She has been doing embroidery for the past 2 years as a souce of income, but since childhood always worked helping out her mother with her embroidery. Judith works quietly from home so that she can embroider beautiful petticoats, which are of very good quality thanks to the finishing touches she gives them. As a result, she has a lot of people asking for her work. Judith´s goal is to have a workshop where she can hire people to help her and to keep saving so she can buy a car with which she can provide public transportation service. This is the third time she has a loan with MFP. She is one of the most punctual borrowers and always has behaved responsibly toward the decisions of her communal bank. With the money she is requesting she will buy fabric and thread to meet the requests for embroidery that she has; she will buy at wholesale and this way be able to make a greater profit.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for embroidery

loans.name: Melhem

texts.en:
Melhem, 31, lives in the Bekaa Valley. He has been working as a house painter and decorator for 12 years. He is requesting a loan of $800 USD from A. Majmoua to purchase a car for his business. This is the first time that Melhem has requested a loan. 
Melhem does high-quality work. His clients are people from his region. In the future, he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a car for his business

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled, 41, who lives in Bekaa with his wife and their six children, has been working as a livestock smallholder for 30 years. He also sells milk. Khaled is requesting a loan of $1000 from A. Majmoua to purchase animA. feed. This is the first time that he has requested a loan, and in the future he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia está casada, y utiliza las ganancias de su negocio, al que se dedica desde hace diez años, para cubrir los gastos del hogar junto a su esposo. Tienen cuatro hijos, dos varones y dos mujeres, pero todos ya son casados e independientes. 
Eugenia tiene un pequeño bazar en su casa, donde vende productos variados como  abarrotes, dulces y gaseosas. Además tiene un negocio de salchipapas en el cual también invierte.
A pesar de que tiene préstamos por EDAPROPSO desde hace cuatro años, ya anteriormente ahorraba sus ganancias para la mejora de su hogar. Junto a su esposo construyeron su casa desde que no había nada, y a sus cincuenta y tres años sus planes para mejorar su nivel de vida continúan. En un futuro le gustaría abrir un restaurante o quizás, como su hija es estilista, un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Eugenia is married and uses the earnings from her business - which she has had for the past 10 years - to help her husband take care of household expenses. They have four children, two boys and two girls, who are all married and living on their own. Eugenia has a small convenience store in her home where she sells a variety of goods such as groceries, candy and soft drinks. She also has a business selling salchipapas (a type of fast food that consists of thinly sliced hot dogs and french fries, mixed together). In spite of the fact that she has had loans from EDAPROPSO for the past four years, she used to save her profits to make improvements to her home. Together with her husband they built their house from nothing, and at 53 years old her plans are to continue to improve her standard of living. In the future she would like to open a restaurant or maybe, since her daughter is a beautician, a beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, beer and candy.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Ella trabaja en su fábrica D. ladrillos, la cual obtuvo hace 2 años. Todo comenzó como un proyecto familiar, adquiriendo un terreno arcilloso (el material requerido para la fabricación D. ladrillos), lo que le dio buenos resultados, ya que ahora ha repartido una parcela a cada uno D. sus hijos, a fin D. que cada uno tenga su propia fábrica. Esto no perjudica el mercado D. Gloria, ya que existe una alta demanda en este rubro. Actualmente produce hasta 23 millares D. ladrillos por mes, teniendo que contratar a personas que la ayuden, Luisa les paga por millar, y tiene que estar pendiente todo el día supervisando el trabajo. Su deseo es seguir trabajando porque quiere mejorar, cada vez más, la calidad D. su producto. Es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella está muy contenta por ser parte D. su banco comunal y seguirá trabajando con responsabilidad para el bienestar D. todos. El dinero que solicita será usado en la compra D. una camionada D. aserrín que cuesta en promedio D. 1200 soles y la otra parte la invertirá en el pago del jornal D. sus empleados, ya que en esta ocasión aumentará su producción.
texts.en:
Luisa is 49 years old and lives with her husband in their own home. She works in her own brick-making operation, which she acquired 2 years ago. It all began as a family project with the acquisition of a piece of land with clay dirt (material needed to make bricks), and the results were good so now she has given a piece of the land to each of her children so that they can have their own production. This does not affect her as there is a high demand for bricks. She currently produces up to 23,000 a month and has hired people to help her. Luisa pays them for each 1,000 bricks and spends all day supervising their work. She hopes to keep working because she wants to continue to improve the quality of her product. This is the third time she has had a loan with MFP. She is pleased to be part of the communal bank and will keep working responsibly for the well-being of everyone. The money she requests will be used to buy a truck-load of sawdust which will cost an average of 1,200 soles and another part will be used to pay her employees since their production will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sawdust and pay her day workers.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
BilA. is a 47-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their three children. BilA. has owned a grocery store for fifteen years. He also sells vegetables. BilA. requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that BilA. has requested a loan.

His clients are people from his area. BilA. decided on doing this business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 28-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa. Omar has been working as an aluminum installer for four years. He repairs doors and windows. Omar requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his business. This is the first time that Omar has requested a loan.

Omar is speciA. in his work because he does a clean, neat job. His clients are the people from his area. Omar decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Omar will use the loan to purchase tools for his business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 42 años, vive en casa de su madre y su hijo. Ella ofrece el servicio de prótesis dental  desde hace más de 18 años, estudió para este oficio, el cual la apasiona y es su fuente principal de ingreso. Hace varios años atrás decidió dedicarse a su profesión de manera independiente. Durante los meses de enero y febrero viaja a los asientos mineros para atender a allí, luego desde abril hasta agosto atiende en la ciudad de Lima, y finalmente desde setiembre hasta diciembre  se queda en su ciudad, donde tiene su consultorio en su casa. Lo que realiza principalmente son prótesis dentales y con la larga experiencia que tiene lo que produce es de excelente calidad, por lo que sus clientes satisfechos la recomiendan a otras personas y de esa manera consigue nuevos clientes. Es la tercera vez que Vilma está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las integrantes más activas y responsables de su grupo, promueve un trabajo solidario con cada uno de sus compañeros, y además recomienda a otras personas que trabajan de esta manera, formando nuevos  bancos comunales. Vilma requiere esta cantidad para la compra de los materiales e insumos necesarios para la fabricación de las prótesis dentales, aprovechará la buena demanda que tiene donde está actualmente, en los asientos mineros, y necesita de abastecerse de articuladores, impresores dentales, los metales como oro y plata, etc.
texts.en:
Vilma is 42 years old and lives in her mother´s house with her son. She has had a dental prosthesis service for more than 18 years. She studied this career, which fascinates her and which is her main source of income. Several years ago she decided to work independently. During January and February she travels to all the mining sites to take care of the miners, later from April to August she works in Lima, and finally from September to December she works in her own city, where she has her office at her home. What she mainly does are dentures and with her experience the prostheses she produces have excellent quality, which is why her patients are satisfied and recommend her to other people and this is how she gets new patients. This is the third time that Vilma has requested a loan from MFP. She is one of the most active and responsible members of her group, she encourages each of her fellow members and recommends others to work and form new communal banks. Vilma needs a loan to buy materials and supplies necessary to produce dental prostheses and will make the most of the high demand that currently exist at the mining sites. She needs to build up her inventory of pieces, trays for dental impressions, metals like gold and silver, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for making dental prostheses

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Junto a su esposo invirtió en materiales para la confección de maletines y mochilas.
Celestina se dedica a más de una actividad para salir adelante. Su negocio propio es de tejidos, al cual se dedica desde hace tres años. Hace unos años se juntó con unas compañeras de su comunidad para organizar unos talleres de capacitación, pagados por el estado, de tejido y confección. Ahora las mujeres trabajan juntas en el tejido – eligieron tejido porque confección textil necesitarían máquinas. Ellas se reúnen y tejen juntas, van a las ferias, y al final se reparten los ingresos, cada una recibiendo las ganancias de sus productos que han sido vendidos. 
A parte Celestina apoya su esposo en su negocio de confección de maletines y mochilas, que él mismo produce, desde hace diez años, y que ella se dedica a vender desde hace 5 años. La pareja comparten los gastos del hogar y del mantenimiento  de sus 3 hijos, dos de los cuales todavía estudian, cada uno utilizando las ganancias de su negocio.
Además desde hace más de diez años Celestina apoya el comedor de su comunidad, junto a otras mujeres de su Alcancía Comunal y compañeras del trabajo.
Recién empezó a sacar préstamos con EDAPROSPO. No obstante, a sus cincuenta y seis años le gustaría en un futuro abrir una tienda, en donde vender lo que ella y su esposo producen en vez de tener que salir a vender como ambulante, para asegurarse unos ingresos más estables.
texts.en:
She and her husband invested together in materials to make satchels and backpacks.
