Celestina has more than one job to make ends meet. Her own business that she has had for three years is knitting. A few years ago she got together with a some friends from her community to organize knitting and dressmaking training workshops paid by the state. Now the women work together knitting. They chose knitting because they would need machines for dressmaking. They get together and knit, go to the fairs, and in the end they share the income. Each one receives the profits from her products that sold.

Celestina also helps her husband in his business making satchels and backpacks that he has been making himself for ten years. She has been selling them for 5 years. The couple shares expenses for the household and maintenance of their 3 children, two of them still in school, each using the profits from their business.

In addition, Celestina has been supporting her community lunchroom for more than ten years, along with other women from her Community “Alcancía” and coworkers.

She has recently begun to get loans from EDAPROSPO. Nevertheless, at fifty-six years old she would like to open a store in the future to sell what she and her husband make instead of having to sell as a street vendor. This would ensure a more stable income.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She and her husband invested together in materials to make satchels and backpacks.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Housam

texts.en:
Housam is a 38-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their five children. Housam has been working as a carpenter for nineteen years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase wood and tools for his work. This is the first time that Housam has requested a loan.

His clients are the people from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty purchasing wood for his work. Housam decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase wood and tools for his work

loans.name: Abelina

texts.es: Abelina de 45 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, golosinas, productos de primera necesidad y bebidas en general en su casa, en un pequeño local que mandó a construir para su bodega, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 5 años atrás y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que se relaciona con muchas personas y le es muy rentable porque donde ella vive es la única persona que tiene este tipo de negocio. Posteriormente quiere mandar a ampliar su negocio y así llegar a constituir su propio minimarket. Ella ha tenido 5 veces un préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque le dan la oportunidad de seguir surgiendo. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a ampliar su negocio, comprará más productos y sobre todo mejorará algunas estructuras de su local y su casa.
texts.en:
Abelina is 45 years old, single, and lives with her two children in her own home. In general, she dedicates herself to the sale of groceries, sweets, basic necessities, and beverages. She works from a small space in her house that she had built for her store, she has been carrying out this activity for five years, and things are going well. What she most enjoys about her business is the contact she has with many people, and it is very profitable because where she lives she is the only one with this type of business. She would like to, in time, expand her business and be able to build her own minimart. She has had five loans with MFP, and she likes working with the cooperative bank because it gives her an opportunity to continue to progress. With the funds requested she would like to expand her business, buy more products, and, most of all, make some structural improvements to her business location and home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Olinda Geronima

texts.es:
Compró lana para sus tejidos.
Olinda, aunque está casada y comparte sus gastos con su esposo, se dedica a varios negocios para tener bastante ingresos para cubrir los expendios de su hogar y de la cría de los niños que tiene a cargo – sus dos hijos y una sobrina. 
Principalmente se ocupa de tejido manual de prendas y chompas, y de compra y venta de productos lácteos. Los dos los empezó recién, hace 6 meses. Los tejidos aprendió a hacerlos trabajando en una fábrica, donde tiene un empleo inestable desde hace dos años, y los produce comprando ella misma los materiales. El negocio de la compra y venta de quesos y otros productos lácteos se le ocurrió porque su madre y su padre son ganaderos en la selva, y de allí ella puede conseguir unos buenos productos naturales que mucha gente prefiere a los industriales que se encuentran mayormente en la zona.
Además Olinda apoya en el comedor de su comunidad desde hace ocho años, junto a otras mujeres de su Alcancía Comunal y compañeras de su trabajo de tejido.
Recién empezó a sacar los préstamos con EDAPROSPO, hace unos meses, y a sus cuarenta y ocho años le gustaría en un futuro poder abrir una bodega en su casa para tener un lugar fijo donde vender sus productos.
texts.en:
She purchased yarn for her knitting. Olinda, although married and sharing the expenses with her husband, dedicates herself to various businesses to generate enough income to cover the costs of the home and raising the children in her care – her two children and one niece. Primarily, she occupies herself making hand-knitted clothes and sweaters, and in the purchase and sale of dairy products. She started both endeavors recently, only about six months ago. She learned how to make her knitwear working in a factory, where she has worked sporadically for the past two years. She makes her products by buying the raw materials herself. The business involving buying and selling cheeses and other dairy products occurred to her because her mother and father are jungle ranchers. From them, she can obtain a variety of good, natural products that many people prefer to those that are manufactured such as those found primarily in her zone. In addition, Olinda has helped out at the dining hall of her community for the past eight years, along with other women of the township and workmates from her knitting job. Recently, only two months ago, she started taking loans with EDAPROSPO. At 48 years of age, she would like to in the future be able to open a general store in her home to have a fixed location from which to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of yarn for her knitwear.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lizbeth  Vanessa

texts.es:
Compró productos que le faltaban en su tienda.
Lizbeth recién comenzó su negocio hace un año cuando tuvo su bebé, a raíz de que quiso independizarse. Empezó con un pequeño capital que le dio su esposo, y poco a poco con sus ganancias, y desde hace unos meses con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, fue agrandando su negocio de ropa, sábanas y otros productos. Como su esposo se encarga de cubrir los gastos del hogar, ella puede invertir todas sus ganancias en la tienda que comparte con su mamá.
A sus diecinueve años Lizbeth tiene toda su vida delante, y por el momento sus planes por el futuro son de expandir a su negocio, y poco a poco desarrollar un buen hogar para su futura familia.
texts.en:
She purchased products that were missing from her store. Lizbeth only recently started her business, about one year ago, when she had her baby, which led her to want to be independent. She started with a small amount of capital give to her by her husband and, little by little with her earnings and loans from EDAPROSPO, she grew her business selling clothing, sheets, and other products. Since her husband is in charge of covering the household expenses, she can invest all her earnings into the store that she shares with her mother. At 19 years of age, Lizbeth has her whole life ahead of her. For now, her plans for the future include expanding her business developing a good home for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products that were missing from her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana lleva pocos meses con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, pero empezó a dedicarse a su negocio, la venta de cosméticos, ocho meses.
Anteriormente trabajaba de empleada en una tienda de ropa, aproximadamente durante cinco meses, pero cuando quedo en cinta de su ultima hija de dos años y medio dejó el trabajo y se quedó en casa para cuidar la niña.
Su pareja es obrero de construcción y con su ganancias la apoya en los gastos del hogar y de la niña. No obstante, a sus 22 años, Diana se dio cuenta que, para garantizar un futuro mejor a su hija, necesitaba más ingresos. Por esta razón empezó con su negocio de cosméticos, y también le pidió a su mamá que venga a vivir con ella para cuidar a la niña, así Diana puede conseguir un trabajo más estable. En estos días empezará a trabajar en la empresa Telefónica, gracias al empleo que le consiguió una amiga. 
A pesar de que conseguir un negocio propio sea más difícil que conseguir un empleo en alguna empresa, a Diana le gustaría en un futuro abrir una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Diana has had loans for just a few months with EDAPROSPO, but she began working at her business, selling comsetics, eight months ago. Before that she worked as an employee in a clothing store for about five months, but when she became pregnant with her youngest daughter, now two and a half years old, she left her job and stayed at home to care for the baby. Her partner is a construction worker and with his income he helps Diana with the expenses of the household and the child. Even so, at 22 years, Diana realized that in order to guarantee a better future for her daughter she needed more income. This was the reason she began her cosmetics business and also asked her mother to come to live with her to care for the girl, so Diana could get a more stable job. Shortly she will begin to work in the business Telefonica, thanks to a friend who got her the job. Despite the fact that starting your own business is more difficult than getting a job in some business, in the future Diana would like to open a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Use it to pay a pending bill and for her stock of cosmetics

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: La familia D. Ana, D. 50 años D. edad, consta D. 4 miembros, su esposo y tres hijos. La casa donD. viven es propia. Ella se dedica a la sastrería en las instalaciones D. su casa, porque cose desD. la edad D. 14 años a raíz que aprendió D. su madre, D. esa manera estuvo haciendo lo que siempre le gusta, que es confeccionar ropa. Esta actividad la realiza con más interés desD. hace 25 años, y lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos por su buena labor, además le es muy rentable porque cuenta con una clientela selecta y exigente. En adelante Ana quiere mandar construir su propio taller textil. Este es su préstamo número 12 con MFP y se siente satisfecho por la labor que hace en su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprar materiales como telas, hilos, cierres, y otros para confeccionar más prendas que pueda vender.
texts.en:
Ana is 50 years old and has a family of four: her husband and 3 children. They own their home. She works as a seamstress out of her home. She has been sewing since she was 14 years old, when she learned from her mother, and in this way has always been doing what she enjoys, which is making clothing. She has become more dedicated to sewing in the past 25 years, and what she enjoys about her work is that her customers feel satisfied with the good job she does, and that it has been very profitable since she has a select and demanding clientele. In the future, Ana wants to have her own sewing workshop built. This is her 12th loan with MFP and she is very satisfied with the work she does with her communal bank. With the money that she is requesting, she will buy materials such as fabric, thread, zippers, etc. to make more garments that she can sell.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make garments

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a married Mom with two children. She lives in Ordzhonikidze and owns a small business selling cosmetics and perfumes in her home town. Olga has good and loyal clientele who know her little store for versatile merchandise and affordable prices. Olga has been in the trade for 9 years. Presently, her turnover capital is about 40,000 Grivnas. Monthly income is about 6,000 Grivnas. 

Olga would like to increase assorted inventory in her store and her sales as a result. She is hoping to get stable source of income and continue developing her business. A committed wife and mother, Olga works tirelessly to improve the quality of life for her family. Today she is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnas to re-stock her inventory. We are hoping that her eye to market trends and customer needs will help her maintain consistent growth in business and reach success.

loans.use: To re-stock her inventory

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es:
Antes que tuviera hijos, Rogelia se dedicó a variados tipos de trabajos, el último de ellos fue como empleada en una tienda de ropa. Dejó de trabajar cuando tuvo su primer hijo, hace quince años. No obstante, hace tres, cuando nació su tercer y último hijo, se dio cuenta que de alguna manera tenía que apoyar los ingresos de su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de la familia.
Entonces empezó con su negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos. Hasta ahora le ha ido bastante bien, y tuvo ocasión de agrandarlo aún más cuando empezó a recibir préstamos de EDAPROSPO. Las ganancias de su negocio las utiliza para cubrir los gastos que su esposo no alcanza, y las demás las reinvierte en mercancía.
A sus treinta y un años le gustaría, en un futuro, poder juntar un poco de dinero para alquilar un local y abrir una tienda de ropa en el centro de Lima, ya que en Puente Piedra no hay mucha salida de comercio.
texts.en:
Before she had children, Rogelia had a variety of jobs, the last of which was as an employee in a clothing store. She left that job when she had her first child 15 years ago. Nevertheless, three years ago when her third and last child was born, she realized that she had to, in some way, support her husband’s income to cover the household and family expenses. So she began a business selling clothing and shoes. Up until now it has gone rather well, and she had the opportunity to expand her business even more when she began to receive EDAPROSPO loans. The earnings from her business are used to cover the expenses her husband’s income can’t cover, and the rest is invested in merchandise. At 31 years old, she would like, in her future, to be able to save a little money to rent a locale and open a clothing store in Lima’s downtown, because in Puente Piedra there isn’t much commercial business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for her clothing and shoe business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
María se dedica a la venta de ceviche desde un puestito que tiene justo en la puerta de su casa desde hace cinco años, pero recién empezó a recibir préstamos de EDAPROSPO, hace  unos meses. 
Anteriormente tenía un puestito en el mercado donde vendía ceviche y otros platos criollos durante cinco años, pero cayó enferma y tuvo que dejar este trabajo.
No obstante, hace cuatro años empezó a dedicarse también a otro trabajo: ser Distribuidora Independiente de Omnilife. En este negocio su padre fue el primero que empezó, y como le iba bien poco a poco casi toda la familia se juntó a la empresa.
Ahora, a sus cuarenta y cinco años le parece que dedicarse 100% a Omnilife sería su mejor opción en el futuro.
texts.en:
María is dedicated to selling ceviche from a little stand that she has just inside the door of her hourse. She has been doing this business for five years but has recently started receiving loans from EDAPROSPO since a few months ago.

Previously she had a little stand in the market where she sold ceviche and other native dishes, but she became sick and had to leave this job.

Nevertheless, four years ago she began to work at another job as an independent distributor of Omnilife. In this business, her father was the one to start in it, and since it has been going well for him, little by little the whole family joined the business.

Now at age 45, it looks as though dedicating herself 100% to Omnilife will be the best option for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in ingredients for her business - ceviche sales

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es: La señora Cruz tiene 49 años, es casada y vive con sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Ella es propietaria de un motocarro, se dedica a la administración del mismo, también vende golosinas y comida en el tiempo escolar en las afueras de una institución educativa cerca de su casa. Su motocarro lo tiene desde hace 2 años y quien se dedica a manejar y realizar el servicio de transporte de pasajeros es su hijo. Este negocio le produce ingresos que ayudan a fortalecer su hogar, por lo que está satisfecha con este. Además lo considera rentable porque es su propio hijo quien lo maneja y lo cuida como es debido. Posteriormente quiere comprarse otro motocarro para cumplir con su objetivo de incrementar sus ingresos. Ya son 12 veces que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal porque son responsables. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a reparar su herramienta de trabajo (moto), gastará un aproximado 600 soles, con el resto mandará a construir un kiosco en las afueras de su domicilio, comprará golosinas y se implementará con materiales de cocina, además de víveres para cuando inicie la preparación de sus platos en los próximos meses.
texts.en:
Cruz is 49 years old, married, and lives with her 4 children in her own home. She is the owner of a motorcycle taxi, and makes a living managing this business and selling candies and meals outside a school near her home during the academic year. She has had her motorcycle taxi for the past 2 years, and her son makes his living driving it and transporting passengers. This business generates income that helps Cruz improve her home, and for that reason she is very pleased with it. Besides, she considers it worthwhile, since she employs her own son to drive the motorcycle taxi and look after it properly. She eventually wants to purchase another motorcycle taxi so that she can achieve her goal of increasing her family’s income. Cruz has previously taken out loans from Kiva partner MFP on 12 separate occasions; she likes the work that her communal bank does because it is very responsible. She wants to use the money she is requesting to have the ‘tool of her trade’—her motorcycle—repaired, which will cost approximately 600 Peruvian soles. Cruz plans to use the rest of the money to have a kiosk built outsider her home, to purchase candies, and to set herself up with cooking utensils and supplies for when she begins preparing her meals in the coming months.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing her motorcycle taxi and investing in her store

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is divorced with a daughter. She lives in Zaporozhye and works in Yubileynyi market selling animal feed and accessories. There are very few other vending kiosks with the same type of inventory. Oksana has been in this trade for 10 years. Presently, her turnover capital is about 50,000 Grivnas.

Oksana is requesting a loan of 2,500 Grivnas to purchase the fourth vending facility in the market and improve the financial situation in her family. She believes in success for her venture and is willing to learn and work hard to be better at what she does. We think Oksana’s ability to find her niche, put her customers' needs first and take care of them will be instrumental to her business success.

Note: this is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To open a new vending facility

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all girls. She says currently, one of them is in senior high school, another in junior high school while the rest are in primary school. Her husband is a cocoa and palm farmer. She lives with her family in an old family house at Simpa. Simpa is a small farming community which is a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants combine farming with other economic activities.

Rose sells maize and groundnuts. She buys bags of maize and groundnuts from the farmers in her community and nearby villages. She says food vendors come from the big cities to buy from her. She also sells in the local market and treks to nearby markets. Rose has been in business for three years. She wants to buy maize/groundnuts on a larger scale so that she can supply them to the increasing number of her customers and increase her profit. Rose desires to help her children climb the academic ladder to higher levels.

loans.use: To procure maize and groundnuts for re-sale

loans.name: Nolasco

texts.es:
Invirtió para aumentar la mercancía de su tienda.
A sus sesenta y un años, Nolasco tiene a cargo el negocio que sustenta la familia, un hijo todavía menor de edad, y a su esposa inválida. 
Nolasco dedicó casi toda su vida a trabajos en diferentes empresas, como personal de limpieza principalmente, trabajo en el cual recién, en enero de este año, logró jubilarse y conseguir una pensión que lo ayude ahora a cubrir los gastos del hogar y de su familia.
Hace seis años su esposa perdió sus piernas, así que el tuvo que encontrar una manera de trabajar y poder cuidar de ella a la misma vez. Entonces abrió una tiendita de abarrotes en su propia casa. Hace pocos meses empezó a sacar préstamos de EDAPROSPO, y en el futuro espera poder mejorar su tienda y su hogar, y tal vez disponer de servicios como Internet.
texts.en:
He invested to increase the goods in his store. At 71 years of age, Nolasco is responsible for the store which supports his family, a son still a minor, and his disabled wife. Nolasco has spent almost his entire life working in different businesses, mainly as a cleaner. Recently, in January of this year, he managed to retire and receive a pension which now helps him to cover the household expenses. Six years ago, his wife lost her legs and so he had to find a way of working and of caring for her at the same time. To do this he opened a small grocery store in his home. A few months ago he began taking loans from EDAPROSPO and in the future he hopes to make improvements to his store and his home and perhaps even get services such as the internet.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more goods for retail

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia lleva cuatro meses con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, pero ya lleva tres años con su negocio. Ella compra y vende bajo pedidos: quesos, maca y miel. Los quesos los trae desde Huancayo. Se animó a empezar este negocio una vez que estuvo en Huancayo, donde a menudo viaja para visitar a su familia, y gracias a un familiar se enteró que podía comprar quesos allí para venderlos a un precio un poco más alto en Puente Piedra.
Con las ganancias de la venta de sus productos vuelve a invertir en el negocio, los demás gastos del hogar los cubre su esposo que es chofer.
A sus treinta y ocho años planea en un futuro tener una tienda propia desde donde vender quesos y otros productos lácteos, su esposo está tratando de construir el local en el pequeño lote donde viven.
texts.en:
Sonia has been borrowing from EDAPROSPO for four months but has had her business for three years. She buys and sells goods on request: cheese, maca [an Andean root vegetable] and honey. She brings the cheese from Huancayo. She decided to start her business on a trip to Huancayo where she often travels to visit her family: thanks to a family member she realized that she could buy cheese there and sell it for a slightly higher price in Puente Piedra. With the profits from the sale of these products she has begun to invest in the business; her husband who is a driver pays for the household expenses. Thirty-eight years old, she is planning to own a proper store in the future, where she can sell cheese and other milk products. Her husband is trying to build her a store on the small lot on which they live.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loan was used to buy maca [an Andean root vegetable] for her grocery store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married. She and her husband live in Zaporozhye. Nadezhda sells women’s clothing in Yubileynyi market. She has been in the trade for 10 years. Presently, Nadezhda has about 25,000 Grivnas in inventory. Her gross income amounts to 5,000 Grivnas.

Nadezhda sees an opportunity for business growth this spring season. Her expertise in quality clothing merchandise is greatly appreciated by her customers. Her desire to assist clients and her entrepreneurial spirit are part of what makes her business successful. Nadezhda has requested a loan for 2,500 Grivnas to broaden the assortment of clothing items she offers at her kiosk so she will be ready for the busy season. She has proven to be a strong and reliable client with “Nadiya Ukraine”. We believe that this loan will be a big help to Nadezhda as she looks for ways to increase her business activity.

Note: this is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase assortment of clothing items.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica A. is forty years old. She is divorced but has given birth to three children, all girls. All of her children have completed junior high school but could not go further due to financial problems. They have taken to selling and learning a trade – hairdressing. Monica lives with her children in a rented apartment in a small town called Simpa, a farming community which is a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana. She works as a petty trader to provide for her children.

Monica prepares ‘rice-kenkey’ and distributes it to retailers in her community. She says she uses local rice to prepare the "kenkey". She prepares rice-kenkey by first pounding the rice, mixing it with salt, wrapping it in plantain leaves and cooking it. She also sells her rice-kenkey in the local market apart from distributing it to retailers. Monica has been in business for over twenty years. It has been her desire to make savings enough so she can take very good care of the family. She wants a loan to procure bags of local rice in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Desde que tenia veinte años se dedica al rubro de la carpintería. Hoy a sus veintinueve años es dueño de un taller de carpintería que este año cumple cinco años desde que se inicio.
Wilmer de muy joven ha trabajado como comerciante vendiendo diversos productos como lanas y jabones. No fue sino después de haber abandono su trabajo en una fábrica de cerrajería que ingreso a trabajar en un depósito de madera, donde el interés por la carpintería nació.
Su sueño siempre fue tener un negocio propio, poco a poco durante los años que han pasado ha sabido administrar bien su taller y hoy goza de buena clientela. A la par con su trabajo, actualmente esta estudiando diseño de interiores para en un par de años tener tiendas de muebles.
Compra de materiales para su taller
texts.en:
Wilmer C. A. has worked in carpentry since he was twenty years old. Now, at the age of twenty-nine, he is the owner of a carpentry shop that he opened almost five years ago. Since a very young age, Wilmer has worked as a tradesman, selling a variety of products such as cloth and soaps. It was not until after he left his job at a locksmith factory that he began to work at a lumberyard, and it was there that his interest in carpentry was born. He had always dreamed of owning his own business. Little by little over the years, he has learned how to be a good business manager. Today, he enjoys a strong clientele. On top of this job, he is currently studying interior design so that in a couple of years he can open a furniture shop. He requests this loan to purchase materials for his carpentry shop.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for his carpentry shop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vita

texts.en:
Vita owns a retail business and has two locations at the food market. She sells bread and bakery products at one location and clothing (underwear, slippers, t-shirts, etc.) at the second location. She has been in the business for 7 years now. Vita used to work as a sales person before she decided to start her own business. Later, her husband joined her.

Vita would like to get a loan of 9,000 UAH to open new location. This business is the only source of income for this family. She would buy 500 pairs of slippers, 50 pajamas, and 100 t-shirts.

loans.use: To open new location

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es: Damaris tiene 28 años, en la actualidad está embarazada, vive con su cónyuge y un hijo en su casa propia. Ella tiene una pequeña distribuidora de gaseosas, producto que vende a las distintas bodegas y bares que se encuentran por su zona. Esta labor la viene ejerciendo desde hace 15 años, cuenta con la ayuda de su pareja, quien es el que administra el negocio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le genera buenos ingresos y eso repercute en la mejora de la calidad de vida que les pueden brindar a sus hijos. Posteriormente quiere tener una hielera para vender en grande bloques a los pescadores, quienes serían sus principales clientes, debido a que se encuentra muy cerca al puerto fluvial. Es la primera vez que recibe un crédito de MFP, y tiene expectativas muy positivas de su trabajo con su asesor de crédito en su banco comunal. Con el dinero solicitado comprará un motocarro, que le cuesta 4000 soles, lo que cubrirá con este préstamo y con los ahorros que tiene para este objetivo. Ya que necesita de esta movilidad, la cual le servirá para transportar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Damaris is 28 years old and is pregnant. She lives with her husband and a son in her own home. She has a small soft drink distribution company and sells her products to a variety of general stores and bars in her neighborhood. She has been doing this work for the past 15 years and she counts on the help of her husband, who manages the business. She likes her work because it lets her make a good income and this helps her give a better quality of life to her children. In the future she would like to buy a cooler to sell large quantities to the fishermen, who would be her principal clients, as she is very close to the river port. This is the first time she has received a loan from Kiva partner MFP (Microfinanzas PRISMA), and she has high expectations because of her work with the communal banking representative. She will buy a moto-car with this loan, which will cost 4000 soles (about $1,220), and she will use the money from this loan and money she has saved for this purpose to buy it. She needs this mobility, as it will help her transport her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a moto-car to transport her products

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Debido a que sus padres se dedicaron siempre a la pesca y venta de pescados, Maria creció en este mundo y por lo tanto, cuando se independizo también se dedico a la venta de pescados.
A sus cuarenta y ocho años ya tiene más de veinte en su negocio. Hoy en día, su puesto de ventas se ubica a una cuadra del mercado, como ambulante. Antes tenia un espacio alquilado dentro del mercado pero tuvo problemas con el administrador del centro comercial y decidió vender por su cuenta.
Felizmente Maria es muy carismática y sus clientes son muy fieles a ella y no la dejan de visitar. En el futuro quisiera ampliar sus ventas y poder adquirir un puesto grande dentro del mercado.
texts.en:
Because her parents always worked in fishing and selling fish, Maria grew up around the business of fish and when she became independent she too worked selling fish. At 48 years of age, she has more than 20 years in this business. Today, her stall is located on one of the corners of the market, as a street vendor. She used to rent a spot inside the market but had problems with the administrator of the central market and decided to strike out on her own. Happily, Maria is very charismatic and her customers are very loyal and have not stopped seeing her. In the future she would like to expand her sales and be able to get a large stall inside the market.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria se dedica a la venta de ropa y a la compostura de prendas de vestir en el mercado más cercano de su casa. Hace cinco años que goza de tener un puesto propio por el cual no tiene preocupaciones de renta y le permite tener un negocio mas rentable.
Anteriormente estuvo vendiendo como ambulante alrededor de ocho años. No obstante, la municipalidad le restringió el permiso y tuvo que abandonar las calles para vender dentro del mercado.
El interés por la venta de ropa nació cuando vendía prendas de vestir al por mayor en su casa, en donde se dedicaba también a la fabricación de monederos y pequeñas carteras. Es así que se dio cuenta que el negocio de ropa era bueno si se esforzaba mas.
Por otro lado, también recibe ingresos gracias al alquiler de un mini departamento que se ubica en el segundo piso de su casa.
A sus cincuenta y siete años, aun tiene muchos planes para el futuro, como juntarse con un grupo de compañeras y formar una pequeña empresa de fabricación de ropa. Más adelante quisiera
Ropas y zapatos para surtir su puesto
texts.en:
Candelaria makes a living by selling clothing and also by mending clothing items in the marketplace closest to her house. For the past 5 years she has enjoyed having her own stall at the market. She does not have to worry about paying high rent and it allows her to have a profitable business. She was an ambulatory salesperson for about 8 years. However, the city government started to restrict licenses for ambulatory salespeople and she had to abandon selling in the streets and move to the marketplace. She became interested in selling clothing when she started to sell clothing at wholesale prices out of her house. She also worked making coin purses and wallets. She then realized that the business of selling clothing would be profitable if she worked harder. Candelaria also receives rental income from a studio that she rents out which is located on the second floor of her house. She is 57 years old and she still has many plans for the future. One of her plans is to get together with a group of women like her and start a small business that specializes in making clothing. She would also like to have a larger selection of clothing and shoes to sell at the market place.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing and Shoes to Increase Her Inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bitca's Group

texts.en: Bitca E.'s group and all members of this group are farmers. All of them are relatives and live in the same district. I. works very hard every day and is very responsible regarding his family. He and his brother Racila A. manage a store where they sell vegetables together with relatives,they grow on 20 hectares of arable land which was inherited from their parents. I. suggested to his relatives to take a loan to open one more store in the wholesale market. All of them agreed because sales are going well so they will be able to return money back without out standings.

loans.use: increase working capital

loans.name: Julia,

texts.es:
Desde hace siete años Julia se dedica a la venta de frazadas y polares según los pedidos de amigos familiares y personas que la conocen. La idea de este negocio nació a raíz de que su esposo empezó a trabajar en una fábrica textil. Para poder aportar un ingreso económico al hogar fue que Julia se animo a comprar productos de  la fabrica de su esposo y revenderlas a un precio un poco mayor.
Anteriormente a este trabajo ella cuenta haber organizado siempre todo tipo de actividades para generar ingresos. Con sus ganancias apoya a sus hijos. Pero más adelante, cuando sus hijos terminen sus estudios quisiera seguir progresando para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
En estos días esta planeando invertir junto con su esposo un nuevo negocio de venta de vinos.
Compra de vino al por mayor para nuevo negocio
texts.en:
For the past seven years Julia has been selling electric blankets and sweatshirts based on orders from friends, family and acquaintances. She got the idea to open this business because her husband started work in a textile factory. In order to contribute to the household Julia decided to buy products from the factory her husband worked at and retail them at a slightly higher price. Before this enterprise, she tells us that she always found various ways of generating income. With her profits she supports her children. In the future, when her children will have finished their studies, she would like to continue progressing in order to have a better quality of life. For now she is planning to invest with her husband in a new business: wine sales. She will buy wine wholesale for the new business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wine wholesale for a new business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dan

texts.es: Dan tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hijo, la casa donde viven es propia. Él brinda servicios de cabinas públicas de Internet, a razón de encontrarse cerca de una Institución Educativa porque sus principales clientes son los niños y jóvenes colegiales. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años atrás, administra y atiende su negocio él solo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se relaciona con los jóvenes quienes le piden su apoyo para cualquier tema a tratar. Le es muy rentable porque ya cuenta con su fiel clientela y sus cabinas funcionan diariamente. Posteriormente quiere ampliar y comprarse más computadoras, ya que las que tiene no abastece a muchos jóvenes que necesitan de este servicio. Con este son 9 préstamos que Dan ha trabajado con MFP, además que le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para mandar a reparar sus computadoras, ya que tienen que estar en buenas condiciones para su uso diario.
texts.en:
Dan is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and his son in a house he owns. He offers internet access to the public. Because he is close to a school, most of his customers are children and young people who attend the school. He has had this business for two years: he manages and attends to his business alone. What he likes best about his work is interacting with the young people who ask for his help. The business is very profitable because he has loyal customers and his internet stations are always busy. In the future he wants to expand and buy more computers as he doesn't have enough for all the young people who need this service. This will be Dan's ninth loan with MFP. He also enjoys working with his community bank. He will use the loan to repair his computers as they need to be in good condition for daily use.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Computer maintenance

loans.name: Rosa,

texts.es:
Hasta los veintiocho años Rosa se desenvolvía como una gran ama de casa; sin embargo, llegado a sus veintinueve años ella afirma haber sentido la necesidad de trabajar y sentirse productiva, no solo por ella , sino también por sus dos hijos de nueve y dos años.
A raíz de esto, ella decide abrir en un local dentro de la casa de sus padres, unas cabinas públicas de Internet. En solo un año ha crecido este negocio, de tal modo que también ofrece el servicio de fotocopiado, venta de útiles de oficina y, por el verano, también vende helados.
En unos años ella desea seguir creciendo para luego mudarse a un local mas grande. A la par de su negoció ella también ofrece servicio de diseño grafico, practicando los cursos que llevó cuando salió del colegio.
Helados por ser temporada de verano
texts.en:
Until she was 28 years old Rosa was just a great housewife, however, when she turned 29 when she felt the need to work to make money and to feel productive. She wanted this not just for herself, but for her two kids who are 9 and 2 years old. So she decided to open a business in her parent's house where people come and pay to use the Internet. In only a year her business has grown and she now also offers photocopier services. She also sells office supplies, and during the summer she sells ice cream. In aditon, she offers services in graphic design since she has taken classes in graphic design. Looking forward to the next two years, Rosa hope that her business continues to grow so that she can move her business to a bigger space.

(Translated by Ashlee and Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ice Cream to Sell During The Summer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila tiene 33 años, es casada, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas y bebidas de todas las variedades en un pequeño local construido por su esposo, esta labor la realiza desde hace 5 años atrás. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque la mantiene activa y conoce a muchas personas, además le es muy rentable porque su negocio se encuentra ubicado cerca de un colegio y tiene ingresos diarios que provienen, en su mayoría de los colegiales. Más adelante Domitila quiere llegar a tener su minimarket. Ya son 2 veces que recibe un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido a ser puntual en sus cuotas de devolución. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a ampliar su negocio y ambientarlo mucho mejor para verse más presentable ante sus clientes, también comprará más golosinas y bebidas gaseosas.
texts.en:
Domitila is 33 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two children in a house she owns. She sells candies and refreshments of all kinds in a small locale made by her husband. She has had this business for five years. She enjoys her work very much because it keeps her busy and she meets many people. In addition, the business is very profitable because it is located near a high school. Most of her sales are to students. In the future, Domitila would like to have a convenience store. This is her second loan from MFP; she is committed to repaying the loan on time. She will use the loan to expand her business and give it a better atmosphere so that it will be more attractive to her customer; she will also buy more candies and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to resell

loans.name: Vilma Margoth,

texts.es:
A partir de las seis de la tarde hasta la medianoche, Vilma Casimiro se dedica a vender anticuchos en la puerta de su casa desde hace un par de años. Antes de vender anticuchos vendía frituras puesto que consiguió un carrito ambulante donde cocinar. En este negocio estuvo solos dos años hasta que el carrito se descompuso. Además la competencia en la venta de frituras era cada vez más alta.
Vilma empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos variados, especialmente cosméticos por catalogo. Su esposo, quien trabaja como chofer contratado de una reconocida clínica, y ella cubren los gastos del hogar. En unos años ella quisiera abrir un restaurante si se le presentara la oportunidad.
texts.en:
From 6 in the afternoon until midnight Vilma Casimiro sells kebobs from the door of her home – something she has done for six years. Prior to selling kebobs she used to sell fried food as she obtained a small cart where she could cook. She was in this business only two years when her cart broke. In addition, the competition in fried food continued to grow. Vilma began working selling various products, including cosmetics through a catalogue. She and her husband, who works as a contracted driver for a well-known clinic, cover the household expenses. In a few years she would like to open a restaurant if she has the opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients and materials for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: El señor Enrique tiene 50 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos y la casa donde viven es propia. Es propietario de un motocarro, con el que se dedica a brindar servicio de trasportes de pasajeros por los distintos lugares de su zona, este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 3 años atrás. Lo que le gusta de esta labor es estar en contacto con los distintos clientes que requieren de su servicio, y le es muy rentable a sola razón de que él mismo labora en su herramienta de trabajo y es quien lo administra. Lo más difícil para él es no contar con un lugar adecuado para guardar su motocarro, ya que los robos son constantes. Posteriormente quiere tener un negocio adicional de la venta de abarrotes, lo que significará nuevos ingresos para su hogar. Ya son 6 veces que está recibiendo un crédito con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal ya que se lleva bien con todos sus compañeros. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a reparar su motocarro, comprar llantas y desde luego construir un garaje para su vehículo y estar protegido de cualquier robo.
texts.en:
Enrique is 50 years old, married, with three children, and they live in their own home. He owns a motorcar with which he provides passenger transportation to different places in his area. He has been doing this work for 3 years. What he likes about this work is having contact with various customers who require his service. It is very profitable because he himself fixes his vehicle and manages it. The most difficult for him is not having an adequate place to park his motorcar, and robberies are constant in the area. In the future he wants to have another business selling groceries, which will generate new income for his home. This is his 6th loan with MFP, and he likes to work with the communal bank and he gets along well with his colleagues. With the money from the loan he wants to send his motorcar for repair, buy tires, and then construct a garage for his vehicle so it is protected from being stolen.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his motorcar and build a garage

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet K. is twenty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: a boy and three daughters. The first three of her children are already in school; the last born is yet to start. She lives with her husband and children in a family house at a small town called Simpa. Simpa is a farming community which is a few kilometers away from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana.

Janet’s husband is a farmer who cultivates palm nuts. She is a bread baker. Janet buys bags of flour and other ingredients from wholesalers in the nearby markets. She bakes bread in a traditional oven made from clay. Janet says she supplies to beverage sellers and retailers in her community. Janet has been in business for four years. It has been her desire to expand her business so she can make enough savings to help her husband take very good care of the family. She wants a loan to procure bags of flour in bulk so she can supply bread to more customers.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
Maria es una señora muy dedicada a su familia, por ello siempre busca la manera de apoyara a su esposo con el mantenimiento de ella. Es así que desde hace nueve años trabaja ofreciendo servicio de limpieza en la Municipalidad de su distrito. Antes de este trabajo ayudaba a vender a una amiga todo lo referente a productos de belleza y eventualmente preparando comida. Sin embargo, luego de un tiempo se independizó y con la ayuda de su hija vendía por su cuenta cosméticos por catálogo.
Sus ganancias siempre las ha destinado para la construcción de su casa. Justo ahora esta arreglando la fachada de su casa, ya que en unos meses piensa abrir, si consigue el capital, una bodega en su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is a women very dedicated to her family, and she always looks for ways to support her husband in maintaining the family. It's for this reason that for the past 9 years she worked offering a cleaning service in her district council. Before this job, she used to help a friend selling beauty products and eventually preparing food. After a time she became independent and with the help of her daughter, began to sell cosmetics from a catalogue from her own account. Her earnings have always been destined for the construction of her house. Now she is repairing the facade of her house, where, in a few months, if she obtains the capital, she is thinking of opening a grocery store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House construction

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jane

texts.es: La señora Jane tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en su casa propia con sus 2 hijos quienes la apoyan mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad en su casa donde constituyó una pequeña bodega, la misma que lo tiene desde hace un año. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce a muchas personas, y le es rentable porque es la única bodega en la cuadra donde vive. Posteriormente quiere poner un lavadero de motos y autos en las afueras de su domicilio, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy transitada. Ya son 3 veces que está recibiendo un préstamo con MFP, y le gusta el trabajo que hace con su banco comunal, con el que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprara más abarrotes (azúcar, arroz, leche, etc.) y sobre todo ampliará su el espacio de su bodega, ya que está aumentando la demanda de sus productos.
texts.en:
Jane is 33 years old, is a single mother and lives in her own house with her 2 children, who support her a lot. She sells grocery products and items of necessity in her house, where she built a small grocery store, which she has had for a year. What Jane likes about her work is that she meets many people, and it is profitable because it's the only grocery store on the block where she lives. Later, she wants to instal a carwash outside her house, as she lives in a very busy zone. This is the third time that Jane has received a loan from MFP, and she likes the work that she does with her communal bank, where she is punctual with her payments. With the money that she is seeking this time, Jane will buy more items of necessity (sugar, rice, milk etc) and above all will increase the space in her grocery store, now that demand for her products is growing.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand grocery store and buy groceries

loans.name: Maris Yamileth

texts.es:
La Sra. Maris tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, ella se dedica a confeccionar prendas, camisas, faldas, pantalones, trajes etc. es una Sra. muy responsabel y amable, ella pasa muchas horas al dia costurando para poder terminar sus trabajos que tiene pendientes para poder entregarlos a sus clientes y cuando tiene tiempos libres en las tardes vende cremas, lipsticks, carteras, shampoos, desodorantes, gel de baño.  ella en estos momentos necesita un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y telas ya que tiene muchos trabajos pendientes y necesita comprar dicha materia prima para poder terminarlos. 
Maris tiene dos hijos de los cuales dependen de ella, su meta a corto plazo es ver a sus hijos graduados ya que uno de ellos este año ingresa al colegio.
texts.en:
Maris is 31 years old, and is a single mother. She sells garments, shirts, skirts, pants, suits etc. She is a very responsible and friendly lady, and spends many hours each day sewing so that she can finish the jobs that she has pending, to give them to her clients. When she has spare time in the afternoons she sells creams, lipsticks, handbags, shampoos, deodorants and bath gels. In this moment she requires a loan to buy more merchandise and threads as she now has many pending jobs and needs to buy this material to be able to finish them. Maris has 2 children that depend on her. Her short term goal is to see her children graduate, now that one of them this year will enter school.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth, threads, sponges

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 21 años, vive con su pareja, aun no tienen hijos, la casa donde vive es propia. Ella es propietaria de un motocarro, trabaja en comunión con su esposo en el transporte de pasajeros, mientras él es quien lo maneja y recorre las calles de su localidad brindando servicio de taxi a diversas personas, al final del día, es Lidia quien administra todas las ganancias. Ya son dos años que viene trabajando de esta manera y han obtenido ganancias satisfactorias, a pesar de la proliferación de los motocarros y con ello el aumento de la competencia, ellos se esfuerzan mucho para seguir obteniendo ingresos que logren cubrir sus gastos diarios. Esta es la primera vez que Lidia tiene un préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta por el trabajo en su banco comunal, quiere aprender de su asesor de crédito y del resto de miembros formas para mejorar su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a reparar su motocarro y con lo que le reste quiere reparar algunas estructuras de su casa.
texts.en:
Lidia is 21 years old and lives with her husband. They do not yet have children, and they live in their own home. She owns a moto-car and works with her husband transporting passengers. While he drives the taxi and gives rides to various people, at the end of the day, it is Lidia who administers the earnings. They have been working this way for the past two years and have made good earnings despite the proliferation of moto-cars and with it, increased competition. They work very hard to keep earning the income they need to cover their daily expenses. This is the first time that Lidia has received a loan from Kiva partner MFP (Microfinanzas PRISMA), and she is very happy with her work with the communal bank. She would like to learn from her loan officer and the rest of the members about ways in which she can improve her business. With the loan she will repair the moto-car and with any that is left over she would like to make some structural repairs to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her moto-car

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Desde hace cuatro años Ysabel vende cosméticos de tres distintas marcas. También se dedica a la venta de ropa bajo pedidos. Anteriormente, a lo largo de dos años estuvo trabajando en un colegio como auxiliar, debido a los estudios de educación que tuvo cuando era joven.
El negocio de los cosméticos nació a raíz de que Isabel vio que sus tiempos libres los podía ocupar también en algo que le generara un ingreso adicional, un trabajo que sea sobretodo independiente.
A sus cuarenta y ocho años y con dos hijos ya mayores de edad e independientes, Isabel quisiera aumentar la mercadería de sus cosméticos y poder comprar una vitrina grande para mostrar a sus clientes todo su stock.
texts.en:
For the past 4 years Ysabel has sold 3 different brands of cosmetics She also sells clothing to customers that place orders through her. She also worked at a private school as a teacher's aid for two years. She was able to get this job because of her level of education. She started to sell cosmetics because she could run the business in her free time and earn money. She also loves working for herself. Now that she is 48 years old and her 2 kids are grown and independent, Ysabel would like to increase her inventory of cosmetics and also buy a glass case to display her current stock to her customers.

(Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beauty Products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: la Sra. Margarita A. tiene 43 años de edad, ella tiene su taller de costura para confeccionar prendas, camisas, faldas, pantalones, trajes, cameras, cortinas.  desde muy temprano en la mañana empieza a costurar para poder entregar a tiempo sus encargos, ella es muy dedicada a su trabajo, ella tambien vende su producto a gente que revende su producto en diferentes lugares de la cuidad capital, en estos momentos ella necesita comprar mas materiales para poder tener una mayor produccion y ahora quiere fabricar almohadas, su meta para este año es comprarse una maquina sogeteadora marca COVER especialmente para hacer ruedos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita A. is 43 years old. She has a sewing workshop to fabricate garments, shirts, skirts, pants, suits, bed covers, and curtains. She begins sewing very early in the morning to be able to deliver her orders on time. She is very dedicated to her work. She also sells her products to others who resell them at different locations in the capital city. Currently she needs to buy more materials to be able to increase production, and she now wants to begin making pillows. Her goal for this year is to buy herself a Cover brand serger especially for making hems.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase liner fabric, pillow stuffing, curtain fabric etc.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos de 28 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con sus padres y la casa donde radica es propia de su familia. Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte a pasajeros por las distintas zonas donde vive, a razón de ser propietario de un motocarro, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace 3 años atrás y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar un buen trato a sus pasajeros y sobre todo la confianza necesaria durante el viaje. Esta actividad le es rentable ya que es él mismo quien maneja y no tiene que contratar a un chofer, además cuida y administra solo su negocio. En el futuro le gustaría tener un taller de mecánica, ya que estudió para eso y desea poner en práctica su profesión. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque, menciona, que le brindaron la oportunidad que otros no le supieron dar, por lo que está muy agradecido. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a reparar su herramienta de trabajo y luego comprar ropa y zapatos para vender y obtener un dinero extra.
texts.en:
Marcos is 28 years old, single, and lives with his parents in their family's house. He works offering transportation to passengers between the various zones where he lives. For this reason, he owns a motorcycle taxi, which he has been using for his job for 3 years. What he likes about his job is giving his passengers a good experience and above all the confidence necessary during the trip. This job is profitable since he drives himself and does not have to hire a driver. Also, he manages and takes care of the business by himself. In the future, he would like to have a mechanic shop since he studied mechanics, and wishes to put his profession in practice. This is his second loan with Kiva partner MFP. He likes to work with his communal bank, because they offer him an opportunity that others are not able to provide. For this, he is very thankful. With the money that he is requesting, he wants to send in his motorcycle taxi for repairs, and then purchase clothing and shoes to resell in order to earn extra money.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorcycle taxi repairs and the purchase of clothing for resale

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria Teresa tiene 31años, vive con sus hijos y su esposo en su casa propia. Su actividad es la venta de ropa y zapatos, los mismos que los vende ambulatoriamente por la zona donde vive, dejando sus prendas al contado o al crédito. Esta labor la viene realizando desde hace 4 años juntamente con su esposo, quien es el encargado de viajar a comprar la mercadería para luego traerla y llevarla a vender. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y muchas personas, además le es rentable porque tiene su clientela que le solicitan con anticipación sus prendas. Posteriormente quiere tener un local para instalar su propia tienda de ropa. Ya son 11 veces que recibe un préstamo con MFP, y le gusta mucho trabajar con los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más ropa y zapatos, y en adelante mandará a construir un local para poner su mini tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa is 31 years old, lives with her children and husband. She owns her own house. Her activities are selling shoes and clothes in her neighborhood. She accepts full payment from her customers or she keeps a tab. She has been doing this for the past 4 years with her husband who is the one in charge of traveling to buy the merchandise to sell. The thing she likes about her job is that she travels and meets a lot of people. Her business is also profitable because she has her clients that pre-order their clothing items. In the future she wants to have her own store. She has received 11 loans from MFP and she enjoys working with the members of her communal bank. With the money she is asking for, she will buy more clothing and shoes. In the future she would like to have enough to build her own little clothing store.

(Translated by Ashlee and Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Merchandise

loans.name: Quinto

texts.es: Quinto de 30 años de edad, vive con su hija y su conviviente. La casa donde viven es de su madre. El se dedica al transporte pasajeros desde hace 2 años atrás, a razón de ser propietario de un motocarro. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce mucha gente con quien comparte ideas, para Quinto es muy importante dar un trato amable a sus clientes para que luego lo busquen cuando necesiten de sus servicios. Esta actividad le es rentable porque no tiene que contratar a otra persona y él mismo se encarga de administrar sus ganancias diarias y de su mantenimiento. Lo que se convierte en una dificultad es que ya que existe mucha competencia, hay demasiadas personas brindando el mismo servicio, por ello en ocasiones compra diferentes productos y los lleva a vender al mercado. Quinto desea tener una bodega en su casa, ya que no existe competencia por donde vive. Es el 2do préstamo que tiene con MFP, y está comprometido a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el dinero que solicita comprará un motor nuevo para su motocarro, ya que el que está usando se encuentra en mal estado y no le permite trabajar. Con lo que resta de dinero lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para empezar a implementar su pequeña bodega ya que cuenta con el espacio adecuado.
texts.en:
Quinto is 30 years old and lives with his daughter and his partner. They live in his mother's house. He has been transporting passengers for the past two years as he owns his own motocar. What he enjoys about his work is that he meets many people with whom he shares ideas. Quinto feels it is very important to treat customers well so that later they will look for him when they are in need of his services. This is a profitable entreprise because he does not need to hire anyone else: he alone is in charge of managing his daily profits and of his maintenance. The hard part of his work is that there is a competition where he lives. This is his second loan with MFP and he is committed to repaying the loan punctually. He will use the loan to buy a new motor for his motocar as the one he has is in poor condition and does not allow him to work. He will invest the remainder of the loan in the purchase of groceries so that he can open a small store because he has the space to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new motor for his motocar

loans.name: Maria Luz,

texts.es:
Durante siete años Luz atiende en su librería propia que por ahora no esta funcionando ya que esta remodelando el local de esta para tener un espacio mas grande donde pueda caber una mercadería mas grande. Todos sus productos se encuentran en la casa de su hermana hasta el término dela construcción. 
A la par, ella también se dedica a  ofrecer servicio de limpieza en un hospital desde hace tres años. Antes de su librería Luz trabajaba vendiendo frutas en el mercado, sin embargo el cuidado de sus hijos, quienes en ese entonces estaban pequeños aun, decidió formar un negocio que no la aleje de su casa.
Sus ganancias en gran parte la reinvierte en la librería, solo una pequeña fracción las destina para los gastos de su casa. Poco a poco quiere llegar a tener una librería que esté surtida en todo.
Enrejado de su nuevo local para que este asegurado
texts.en:
During 7 years, Luz has attended her own book store which for now is not working, since she is remodeling the space to have a biggger space where she can fit a larger merchandise. All of her products are found in her sisters houe until she finishes construction. She is also dedicated to offering cleaning service in a hospital for three years. Before her bookstore, Luz worked selling fruits in the market, of course raising her children, who were still little though, so she decided to form a business which didn't take her away from her home. Her earnings are largely reinvested in the bookstore, only a small fraction is destined for her household expenses. Little by little she wants to get to having a bookstore which is fully stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodeling her bookstore to be secure

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: la Sra Sara S. tiene 39 años de edad, ella reside en la colonia Hato de Enmedio de esta ciudad capital, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos de todo tipo, tambien vende ropa para dama, caballero y niños, gracias a sus ventas ha logrado salir adelante y ha podido dar una estabilidad a su familia, con las ganancias tambien paga alquiler de su negocio y cubre todos los gastos alimenticios, salud y educacion para su familia, ella es una mujer muy luchadora y gracias a su espiritu de trabajo y superacion ha logrado salir adelante, en estos momentos ella necesita un credito para poder inyectarle mas mercaderia al negocio y asi poder tener una tienda mas grande y tener mayores ganancias. su meta es poder tener varias tiendas en diferentes colonias.
texts.en:
Sara S. is 39 years old. She lives Hato de Enmedio in the capital city. She sells shoes of all types and also sells women’s, men’s and children’s clothing. Thanks to her sales she has succeeded in moving forward and bringing stability to her family. With her earnings, she pays the rent for her business and also covers all the food, medical and educational expenses for her family. She is a fighter, and thanks to her hard-working spirit and desire to overcome she has succeeded in moving forward. Right now she needs a loan to be able to bring in more merchandise for her store and also to be able to have a bigger store and better income. Her aim is to be able to have various stores in different neighborhoods.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy women's and men's shoes and clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Alejandrina,

texts.es:
María es una señora a quien caracteriza su emprendimiento. A sus cincuenta y tres años ella es líder D. un grupo señoras trabajadoras y ama D. casa, promueve el desarrollo D. su comunidad y es una D. estas fundadoras D. su pueblo. 
Cuando era muy joven aprendió la confección textil. Es por ello que desD. siempre ha estado aprendiendo más sobre este rubro y hoy en día, junto con sus amigas, recibe clases D. bisutería y bordados.
Siendo madre y padre D. sus dos últimos hijos, aun es edad escolar, ya que hace algunos años perdió a su esposo, ella se siente con mucha más responsabilidad para cuidar D. su hogar. Actualmente, tiene pensado comprar maquinarias D. confección para construir un taller granD. D. confección D. disfraces.
Arreglar máquinas D. coser remalladoras que se encuentran en mal estado
texts.en:
Maria is a woman is characterized by her undertakings. At 53 years old, she is a leader of a group of female workers and a housewife. She promotes the development of her community and is one of the founders of her town.

When she was very young, she learned tailoring. Ever since this she has always been learning more in this area. Today, together with her friends, she takes classes in jewelry making and embroidery.

Being mother and father to her last two children, one who is school-aged, since some years ago when she lost her husband, she feels very responsible her hometown. At the moment, she is thinking of buying sewing machines to construct a large workshop for costume making.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix sewing machines in disrepair

loans.name: Rosmeri

texts.es: Rosmeri de 26 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de su madre, con ella y sus dos hermanos. Se dedica a su peluquería, brinda servicio de cortes de cabello, tintes y frisados, en un espacio de su casa que implementó especialmente para este negocio. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace un año y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce mucha gente que acude a ella por su buena labor, además le es rentable porque ya cuenta con una fiel clientela. Para el futuro quiere tener un salón de belleza con todos los servicios, como manicura, pedicura y masajes. Rosmeri ya ha llevado 2 préstamos con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque aprende mucho del asesor de crédito y del resto de integrantes. Con el dinero que solicita comprará un gran espejo y materiales de peluquería, así como también mandara a ampliar un poco más el espacio de su local.
texts.en:
Rosmeri is 26 years old, single, and lives at home with her mother and two sisters. She has a salon, which offers haircuts, color and perms, in a part of her house, which she has set up specifically for this business. She has been doing this for one year, and it is going very well. What she likes about her job is that she meets a lot of people who come to her for her good work. Also, it is profitable because she already has a faithful clientele. In the future, she wants to have an a full-service beauty salon with manicures, pedicures and massages. Rosmeri has had 2 loans from MFP. She likes working with her community bank because she learns a lot from her loan advisor and the other members. With the money that she requests, she will buy a large mirror and salon materials in order to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her business and install necessities for her work

loans.name: Janet Alberta,

texts.es:
Janet siempre ha sentido afición por la fotografía, es por eso que cuando empezó a trabajar vendiendo ropa bajo pedido D. clientes ella se animó a ofrecer el servicio D. fotografía en el colegio D. su  hijo cada vez que había un evento especial.
Poco a poco el gusto por el arte fotográfico fue creciendo así que decidió dedicarse por completo a este oficio. Un tiempo después no solo ofrecía la toma D. fotos, sino también la filmación D. eventos. Ahora ya tiene dos años dedicándose a la filmación D. eventos y fiestas no solo escolares, también D. matrimonios, cumpleaños, etc.
Por otro lado, también venD. productos D. belleza desD. hace cinco años. Las ganancias que obtiene D. su trabajo las vuelve a reinvertir y una fracción la destina para las necesidades D. su menor hija. Su esposo se encarga del mantenimiento D. los además gastos D. la casa.
Más adelante ella desearía tener el capital suficiente para implementar un estudio fotográfico, ya sea en su casa o en otro lugar.
Productos D. belleza
texts.en:
Janet has always had an affinity for photography, which is why when she started selling custom order apparel, she decided to offer photography services at her son’s school whenever there was a special event. Little by little, her love of photography kept growing, so she decided to completely dedicate herself to this skill. After some time, she not only took pictures, but also started offering video services. She has now been videotaping special events—schools, weddings, birthdays, etc.—for two years. She has also been selling beauty products on the siD. for five years. She re-invests some of the profits, saving the other part of her income to pay for her young daughter’s necessities. Her husband covers the rest of the household expenses. She would like to have enough capital to set up her own picture studio—either in her own house or somewhere else—some time in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beauty products

loans.name: Livia,

texts.es:
A sus veintiún años Livia maneja un pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza desde hace un año, con la finalidad de tener un ingreso adicional y poder apoyar en lo gastos de su casa. Livia es soltera y no tiene hijos, por lo que ahora esta enfocada no solo en crecer en su venta de negocio si no también en terminar sus estudios universitarios.
Actualmente, esta cursando el tercer año de su carrera de educación primaria, gracias a estos estudios ha podido obtener un puesto de trabajo en un colegio cerca de su casa. En el futuro ella solo desea dedicarse por completo a su profesión y crecer en la mercadería de su negocio.
Por otro lado, ella integra un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras,  por medio del cual esta recibiendo talleres de bisutería y de bordados.
texts.en:
Twenty-one-year-old Livia has been running a small beauty product business for a year so that she can earn extra income and help out with the household expenses. Livia is single and has no children, which is why she is now focusing not only on making her business grow, but also on finishing her university studies.

She is currently in her third year of her major: primary education. Thanks to her education, she has been able to obtain a job at a school near her house. In the future, she hopes to fully dedicated herself to her career and increase her business’ inventory.

Additionally, she is part of a group of enterprising women, through which she is receiving training in making costume jewelry and embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beauty products

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah O. is fifty-one years old, married and has five children, two of whom are boys and three girls. He says currently, one of them is in the senior high school, another in the junior high school, while the rest are in the primary school. His wife is a trader as well as a farmer. He lives with his family in a rented house at Simpa. Simpa is a small farming community which is a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants combine farming with other economic activities.

Noah is a fitting mechanic by profession. He repairs damaged vehicles in his community. He owns a workshop in which he works. Noah also sells car spare parts in his shop to customers. He wants a loan to buy more spare parts such as driving mirrors, wind screens, head lights, hoods, etc. According to him, he has trained a number of apprentices who have graduated and are running their own shops. Noah has been in business for over twenty years. Noah desires to help his children climb the academic ladder to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Carmen Ernestina,

texts.es:
Carmen se dedica desD. hace tres años aproximadamente a la venta D. piñatas, cotillón y todo lo necesario para decorar una fiesta infantil. Anteriormente, por el tiempo  D. dos años, vendía desayuno en un puesto ambulante en la puerta D. un colegio cercano a su casa.  
La idea D. empezar el negocio D. piñatas nació a raíz D. que su hijo le comentara que el negocio era rentable. Fue así como, entre los dos, alquilaron un puesto en un mercado; sin embargo, después D. un tiempo, el hijo D. Carmen tuvo que dejar D. apoyarla y como el pago del alquiler del local ya no le salía a cuenta ella mudo el negocio a su casa. Hoy solo venD. bajo pedidos a clientes que ya la conocen.
Por otro lado, desD. hace un año recibe diferentes talleres D. bisutería y bordados, estos productos también los venD. para obtener un ingreso adicional en su casa. Junto con su esposo, quien ya esta jubilado, mantiene los gastos del hogar. Solo tienen un hijo a quien mantener.
texts.en:
Carmen has been selling piñatas, party favors, and all kinds of children’s party supplies for approximately three years. Two years prior to that, she used to sell breakfast as a street vendor at the entrance to a school near her house.

She got the idea to start her business after her son told her how profitable it would be. Thus, she and her son rented a stand in the market. However, after some time, her son had to stop giving her support and she was unable to pay the rent for the office space, so she moved the business to her house. She now only handles orders from customers who already know her.

Additionally, she has been selling costume jewelry and embroidered products from home for a year in order to earn extra income. She and her husband, who is now retired, help with the household expenses. They have only one son that they must support financially.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costume jewelry materials

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana O. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, a son and four daughters. According to Susana, two of her children are in junior high school while the rest are in primary school. She says her husband is a cocoa/palm nut farmer. She lives with the family in a house at a small town called Simpa, a farming community which is a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana.
